Mary Wolcott of Windsor CT

2nd daughter of Henry and Elizabeth Wolcott of Windsor CT.

Revised January 2026
These web pages are intended for genealogical research purposes only and may not be used elsewhere without permission, but linking is allowed without need of approval. Questions and additions or corrections may be sent to Eric Wolcott, (ewolcott6 at gmail.com).
(2) Mary Wolcott2 b. ABT 1622 Tolland, Somerset, England, d. 16 SEP 1689 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesMARY came to America with her sister and younger brother about 1635. She and her husband died the same day.
m. 25 JUN 1646 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Job Drake, b. 1619 Wiscombe, Devonshire, England, d. 16 SEP 1689 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesJOB came to America in 1630 with his family on the "Winslow Fleet". He and his wife died on the same day of a disease that caused many deaths at Windsor in 1689 including two of his brothers, one sister in law, and one brother-in-law. His will said "I leave unto my wife the use of my dwelling house & barn. orchard & homelot except that which I give unto my son, Job, with my pasture I bought of Goodman Bissell, the land in the Little Meadow & the 10 acres of land I had of my brother, Christopher, & the inclosed lands...unto my son Job 6 acres of land that I had of my father Drake...my dwelling house, barn orchard and homelot with all my land within the township of Windsor...provided that he record to his son Job that house and that part of the homelott which he now enjoyeth...at 21 years of age...to my daughter Elizabeth the 4 acres of land in the Great Meadow that I bought of Goodman Thrall at my wife's decease. I give to Ephraim Colton 40 shillings and small rapier. I have given to my grchild Israel Dewey 2 young steers as also a chest marked E. D. To my grchild Susanna Packer my land at Greenfield.... I give to Joseph Dewey L4.... I give to my Grandchild Mary Drake that which is due me from my Father Drake's estate also from my brother Joseph's estate, also L4. I give to my grson Joseph Dewey land over the river...which was my father Drake's I give to my grchild Job Colton L5...and a gun. I give to Elizabeth my son Job's wife 50 shillings...the remainder of my estate to be divided amongst my children, that is to Job, Abigail, Elizabeth, and Esther...my son Job Drake to be sole Executor...." SOURCE CITATION: Title: Colonial Families of the United States Source Comments: NS16043
7 children: Abigail, Mary, Job, Elizabeth, Joseph, Hepzibah, Hester "Esther".
(3) Abigail Drake3 (Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 SEP 1648 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 NOV 1696 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 20 AUG 1668 Northampton, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, Israel Dewey, b. 25 SEP 1645 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 OCT 1678 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Hannah, Israel, David, Joseph.
(4) Hannah Dewey4 (Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1680 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. .
m. 1704 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Philip Loomis, b. 22 FEB 1675 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1 DEC 1746 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
12 children: Hannah, Philip, Joel, Elizabeth, Abigail, Mary, Jerusha, Timothy, Margaret, Sarah, Ruth, Prudence.
(5) Hannah Loomis5 (Hannah Dewey4, Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 MAY 1705 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. ,, Connecticut.
m. 25 JUN 1730 ,, Connecticut, Azariah Holcomb, b. 1707 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1771 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
10 children: Benjamin, Abner, Elizabeth, Eldad, Obed, Hannah, Bethia, Mary, Lois, Eunice.

m. Mercy Kendall, b. 18 JAN 1748 Woburn, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts, d. .
1 children: Mehitable.

(8) Jefferson Cooley8 (Philetus Cooley7, Lois Holcomb6, Hannah Loomis5, Hannah Dewey4, Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 SEP 1800 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 DEC 1840 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesJEFFERSON graduated from Yale University and taught school at Granby. He studied law under Jared Griswold of Hartford. In 1836 he became Preceptor of the Poughkeepsie Academy. He was made Principal of the Academy at Sharon, Connecticut, in 1837.

Spouse NotesJohn served in the Revolutionary War in 1775, 1777 and 1779. He was a private until 1779 when he was chosen Chairman of the Committee of Safety and Correspondence in 1779.

(4) David Dewey4 (Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 JAN 1676 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 NOV 1712 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesDAVID was a weaver. He was a member of the Westfield church for 12 years, and was made a deacon in 1712. Several of his spiritual writing were published in a commemerative pamphlet after his death.

(10) George J. Dewey10 (Henry Dewey9, John Dewey8, Timothy Dewey7, David Dewey6, David Dewey5, David Dewey4, Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 AUG 1843 Monterey, Waukesha Co., Wisconsin, d. 10 MAY 1864 Near Spotsylvania,, Virginia.
NotesGeorge enlisted 2 Septebmer 1861, was a Corporal in Company E, 7th Wisconsin Infantry Regiment and was killed 10 May 1864 at the Battle of Laurel Hill during the Civil War. He is buried in Arlington National Cemetery.

(6) Joseph Dewey6 (Charles Dewey5, David Dewey4, Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 MAY 1735 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 1778 , Columbia Co., New York.
m. 29 JAN 1756 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, Deborah Buell, b. 13 SEP 1735 Marlborough, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 JAN 1813 .
11 children: Deborah, Joseph, Mary, Lydia, Anna, Jerusha, Elias, Chester, Sully, Hannah, Marcia.
(7) Deborah Dewey7 (Joseph Dewey6, Charles Dewey5, David Dewey4, Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 AUG 1756 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. APR 1837 Ashtabula, Ashtabula Co., Ohio.
NotesDEBORAH and her husband moved from Lebanon, Connecticut, to Columbia Co., New York, and then Delhi, Delaware Co., New York, in 1776, where eight of their nine children were born and raised. Her husband died from being thrown by a horse, when a spring-lance he carried in his pocket pierced his side. In 1802, Deborah took her four youngest children by ox drawn wagon to Ohio where her son, Abraham, and his wife had settled in 1801. They settled in a log cabin at what is now Austinburg, Ohio, with Indian neighbors. Her biography was printed in the 1915 Wolcott Society annual report.
m. DEC 1774 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, George Webster, b. Of Lebanon, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 1800 , Delaware Co., New York.
9 children: Cynthia, Abraham, Persis, Wealthy, Belinda, George, Polly, Philo, Lewis.

(8) Abraham Webster8 (Deborah Dewey7, Joseph Dewey6, Charles Dewey5, David Dewey4, Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
NotesABRAHAM came to Ohio in 1801, and settled at Geneva, Ohio.

NotesPHILO's mother raised his children after his wife died. His mother continued living in his home after he remarried.

(10) Howard Roy Dewey10 (George Nelson Dewey9, Isaac Anson Dewey8, Isaac Dewey7, Isaac Dewey6, Isaac Dewey5, David Dewey4, Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 JUL 1879 , d. .
(10) Dwight Mortimer Estes Dewey10 (George Nelson Dewey9, Isaac Anson Dewey8, Isaac Dewey7, Isaac Dewey6, Isaac Dewey5, David Dewey4, Abigail Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 MAR 1876 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 NOV 1943 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesDWIGHT was a Captain in the Connecticut Company Governor's Foot Guard. Prior to his death,he was in charge of Hartford Dog Show. He was made a member of The Oder of the Founders and Patriots of America, Society No.306, General No. 1399 on May 27,1925. He was made a member of the Connecticut Society of the Sons of the American Revolution on February 23,1925. National No. 41161, State No. 2676. Dwight is buried in Rose Hill Cemetary in Rocky Hill,CT in Section 8.

(6) Esther Hoar6 (Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 APR 1742 Brimfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 13 MAY 1818 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
m. 23 JUL 1768 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Simeon Keep, b. 27 FEB 1737 Brimfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 22 JUL 1829 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesSIMEON was a Lieutenant in Capt. James Sherman's Co., Col. Ebenezer Larned's Regt., Massachusetts militia, and in Capt. Reuben Munn's Co., 1st Regt., Hampshire County militia. He was in Capt. Aaron Charles' Co., Lt. Col. Timothy Robinson's Regt., Hampshire Co., militia at Ticonderoga, 24 February 1777. He lived in the part of Brimfield which later became Monson.
9 children: Seth, Simeon, Roxana, Abigail, Esther, Lettice, Joseph, Ethan, Warham.
(7) Seth Keep7 (Esther Hoar6, Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 MAY 1771 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 JUN 1857 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesSeth removed to Vermont, after marriage, and in 1801 moved to Homer, New York. He was a farmer, as were all his sons. He was for many years a member of the Congregational church.

NotesGLENN graduated from the School of Mines at the Univeristy of Utah as a Mining Metallurgical and Chemical Engineer. In 1925 he was with Cerro de Pasco Copper Corporation and was building a plant at the 14,000 level in the Andes Mountains of Peru.

(9) Edward Purington Keep9 (Ethan Keep8, Simeon Keep7, Esther Hoar6, Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 JUN 1833 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1900 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesEDWARD and his sister, Mary, were raised by his aunt and uncle, Limira Keep Chapin and Marcus Chapin. He and Mary were the heirs of Marcus, whose children predeceased him. He was given Marcus' 100 acre dairy farm. Edward donated $40,000 to obtain the Tiffany glass windows for the First Congregational Church in Monson, Massachusetts, where he was a deacon.
m. 30 NOV 1858 Mary E. Grout, b. , d. .
5 children: Sarah Marie, Jennie Elizabeth, Charles Chapin, George Edward, Mary Esther.

m. Lydia Hubbard, b. , d. .
(8) Lamira Goodell Keep8 (Simeon Keep7, Esther Hoar6, Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 JAN 1805 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 15 NOV 1873 .
NotesLAMIRA and her husband purchased a home in 1854. It became a dairy farm, and had several small rock quarries. In 1856, Marcus conveyed the home to his nephew, Edward Keep, as his own children had all predeceased him. Marcus' estate was divided between his nephew and neice, Edward and Mary Keep, who he had raised. The home is now the Keep Homestead Museum.
m. 20 JAN 1830 Marcus Chapin, b. , d. .
1 children: Jane Elizabeth.
(9) Jane Elizabeth Chapin9 (Lamira Goodell Keep8, Simeon Keep7, Esther Hoar6, Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. DEC 1830 , d. JAN 1831 .
(8) Diantha Keep8 (Simeon Keep7, Esther Hoar6, Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 OCT 1807 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1 MAR 1884 .

NotesCHARLES was mustered in as Corporal of Company E, 36th Massachusetts Regiment, 17 July 1862 and died of dysentery at Crab Orchard, Kentucky during the Civil War.

m. 1804 David Wood, b. 5 FEB 1765 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 7 SEP 1851 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDAVID's father served with his father-in-law in Reuben Munn's Company. David was a farmer at Winfield, New York.
7 children: Persis, Hiram, Leander, Alonzo, Jackson, Abigail, Simeon.
(8) Persis Wood8 (Abigail Keep7, Esther Hoar6, Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 MAY 1805 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 22 JUN 1890 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York.
m. 1822 William King, b. 9 NOV 1796 Pawlet, Rutland Co., Vermont, d. 3 SEP 1868 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York.
Spouse NotesWilliam was a Captain in the Calvary. He was a teamster, hauling freight between Albany and Buffalo, New York until the Erie Canal put him out of business.
11 children: Parmelia, William, Esther, Walter C., David Wood, Alonzo W., Almira, Chauncy, Henry H., Franklin, Harriet C..
(9) Parmelia King9 (Persis Wood8, Abigail Keep7, Esther Hoar6, Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JAN 1823 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 22 JUN 1906 Hudran,, Massachusetts.
NotesHer name may have been Parmille or Pamela.

m. 14 JUL 1847 Ephraim Parker, b. , d. .
(9) Walter C. King9 (Persis Wood8, Abigail Keep7, Esther Hoar6, Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 AUG 1828 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 11 AUG 1905 Grand Island, Hall Co., Nebraska.
m. 12 SEP 1863 Margaret Elizabeth Range, b. , d. .
(9) David Wood King9 (Persis Wood8, Abigail Keep7, Esther Hoar6, Deborah Colton5, Ephraim Colton4, Mary Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 AUG 1830 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 26 JAN 1921 Algona, Kossuth Co., Iowa.
NotesDAVID picked corn for Dr. Brooks in Des Moines, Iowa, in the fall of 1854. He then drove a yoke of oxen from Des Moines to Algona, Iowa, for Ambrose Call. He was one of the first settlers in Kossuth Co., Iowa, a farmer and railroad worker. He was on the members of the first Board of Supervisors for Kossuth Co.
m. 6 DEC 1860 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, Anne Lydia "Lyddie" Hall, b. 10 AUG 1834 New York Mills, Oneida Co., New York, d. 16 SEP 1926 Algona, Kossuth Co., Iowa.
8 children: William Hall, Belle Persis, Ulysses Grant, David Phineas, Lydia May, Arthur Alonzo, Walter Samuel, Fred Menzo.

NotesBELLE died the day after her twin daughters were born.

NotesSAMUEL changed his name to Hobart.
m. 1808 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, Rhoda Chamberlain, b. 7 MAR 1785 Dudley, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 JUN 1878 Jamestown, Chautauqua Co., New York.
1 children: Jacob Chamberlain.

m. 1 MAY 1800 Moses Keep, b. 25 SEP 1747 Brimfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 NOV 1825 Leverett, Franklin Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesMOSES enlisted 25 June 1779 as a Private in Capt. Joshua L.Woodbridge's Company, Col. Natha Tyler's Regt., and served until 25 December 1779. This company served in Rhode Island. Moses and his wife, Marah, were 1st cousins,
3 children: Salome, Flavia, Mary.

NotesSTEPHEN served in Capt. Abel King's Co., Col. Sear's Regt. at Saratoga, from 20 August 1781 to 20 November 1781. He was placed on the pension roll 13 April 1830.

m. Anna , b. , d. .
(4) Sarah Drake4 (Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 MAY 1686 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 JAN 1747 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 3 DEC 1702 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Roger Wolcott, b. 4 JAN 1679 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 MAY 1767 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesROGER said that he never attended school in his life, but was taught at home by his mother. At the age of 12 he was apprenticed to a weaver. On reaching adulthood he educated himself by reading, and was admitted to the Bar. He built a home at East Windsor in 1704. Roger was chosen a Selectman of Windsor in 1707, a Representative to the Connecticut General Assembly in 1709, and a member of the Bench of Justices in 1710. He was in charge of the Connecticut commissary supplies in an expedition to Canada in 1711, during Queen Anne's War. In 1714 he was appointed to the Governor's Council. In 1724 he was appointed Judge of the County Court and in 1732 Judge of the Superior Court. He built a ferry across the Connecticut River in 1735, which he sold to the town of Windsor in 1736. In 1741 he became Deputy Governor and Chief Justice of the Connecticut Supreme Court. He was presiding judge in a trial at Winham, where Betty Shaw was convicted of infanticide and hung. Roger was appointed Major General, in command of the Connecticut troops that were part of the expeditions to Cape Breton and the siege of Louisburg in 1745. He was second in command under Sir William Pepperill. In 1750 he was elected Governor of Connecticut, serving until 1754. Roger fell from public favor due to a Spanish merchant's claim for damages when his ship was detained, for which the Assembly blamed the Governor, and so he was defeated for re-election. Roger was granted the right to operate a ferry boat on the Connecticut River near South Windsor. It is said that he became wealthy through land speculation. In 1720, he and seven others purchased 10,000 acres of land in Vermont from the Colony of Connecticut. They sold this land to settlers. While he was Governor, he was accused of encouraging the Susquehanna Company, a group of Connecticut investors who sold to settlers land in Northern Pennsylvania that Connecticut and Pennsylvania both claimed. Roger's son, Oliver, was a member of this company. It was later determined that neither Connecticut or the Susquehanna Company had a legal right to this land. Roger retired from public life, retiring to farming and literary pursuits. He published at least three of his writings, one being "Poetical Meditations, Being the Improvement of Some Vacant Hours", printed in 1725, said to have been the first book of poetry printed in the colonies. The second was an ecclesiastical tract about the history and liberties of the Congregational church, printed in 1761. The third was "A Letter to the Freemen of Connecticut", which appeared in the "Connecticut Gazette" in 1761. A pair of silver cups he presented to the Congregational Church at East Windsor have "R W 1756 engraved on them. His estate was valued at 1,805L. Among the bequests in his will were a silver tankard and cup left to his sons Erastus and Oliver Wolcott. Erastus bequeathed the tankard to his son, Erastus. They have the arms of the Shropshire family of Walcott engraved on them. Samuel Wolcott, the author of "The Wolcott Memorial", had the tankard in his possession in 1879. Roger's will also left land at Tolland, Connecticut, and a seal, ring, and a gun to his son, Alexander; land at Podunk, a silver sword, gold buttons, and a gun to his son, Josiah; his home at Windsor and a ferry boat to his son, Erastus; land at Litchfield, Hartford, Colebrook, and Wimdsor and a cannister to his son, Oliver; land at Windsor to be divided between his sons, Alexander, Erastus and Oliver; a watch to his son, Alexander; land at Windsor and Podunk to his grandsons, Roger and Epaphras; 130L to his grandson, Parmenio; land at Windsor, Bolton, and Wellington to his daughter, Maryanne; 15L to his daughter, Ursula; and the balance to be divided among his children. Gravestone reads: "Here lyeth the body of the Hon. Roger Wolcott, Esq., of Windsor, who for serveal years was Governor of the Colony of Connecticut died May 17th, Anno tatis 89, Salutis 1767. Births highest station end in here he lies And dust to dust coneludes her noblest song."
15 children: Roger, Elizabeth, Alexander, Samuel, Alexander, Sarah, Sarah, Hepzibah, Josiah, Erastus, Epaphras, Erastus, Ursula, Oliver, Mariann.
(5) Roger Wolcott5 (Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 SEP 1704 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 10 OCT 1759 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER lived in South Windsor, his property adjoining that of his uncle, Henry. He was a Representative for Windsor at the General Assembly, a Major in the Connecticut militia, a member of the Council, and Judge of the Hartford County Court and the Superior Court of Connecticut. Roger was one of those appointed to revise the laws of the Connecticut Colony, and was one of three commissioners appointed by the Colony of Connecticut to meet at Albany in 1745 with representatives of other colonies, to discuss a plan for union. He was one of the subscribers to the Susquehanna Land Company in 1753.
m. 10 OCT 1728 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Mary "Mara" Newberry, b. 3 FEB 1710 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JUN 1758 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
11 children: Roger, Marah, Roger, Sarah, Roger, Epaphras, Mary, Emeline, Parmenio, Amelia, Martha.
(6) Roger Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 SEP 1729 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 NOV 1729 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Marah Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 OCT 1730 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 AUG 1737 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Roger Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 JUN 1733 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 NOV 1736 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Sarah Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 JUN 1735 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 APR 1812 .
m. 26 APR 1758 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Elisha Steele, b. 7 OCT 1728 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 17 AUG 1773 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesELISHA graduated from Yale College in 1750, and was the first lawyer in Tolland, Connecticut. He was a justice of the peace and elected to the state legislature six times. His marriage was also recorded at Tolland.
6 children: Sarah, Mary, Mary Ann, Elisha, Roger, Mehitable.
(7) Sarah Steele7 (Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 APR 1759 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 15 JUL 1790 .
m. 9 DEC 1779 Justus Reed, b. 17 OCT 1760 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. OCT 1864 .
1 children: Sarah.
(8) Sarah Reed8 (Sarah Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 OCT 1785 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 MAR 1846 .
m. Phineas Blodgett, b. 2 NOV 1783 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 APR 1842 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
5 children: Sarah Maria "Mary", Elizabeth May, Abigail Reed, Phineas Lafayette, Lavellette Clayton,
(9) Sarah Maria "Mary" Blodgett9 (Sarah Reed8, Sarah Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 MAY 1810 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 JUN 1897 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 6 JAN 1831 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, John Terry Thompson, b. 10 APR 1805 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 FEB 1894 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
2 children: Lucius Edward, Charles Edward.
(10) Lucius Edward Thompson10 (Sarah Maria "Mary" Blodgett9, Sarah Reed8, Sarah Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 DEC 1831 Rockville, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. .
(10) Charles Edward Thompson10 (Sarah Maria "Mary" Blodgett9, Sarah Reed8, Sarah Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 FEB 1847 Rockville, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 25 SEP 1924 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesCHARLES moved to Hartford in 1863. He enlisted in the Hartford National Guard in 1865. In 1876 he was employed in the financial department of the Connecticut Life Insurance Co., and worked there until 1921. Charles was appointed 1st Lt. of Co. K, of the National Guard in 1879, and became Capt. of that unit in 1883. He was appointed commanding officer of the First Regiment of the Connecticut National Guard in 1885 and served in that office until 1890. He served as President of the Hartford YMCA and the Hartford Missionary Society, and was a deacon in the Congregational Church. He was also Governor of the Mayflower Society for Connecticut. He was a member of the Wolcott Society 1909-16, and Chairman of the Executive Committee in 1916.
(9) Elizabeth May Blodgett9 (Sarah Reed8, Sarah Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 MAR 1815 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .

m. MAY 1860 Loraine Bradish, b. , d. 29 MAY 1891 .
(7) Mary Steele7 (Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 MAY 1761 , d. .
(7) Mary Ann Steele7 (Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 APR 1763 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 26 OCT 1853 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
m. ABT 1782 Roger Wolcott, b. 25 MAY 1760 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 19 DEC 1799 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesROGER was at East Windsor in 1790 with 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, 2 females, and 1 free Negro. His widow and her three daughters moved from Bridgewater, Connecticut, to Evans Mills, New York, after his death. The widow and her unmarried daughter, Polly, lived with her daughter, Sarah Wolcott Rogers, at LeRoy, New York.
9 children: , Mary Ann "Mariann", Mehitable, Mehitable, Oliver, Mary, Martha Burnham, Sarah Steele "Sally", Mary "Polly".
(8) Wolcott8 (Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 APR 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8 (Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 NOV 1784 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 16 NOV 1858 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. 12 NOV 1801 Warren Samuel Stuart, b. 14 NOV 1781 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 FEB 1828 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
Spouse NotesWARREN was in the 1985 Wolcott genealogy book as Samuel Warren Stuart.
9 children: Esther, Maria, Amelia, Adaline, Elisha S., Martha, Roger Wolcott, William Henry, Samuel Mott.
(9) Esther Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 OCT 1802 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 18 DEC 1889 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
m. 13 JUN 1822 Asahel "Asel" Rogers, b. 1 APR 1800 Bridgewater, Oneida Co., New York, d. 26 MAY 1884 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
Spouse NotesASEL Rogers was a farmer at Philadelphia, New York, in 1850, with all his know children living with him. Asahel was a farmer at Philadelphia, New York, in 1880, with wife Esther, living next door to Charles Rogers.
12 children: Warren, Esther, Asel, Samuel, Betsy, Elisha, William, Mary Ann, Charles, Amelia, Henry, Cornelia.
(10) Warren Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1823 , d. .

(10) Asel Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAR 1826 LeRay, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 23 MAY 1888 Colon, St. Joseph Co., Michigan.
NotesASEL was a shoemaker at Colon, Michigan, in 1880, with Mercy E., Sylvester, Eber, and Susie B. Rogers.
(10) Samuel Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1829 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. .
(10) Betsy Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1829 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 27 NOV 1863 .
(10) Elisha Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1831 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. .
NotesELISHA was a stone mason at Philadelphia, New York, in 1880.
(10) William Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 SEP 1833 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. .
(10) Mary Ann Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 APR 1836 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 27 FEB 1874 .
(10) Charles Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 SEP 1838 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. .
(10) Amelia Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 MAR 1841 , d. .
(10) Henry Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 JUL 1843 , d. 28 APR 1862 .
(10) Cornelia Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 DEC 1845 , d. 28 JAN 1905 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
(9) Maria Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 DEC 1804 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 25 DEC 1885 .
m. 23 JUN 1833 Charles A. Haviland, b. ABT 1809 ,, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesCHARLES is found in the Hamburg, Erie Co., New York 1850 census: Charles A. Haveland, 41, clothier: Maieah, 47, Charles E., 14; Sarah E., 6; and Mariam Stuart, 64 born in Connecticut. The others all born in New York. This census taken 4 August 1850. Living next door is her brother Elisha and family. There is also a Charles A. Haviland, 40 born in New York in the Butte Co., Californian 1850 censes. He is a miner. This census taken 23 Sept 1850. Did he try to strike it rich as many other did? He is found in the Hamburg, Erie Co., New York 1860 census: Charles A. Haviland, 50; Mariah, 53 and Amelia 16. All born in New York. They are found in the Bangor, Bay Co., Michigan 1870 census: Haviland, Chas, 58, clerk in store; Maria, 56. They are living with their daughters family: Cadwell, William, 34, Amelia, 24, and Annie, 1. All born in New York but William, born in Michigan. The are found in the Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois 1880 census still living with their daughters family: Cadwell, William H., 43, retail grocer born in Michigan; Amelia, 36, NY; Annie, 10, NY; Lillian, 9, MI; Haviland, Charles A., father, 71, NY; and Maria, mother, 73, NY.
2 children: Charles Elisha, Amelia.
(10) Charles Elisha Haviland10 (Maria Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 SEP 1835 ,, New York, d. 13 MAR 1887 Hamburg, Erie Co., New York.
NotesCHARLES Was at Hamburg, New York, in 1860 with wife Mary Ann and daughter Anna.

He served in the Civil War.

Its interesting that she has a grave stone in both Dexter, Michigan and Hamburg, New York. What's even stranger is that the stone in NY is a double stone with both "Annie" and C E on it. This is strange because Charles Elisha Haviland remarried and had children with his second wife yet he or someone who outlived him chose to put his first wife on the stone with him. I have talked with the sexton of the cemetery in Hamburg.
I told him Annie also has a grave marked in Michigan. He said this cemetery didn't open until 1878 so its entirely possible her name is just on the stone, that there is no body there. He said on the backside of the lot where this stone rests is the Frinks, W. Henry and Anna liza !! Charles Elisha's second wife was the daughter of W. Henry and Anna Liza Frink.
(10) Amelia Haviland10 (Maria Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1844 ,, New York, d. .
(9) Amelia Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 FEB 1807 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 DEC 1887 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. 5 NOV 1829 Marvin Cadwell, b. 9 SEP 1800 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 27 OCT 1860 .
Spouse NotesMARVIN is found in the Webster, Washtenaw Co. Michigan 1850 census: Marvin Cadwell, 50, farmer born in Connecticut; Amelia, 43, NY; Marvin, 20, NY; Jason, 18, MI; Charles, 16, MI; William, 14, MI; Emeline, 12, MI; Mary Ann, 8, MI; Geo W., 6, MI; and Warren, 3, MI. They are still there in the 1860 census: Marvin Cadwell, 59, farmer born in Connecticut; Amelia, 54, NY; George 16, MI; Warren, 14, MI and Ella, 10, MI. Living next to them is their son Jason, 28, MI and with wife Elen, 21, NY.
10 children: Marvin Stuart, Jason Russell, Charles, William H., Emeline A., Mary Ann, George W., Warren Wolcott, Ella J., Olive.
(10) Marvin Stuart Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 JUL 1830 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 19 JAN 1900 Detroit, Wayne Co., Michigan.
NotesMARVIN was a retired merchant at Lansing, Michigan, in 1880, with wife, Mary.
(10) Jason Russell Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 JUN 1832 Lima, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 10 JAN 1904 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
(10) Charles Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 AUG 1834 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 17 APR 1857 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
(10) William H. Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JUN 1836 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 29 DEC 1910 Williamston, Ingham Co., Michigan.
NotesWILLIAM is found in the Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois 1880 census: Cadwell, William H., 43 year old retail grocer born in Michigan; Amelia, 36, NY; Annie, 10, NY; Lillian, 9, NY; Haviland, Charles A., father, 71, NY; and Maria, mother, 68, NY.
(10) Emeline A. Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 FEB 1838 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 1911 .

NotesGEORGE was killed while serving during the Civil War.
(10) Warren Wolcott Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 DEC 1846 Webster, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 23 OCT 1895 Bronx, Bronx Co., New York.
NotesWARREN and Laura were married by his uncle, Rev. Jason Cadwell. He was an auctioneer at Chicago, Illinois, in 1880, with Laura, Maud L., and Elizabeth E. Cadwell.
(10) Ella J. Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 SEP 1851 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 28 AUG 1897 Lansing, Ingham Co., Michigan.

(9) Adaline Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUL 1809 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 MAR 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesADELINE Haviland purchased land at Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in 1837.
m. 21 JUL 1829 Russell Cadwell, b. ABT 1802 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
1 children: Russell Marvin.
(10) Russell Marvin Cadwell10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1832 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. MAY 1899 .
NotesRUSSELL is found in the Iosco Township, Livingston Co., Michigan 1860: Russell M. Cadwell, 28, farmer born in New York; Harriet E., 24, NY; Ard R., 2, MI; and Geroge D. 1/12. MI. They are living next to his mother and father-in-law.
He is found in the Bath Township, Clinton Co., Michigan 1870 census: Cadwell, Russell M. 38, Railroad Agent born in New York; Harriet, 33, NY; Ard, 12, MI; George, 10, MI; and William, 5, MI. They are found on the same census page has her parents and sister, Martha.
They are found in the Meridan Township, Ingham Co., Michigan 1880 census: Cadwell, Russell M., 47, farmer; Harriet E., 44; George A., 20; and William J., 15.
(9) Adaline Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUL 1809 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 MAR 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesADELINE Haviland purchased land at Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in 1837.
m. 1835 Lewis Jay Haviland, b. 1807 ,, New York, d. 4 JAN 1893 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
Spouse NotesLEWIS was at Iosco Township, Michigan, in 1850. He was a farmer at Iosco, Michigan, in 1880, with Adeline and Samuel E. Haviland. L. J. and Jacob Haviland were land owners at Iosco in 1844, and Charles A. Haviland in 1848. Delos M. Haviland, 20, of Iosco and Lewis A Haviland , 24, of Livingston Co., Michigan, enlisted in Co. K, 4th Michigan Inf. Regt., in the Civil War. L. J. and W. H. Haviland had land at Iosco in 1875.
8 children: Lewis Alanson "Alonzo", Samuel E., Wolcott Stuart, Delos M., Charles J., Sarah M., Adaline Amelia, William Warren.
(10) Lewis Alanson "Alonzo" Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 MAR 1837 ,, Michigan, d. 21 DEC 1913 , Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesLEWIS enlisted with his brother, Delos, 20 June 1861 in the Livingston County, Michigan, "Old Fourth Infantry", and was dischargedEWor disability 15 Jan. 1863. He is found in the Leslie, Ingham Co., Michigan 1880 census: Haviland, Alanson, 39, and Etta, 14. In some record is name is given as Louis.
(10) Samuel E. Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. NOV 1850 , Livingston Co., Michigan, d. 2 AUG 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
(10) Wolcott Stuart Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 FEB 1839 Plainfield, Livingston Co., Michigan, d. 4 APR 1904 Iosco Township, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesWOLCOTT was a farmer and taught school.
(10) Delos M. Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1840 ,, Michigan, d. 27 JUN 1862 , Hanover Co., Virginia.
NotesDELOS enlisted 20 June 1861 in the Livingston County, Michigan, "Old Fourth Infantry". He was killed at the Battle of Gaines Mill, also known as the Battle of Chickahomony.
(10) Charles J. Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1843 ,, Michigan, d. .

m. MAR 1833 Minerva Hunn, b. 1814 , d. 30 JUN 1901 .

(10) Amanda Stuart10 (Elisha S. Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1842 , d. 1909 .
(10) Mary Stuart10 (Elisha S. Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1845 , d. 1914 .
(10) Parson H. Stuart10 (Elisha S. Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1848 , d. 1916 .
(9) Martha Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUN 1814 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 17 FEB 1815 , Jefferson Co., New York.
(9) Roger Wolcott Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 MAR 1818 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 5 JAN 1847 .
m. 15 JAN 1845 Lorinda Prenille, b. , d. .
(9) William Henry Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 27 JAN 1842 Lyme, Jefferson Co., New York, Barbara Allen, b. 2 OCT 1822 , d. 14 SEP 1861 .
5 children: Eben A. "Ahaz", Alice E., Cora V., Glenn D., Maude.
(10) Eben A. "Ahaz" Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 OCT 1842 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. 1 OCT 1858 , Cattaraugus Co., New York.
(10) Alice E. Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1846 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(10) Cora V. Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1848 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(10) Glenn D. Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1859 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(10) Maude Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1861 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. 2 FEB 1881 , Cattaraugus Co., New York.
(9) William Henry Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Mary Ann Steele7, Sarah Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 1 JUL 1863 Jane Popple, b. , d. .

m. Daniel Converse, b. 17 SEP 1791 , d. 2 MAR 1873 Crittenden, Erie Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDANIEL was a farmer. He moved to Erie Co., New York, about 1836, and to Chili, New York, about 1840. About 1860, he sold his farm and returned to Jefferson Co., New York.

m. 3 JUL 1846 Chili, Monroe Co., New York, Henry Wedd, b. 15 SEP 1821 Latchingdon, Essex Co., England, d. .
Spouse NotesHENRY was a farmer. He moved his family to Kansas City, Missouri in 1858. In 1863 he bought 160 acres of land from the Indians, 16 miles from Kansas City. He later owned 660 acres.

Spouse NotesWILLIAM and his wife, Sarah, came to Evans Mills and owned 500 acres on which they built a stone house that was still standing in 1953.

(6) Sarah Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 JUN 1735 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 APR 1812 .
m. AFT 1773 Elijah Chapman, b. , d. .
(6) Roger Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 NOV 1737 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 JAN 1798 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER marched to Boston at the Lexington alarm as an Ensign and standard bearer in Capt. Amasa Loomis' Co.. He was a member of the Executive Committee of the Susquahanna Company, a land developmeny company formed to market land in the Wyoming Valley of Pennsylvania. In 1790 his family consisted of 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, 3 females, and 1 free Negro at East Windsor, Connecticut.
m. ABT 1755 Dorcas Burnham, b. 15 MAY 1737 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 NOV 1823 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
13 children: Martha, Roger, Abner, Jemima, Cornelius, Hannah, Abigail, Seth, Amelia, Emelia, Oliver, , Rhoda.
(7) Martha Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 OCT 1757 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 APR 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 1777 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Samuel Treat, b. 6 JUL 1752 Wethersfield, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 APR 1795 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesSAMUEL was a sheriff.
1 children: Martha Wolcott "Patty".

m. David McKinney, b. 1 SEP 1779 , d. 6 DEC 1853 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.

NotesEDWARD "died from injuries received while in discharge of his duties as conductor on the New York & New Haven Railroad."

(10) Maria Louise Douglas10 (Jerusha McKinney9, Martha Wolcott "Patty" Treat8, Martha Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1851 , d. 1904 .
(9) Maria Louisa McKinney9 (Martha Wolcott "Patty" Treat8, Martha Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1823 , d. 1883 .
m. Hosea Douglas, b. 14 NOV 1823 , d. 1884 .
(7) Roger Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 MAY 1760 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 19 DEC 1799 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER was at East Windsor in 1790 with 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, 2 females, and 1 free Negro. His widow and her three daughters moved from Bridgewater, Connecticut, to Evans Mills, New York, after his death. The widow and her unmarried daughter, Polly, lived with her daughter, Sarah Wolcott Rogers, at LeRoy, New York.
m. ABT 1782 Mary Ann Steele, b. 28 APR 1763 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 26 OCT 1853 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
9 children: , Mary Ann "Mariann", Mehitable, Mehitable, Oliver, Mary, Martha Burnham, Sarah Steele "Sally", Mary "Polly".
(8) Wolcott8 (Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 APR 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8 (Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 NOV 1784 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 16 NOV 1858 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. 12 NOV 1801 Warren Samuel Stuart, b. 14 NOV 1781 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 FEB 1828 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
Spouse NotesWARREN was in the 1985 Wolcott genealogy book as Samuel Warren Stuart.
9 children: Esther, Maria, Amelia, Adaline, Elisha S., Martha, Roger Wolcott, William Henry, Samuel Mott.
(9) Esther Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 OCT 1802 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 18 DEC 1889 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
m. 13 JUN 1822 Asahel "Asel" Rogers, b. 1 APR 1800 Bridgewater, Oneida Co., New York, d. 26 MAY 1884 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
Spouse NotesASEL Rogers was a farmer at Philadelphia, New York, in 1850, with all his know children living with him. Asahel was a farmer at Philadelphia, New York, in 1880, with wife Esther, living next door to Charles Rogers.
12 children: Warren, Esther, Asel, Samuel, Betsy, Elisha, William, Mary Ann, Charles, Amelia, Henry, Cornelia.
(10) Warren Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1823 , d. .

(10) Asel Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAR 1826 LeRay, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 23 MAY 1888 Colon, St. Joseph Co., Michigan.
NotesASEL was a shoemaker at Colon, Michigan, in 1880, with Mercy E., Sylvester, Eber, and Susie B. Rogers.

NotesELISHA was a stone mason at Philadelphia, New York, in 1880.

(10) Charles Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 SEP 1838 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. .

(10) Cornelia Rogers10 (Esther Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 DEC 1845 , d. 28 JAN 1905 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
(9) Maria Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 DEC 1804 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 25 DEC 1885 .
m. 23 JUN 1833 Charles A. Haviland, b. ABT 1809 ,, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesCHARLES is found in the Hamburg, Erie Co., New York 1850 census: Charles A. Haveland, 41, clothier: Maieah, 47, Charles E., 14; Sarah E., 6; and Mariam Stuart, 64 born in Connecticut. The others all born in New York. This census taken 4 August 1850. Living next door is her brother Elisha and family. There is also a Charles A. Haviland, 40 born in New York in the Butte Co., Californian 1850 censes. He is a miner. This census taken 23 Sept 1850. Did he try to strike it rich as many other did? He is found in the Hamburg, Erie Co., New York 1860 census: Charles A. Haviland, 50; Mariah, 53 and Amelia 16. All born in New York. They are found in the Bangor, Bay Co., Michigan 1870 census: Haviland, Chas, 58, clerk in store; Maria, 56. They are living with their daughters family: Cadwell, William, 34, Amelia, 24, and Annie, 1. All born in New York but William, born in Michigan. The are found in the Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois 1880 census still living with their daughters family: Cadwell, William H., 43, retail grocer born in Michigan; Amelia, 36, NY; Annie, 10, NY; Lillian, 9, MI; Haviland, Charles A., father, 71, NY; and Maria, mother, 73, NY.
2 children: Charles Elisha, Amelia.
(10) Charles Elisha Haviland10 (Maria Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 SEP 1835 ,, New York, d. 13 MAR 1887 Hamburg, Erie Co., New York.
NotesCHARLES Was at Hamburg, New York, in 1860 with wife Mary Ann and daughter Anna.

He served in the Civil War.

Its interesting that she has a grave stone in both Dexter, Michigan and Hamburg, New York. What's even stranger is that the stone in NY is a double stone with both "Annie" and C E on it. This is strange because Charles Elisha Haviland remarried and had children with his second wife yet he or someone who outlived him chose to put his first wife on the stone with him. I have talked with the sexton of the cemetery in Hamburg.
I told him Annie also has a grave marked in Michigan. He said this cemetery didn't open until 1878 so its entirely possible her name is just on the stone, that there is no body there. He said on the backside of the lot where this stone rests is the Frinks, W. Henry and Anna liza !! Charles Elisha's second wife was the daughter of W. Henry and Anna Liza Frink.
(10) Amelia Haviland10 (Maria Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1844 ,, New York, d. .
(9) Amelia Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 FEB 1807 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 DEC 1887 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. 5 NOV 1829 Marvin Cadwell, b. 9 SEP 1800 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 27 OCT 1860 .
Spouse NotesMARVIN is found in the Webster, Washtenaw Co. Michigan 1850 census: Marvin Cadwell, 50, farmer born in Connecticut; Amelia, 43, NY; Marvin, 20, NY; Jason, 18, MI; Charles, 16, MI; William, 14, MI; Emeline, 12, MI; Mary Ann, 8, MI; Geo W., 6, MI; and Warren, 3, MI. They are still there in the 1860 census: Marvin Cadwell, 59, farmer born in Connecticut; Amelia, 54, NY; George 16, MI; Warren, 14, MI and Ella, 10, MI. Living next to them is their son Jason, 28, MI and with wife Elen, 21, NY.
10 children: Marvin Stuart, Jason Russell, Charles, William H., Emeline A., Mary Ann, George W., Warren Wolcott, Ella J., Olive.
(10) Marvin Stuart Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 JUL 1830 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 19 JAN 1900 Detroit, Wayne Co., Michigan.
NotesMARVIN was a retired merchant at Lansing, Michigan, in 1880, with wife, Mary.
(10) Jason Russell Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 JUN 1832 Lima, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 10 JAN 1904 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
(10) Charles Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 AUG 1834 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 17 APR 1857 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
(10) William H. Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JUN 1836 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 29 DEC 1910 Williamston, Ingham Co., Michigan.
NotesWILLIAM is found in the Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois 1880 census: Cadwell, William H., 43 year old retail grocer born in Michigan; Amelia, 36, NY; Annie, 10, NY; Lillian, 9, NY; Haviland, Charles A., father, 71, NY; and Maria, mother, 68, NY.
(10) Emeline A. Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 FEB 1838 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 1911 .

NotesGEORGE was killed while serving during the Civil War.
(10) Warren Wolcott Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 DEC 1846 Webster, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 23 OCT 1895 Bronx, Bronx Co., New York.
NotesWARREN and Laura were married by his uncle, Rev. Jason Cadwell. He was an auctioneer at Chicago, Illinois, in 1880, with Laura, Maud L., and Elizabeth E. Cadwell.
(10) Ella J. Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 SEP 1851 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 28 AUG 1897 Lansing, Ingham Co., Michigan.
(10) Olive Cadwell10 (Amelia Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1856 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 27 JAN 1861 .
(9) Adaline Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUL 1809 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 MAR 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesADELINE Haviland purchased land at Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in 1837.
m. 21 JUL 1829 Russell Cadwell, b. ABT 1802 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
1 children: Russell Marvin.
(10) Russell Marvin Cadwell10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1832 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. MAY 1899 .
NotesRUSSELL is found in the Iosco Township, Livingston Co., Michigan 1860: Russell M. Cadwell, 28, farmer born in New York; Harriet E., 24, NY; Ard R., 2, MI; and Geroge D. 1/12. MI. They are living next to his mother and father-in-law.
He is found in the Bath Township, Clinton Co., Michigan 1870 census: Cadwell, Russell M. 38, Railroad Agent born in New York; Harriet, 33, NY; Ard, 12, MI; George, 10, MI; and William, 5, MI. They are found on the same census page has her parents and sister, Martha.
They are found in the Meridan Township, Ingham Co., Michigan 1880 census: Cadwell, Russell M., 47, farmer; Harriet E., 44; George A., 20; and William J., 15.
(9) Adaline Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUL 1809 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 MAR 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesADELINE Haviland purchased land at Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in 1837.
m. 1835 Lewis Jay Haviland, b. 1807 ,, New York, d. 4 JAN 1893 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
Spouse NotesLEWIS was at Iosco Township, Michigan, in 1850. He was a farmer at Iosco, Michigan, in 1880, with Adeline and Samuel E. Haviland. L. J. and Jacob Haviland were land owners at Iosco in 1844, and Charles A. Haviland in 1848. Delos M. Haviland, 20, of Iosco and Lewis A Haviland , 24, of Livingston Co., Michigan, enlisted in Co. K, 4th Michigan Inf. Regt., in the Civil War. L. J. and W. H. Haviland had land at Iosco in 1875.
8 children: Lewis Alanson "Alonzo", Samuel E., Wolcott Stuart, Delos M., Charles J., Sarah M., Adaline Amelia, William Warren.
(10) Lewis Alanson "Alonzo" Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 MAR 1837 ,, Michigan, d. 21 DEC 1913 , Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesLEWIS enlisted with his brother, Delos, 20 June 1861 in the Livingston County, Michigan, "Old Fourth Infantry", and was dischargedEWor disability 15 Jan. 1863. He is found in the Leslie, Ingham Co., Michigan 1880 census: Haviland, Alanson, 39, and Etta, 14. In some record is name is given as Louis.
(10) Samuel E. Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. NOV 1850 , Livingston Co., Michigan, d. 2 AUG 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
(10) Wolcott Stuart Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 FEB 1839 Plainfield, Livingston Co., Michigan, d. 4 APR 1904 Iosco Township, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesWOLCOTT was a farmer and taught school.
(10) Delos M. Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1840 ,, Michigan, d. 27 JUN 1862 , Hanover Co., Virginia.
NotesDELOS enlisted 20 June 1861 in the Livingston County, Michigan, "Old Fourth Infantry". He was killed at the Battle of Gaines Mill, also known as the Battle of Chickahomony.
(10) Charles J. Haviland10 (Adaline Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1843 ,, Michigan, d. .

m. MAR 1833 Minerva Hunn, b. 1814 , d. 30 JUN 1901 .
8 children: Warren Elisha, Mortimer, Florence, Adaline, Charles, Amanda, Mary, Parson H..

(10) Charles Stuart10 (Elisha S. Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1837 , d. 1909 .
(10) Amanda Stuart10 (Elisha S. Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1842 , d. 1909 .
(10) Mary Stuart10 (Elisha S. Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1845 , d. 1914 .
(10) Parson H. Stuart10 (Elisha S. Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1848 , d. 1916 .
(9) Martha Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUN 1814 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 17 FEB 1815 , Jefferson Co., New York.
(9) Roger Wolcott Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 MAR 1818 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 5 JAN 1847 .
m. 15 JAN 1845 Lorinda Prenille, b. , d. .
(9) William Henry Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 27 JAN 1842 Lyme, Jefferson Co., New York, Barbara Allen, b. 2 OCT 1822 , d. 14 SEP 1861 .
5 children: Eben A. "Ahaz", Alice E., Cora V., Glenn D., Maude.
(10) Eben A. "Ahaz" Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 OCT 1842 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. 1 OCT 1858 , Cattaraugus Co., New York.
(10) Alice E. Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1846 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(10) Cora V. Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1848 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(10) Glenn D. Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1859 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. .
(10) Maude Stuart10 (William Henry Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1861 , Cattaraugus Co., New York, d. 2 FEB 1881 , Cattaraugus Co., New York.
(9) William Henry Stuart9 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 1 JUL 1863 Jane Popple, b. , d. .

(10) Belle Stuart10 (Samuel Mott Stuart9, Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(8) Mehitable Wolcott8 (Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 MAY 1786 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 JUL 1787 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Mehitable Wolcott8 (Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 MAR 1788 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 AUG 1788 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Oliver Wolcott8 (Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 MAY 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 22 MAR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Mary Wolcott8 (Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 MAR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Martha Burnham Wolcott8 (Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 FEB 1794 New Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut, d. 13 NOV 1853 Chili, Monroe Co., New York.
m. Daniel Converse, b. 17 SEP 1791 , d. 2 MAR 1873 Crittenden, Erie Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDANIEL was a farmer. He moved to Erie Co., New York, about 1836, and to Chili, New York, about 1840. About 1860, he sold his farm and returned to Jefferson Co., New York.
10 children: Sally Wolcott, Sally Wolcott, Mary Mariah, Cyrus Steele, Lucy Ann, David Elliott, Daniel Evander, Lucy Jane, Roger Wolcott, Willard.
(9) Sally Wolcott Converse9 (Martha Burnham Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 DEC 1812 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 13 DEC 1812 , Jefferson Co., New York.
(9) Sally Wolcott Converse9 (Martha Burnham Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 NOV 1813 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 29 MAR 1879 .
m. 3 DEC 1831 , Jefferson Co., New York, Joel Rogers, b. , d. .
(9) Mary Mariah Converse9 (Martha Burnham Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 JUL 1816 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 5 JUL 1881 .
m. 27 DEC 1835 , Jefferson Co., New York, Frederick Avery, b. , d. .
1 children: William.

m. 16 JAN 1843 Sarah Jane Wooden, b. 5 SEP 1826 , d. 15 NOV 1868 .
9 children: Almeda Charlotte, Ellen Jane, Melvin Cyrus, Alice Ida, Martha Eliza, James Williams, Edward Perry, Charles Hamilton, Willard.

(10) Carrie Bell Converse10 (Daniel Evander Converse9, Martha Burnham Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , Jefferson Co., New York, d. .
(9) Lucy Jane Converse9 (Martha Burnham Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 JAN 1829 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York, d. .
m. 3 JUL 1846 Chili, Monroe Co., New York, Henry Wedd, b. 15 SEP 1821 Latchingdon, Essex Co., England, d. .
Spouse NotesHENRY was a farmer. He moved his family to Kansas City, Missouri in 1858. In 1863 he bought 160 acres of land from the Indians, 16 miles from Kansas City. He later owned 660 acres.
9 children: Henry, Charles, Lucy Jane, George, Mary Maria, Ada Maybell, Willard James, Albert Edward, Elizabeth.

(9) Willard Converse9 (Martha Burnham Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 MAR 1835 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 19 SEP 1864 .
NotesWILLARD was killed in the Civil War.
m. 4 JUL 1858 Mary E. Clark, b. , d. .
(8) Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott8 (Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1796 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 JAN 1892 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
m. ABT 1818 William Rogers, b. 1795 , d. 24 APR 1875 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM and his wife, Sarah, came to Evans Mills and owned 500 acres on which they built a stone house that was still standing in 1953.
6 children: Mayette, Sally Ann, Martha, Jesse, Wolcott Alexander, Milissa.
(9) Mayette Rogers9 (Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1820 , d. 1 MAR 1901 .
m. William R. Steele, b. , d. .
1 children: William Lysander.
(10) William Lysander Steele10 (Mayette Rogers9, Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 MAR 1847 , d. 25 NOV 1907 .
(9) Sally Ann Rogers9 (Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1824 , d. 1907 .
m. George Augustus Wilkie, b. 1824 , d. 1870 .
2 children: Edward Lee, Ella Augusta.
(10) Edward Lee Wilkie10 (Sally Ann Rogers9, Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1854 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 1905 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.

(9) Wolcott Alexander Rogers9 (Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1832 , d. 1905 LeRay, Jefferson Co., New York.
NotesWOLCOTT was at LeRay, New York, in 1860 with wife Laura. Later he was a dairy farmer at Evans Mills, New York.
m. Laura M. , b. 1835 , d. 1897 LeRay, Jefferson Co., New York.
2 children: William E., Lillie M..
(10) William E. Rogers10 (Wolcott Alexander Rogers9, Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott8, Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1861 LeRay, Jefferson Co., New York, d. .
