m. William Gonan, b. , d. .
(8) Mary "Polly" Wolcott8 (Roger Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1798 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
NotesPOLLY and her mother came to live with her sister, Sarah Rogers, at Evans Mills, and both died there and are both buried in the Rogers plot there.
(7) Abner Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 MAR 1762 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 MAY 1762 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Jemima Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 MAY 1763 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 APR 1800 .
m. 19 NOV 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, James Steele, b. 30 AUG 1756 Of Ellington, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JAN 1819 Ellington, Tolland Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesJAMES served in the Revolutionary War and was at the siege of Boston and the Battle of Long Island. He moved from Tolland, Connecticut, to Ellington in 1776. He is said to have had 12 children.
3 children: Emily, Oliver Wolcott, Amelia.
(8) Emily Steele8 (Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
m. Seamans, b. , d. .
1 children: Marie.
(9) Marie Seamans9 (Emily Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
m. Harris Greene, b. , d. .
1 children: William Sherman.
(10) William Sherman Greene10 (Marie Seamans9, Emily Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(8) Oliver Wolcott Steele8 (Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1784 , d. .
NotesOLIVER was a member of the Connecticut State Assembly, Town Clerk of Ellington and a Justice of the Peace. He is said to have been an antiquarian.
m. Abigail Parsons, b. , d. .
4 children: James, Mary, Martha, Jane.
(9) James Steele9 (Oliver Wolcott Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(9) Mary Steele9 (Oliver Wolcott Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(9) Martha Steele9 (Oliver Wolcott Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(9) Jane Steele9 (Oliver Wolcott Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(8) Amelia Steele8 (Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 MAR 1802 Ellington, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 19 APR 1832 Somers, Tolland Co., Connecticut, Otis Arnold Seamans, b. 28 MAR 1812 Foster, Providence Co., Rhode Island, d. 6 JUL 1862 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesOTIS served in the House of Representatives in 1853, and was a member of the Springfield Common Council in 1856 1857, and 1861.
4 children: Maria A., Amanda, Francis E. "Fanny", Sophia S..
(9) Maria A. Seamans9 (Amelia Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 JUN 1833 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(9) Amanda Seamans9 (Amelia Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 APR 1836 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 AUG 1848 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
(9) Francis E. "Fanny" Seamans9 (Amelia Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 JUN 1839 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 11 NOV 1914 ,, New York.
m. 14 JUN 1863 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, John Henry Harris, b. 4 JAN 1838 Troy, Rensselaer Co., New York, d. 22 JAN 1894 .
Spouse NotesJOHN went to sea at age 18 and was shipwrecked off Nova Scotia and nearly drowned. In 1861 he enlisted in the Navy, saw considerable action, and was discharged in 1866. He studied law 1866-7, but left to be a merchant. He was in charge of the New York office of George F. Blake Manufacturing Co., and then organized the Harris Steam Pumping Company, and then was Vice-President and Manager of the Worthington Pumping Engine Co.. He was at Brooklyn, New York, in 1880.
3 children: Antoinette Seamans "Nettie", Isabel W., Francis J. "Frank".
(10) Antoinette Seamans "Nettie" Harris10 (Francis E. "Fanny" Seamans9, Amelia Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 JUL 1864 Worcester, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. JUL 1939 .
NotesANTOINETTE lived in New York City in 1920 when she joined the Wolcott Society.
(10) Isabel W. Harris10 (Francis E. "Fanny" Seamans9, Amelia Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1867 Worcester, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(10) Francis J. "Frank" Harris10 (Francis E. "Fanny" Seamans9, Amelia Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1871 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, d. JAN 1914 .
(9) Sophia S. Seamans9 (Amelia Steele8, Jemima Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 SEP 1844 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 17 JAN 1845 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
(7) Cornelius Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 JUL 1765 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 APR 1812 at Sea.
NotesCORNELIUS drowned in Podunk Brook, while crossing on a plank when the river was flooding. His funeral was recorded in the diary of Rev. Thomas Robbins. Podunk Brook is between Windsor and Hartford, Connecticut.
m. Margaret Williams, b. 1776 , d. 11 JAN 1819 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
7 children: William Williams, Elizabeth, Oliver, Abner, Roger, Cornelius, Martha Treat.
(8) William Williams Wolcott8 (Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 OCT 1791 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 22 JUL 1811 .
(8) Elizabeth Wolcott8 (Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 JUN 1793 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1883 Mendota, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
m. 1 JUN 1812 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Henry Gilman, b. 2 FEB 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1825 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Charles Henry, William Wolcott, Maria, Martha.
(9) Charles Henry Gilman9 (Elizabeth Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 MAR 1817 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 APR 1880 Ottawa, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
NotesCHARLES was a La Salle County judge.
m. 16 NOV 1843 Roxanna Mann, b. 12 JUL 1813 Mansfield, Tioga Co., Pennsylvania, d. 19 NOV 1878 Ottawa, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
3 children: William Henry, Elizabeth, Georgia.
(10) William Henry Gilman10 (Charles Henry Gilman9, Elizabeth Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 MAY 1849 Homer, Champaign Co., Illinois, d. .
(10) Elizabeth Gilman10 (Charles Henry Gilman9, Elizabeth Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 SEP 1844 Homer, Champaign Co., Illinois, d. .
(10) Georgia Gilman10 (Charles Henry Gilman9, Elizabeth Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 JUN 1846 Homer, Champaign Co., Illinois, d. 3 SEP 1931 Ottawa, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
NotesGEORGIA joined the Wolcott Society in 1917 as member 28.
(9) William Wolcott Gilman9 (Elizabeth Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
m. Susan Charles, b. , d. .
(9) Maria Gilman9 (Elizabeth Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
m. William Valentine, b. , d. .
(9) Martha Gilman9 (Elizabeth Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
m. Andrew Lowrill, b. , d. .
(8) Oliver Wolcott8 (Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 JUL 1796 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 26 NOV 1872 .
NotesOLIVER Wolcott, 50, born Connecticut, was living at Barre, New York, in 1830. He was there in 1840 with 1 male 40-50, 1 female 40-50, and 3 young females under 15. He was a farmer at Barre in 1850, with wife Mary 47, Laura Wolcott 17, Martha Wolcott 14, and William Borrows 10. In 1850 William Borrows was no longer with him. In 1860 he was at Barre with Mary and Laura S. Woolcott. In 1865 he was living with his daughter, Laura, at Barre. In 1875, part of Barre became the town of Albion.
m. 27 APR 1826 Enfield, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Mary Mumford, b. 7 SEP 1799 ,, Connecticut, d. 31 MAY 1864 .
4 children: Mary Amelia, James, Laura Sedana, Martha Elizabeth.
(9) Mary Amelia Wolcott9 (Oliver Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 FEB 1827 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 26 JUL 1848 Barre, Orleans Co., New York.
(9) James Wolcott9 (Oliver Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1831 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. .
(9) Laura Sedana Wolcott9 (Oliver Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 MAR 1833 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. .
m. 19 NOV 1864 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, Theodore Birch, b. 1831 , Wayne Co., New York, d. .
(9) Martha Elizabeth Wolcott9 (Oliver Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 SEP 1836 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 3 FEB 1911 Albion, Orleans Co., New York.
m. 26 JAN 1860 ,, New York, Carlton A. Paine, b. 2 APR 1834 ,, New York, d. 17 MAR 1901 Barre, Orleans Co., New York.
Spouse NotesCARLTON was a farmer at Barre, new York, in 1880.
2 children: Oliver A., Carlton Jerome.
(10) Oliver A. Paine10 (Martha Elizabeth Wolcott9, Oliver Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. APR 1861 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 14 APR 1937 Clifton Springs, Ontario Co., New York.
(10) Carlton Jerome Paine10 (Martha Elizabeth Wolcott9, Oliver Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 JUL 1872 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 13 JUL 1873 Barre, Orleans Co., New York.
(8) Abner Wolcott8 (Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 AUG 1798 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 OCT 1854 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois.
NotesABNER was a millwright. He moved to Iowa in 1837. He was one of the first three County Commissionesr for Johnson County, Iowa, elected in 1838. He served on the first Grand Jury and made out the first tax list for the county. In 1841 Abner Woolcott of Johnson Co., Iowa, purchased 80 acres of government land in Iowa. He left Iowa in 1843 for Rock Island, Illinois. He purchased a farm on Lowell Island near Milan, Illinois. In 1850 he was a millwright at Rock Island Co., Illinois, with wife Elizabeth, 25 or 29 born Ohio, and Cornelius 4, and John 5 mo. both born Illinois.
m. 8 APR 1844 , Rock Island Co., Illinois, Elizabeth Ann Wisecarver, b. 1825 ,, Ohio, d. .
4 children: Cornelius Roger, John Abner, Katheryn, William Henry.
(9) Cornelius Roger Wolcott9 (Abner Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 OCT 1845 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. 24 OCT 1921 .
NotesCORNELIUS R. Wolcott of Black Hawk, Illinios, enlisted 4 Oct. 1864 as a Pvt. in Co. I, 126th Illinois Inf. Regt., and was mustered out when the unit was disbanded on 12 July 1865.

Nora Wolcott, dates and relationship unknown, is buried in the same cemetery.
m. 23 OCT 1867 , Rock Island Co., Illinois, Sarah Zeonora Zabrisky, b. 13 JUN 1850 , d. 30 JAN 1926 .
(9) John Abner Wolcott9 (Abner Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1850 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. .
(9) Katheryn Wolcott9 (Abner Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. .
(9) William Henry Wolcott9 (Abner Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 MAY 1852 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. 14 AUG 1935 .
NotesWILLIAM was a railroad brakeman at Muscatine, Iowa, in 1880. He was a minister at Allison, Iowa, 1906-8. His gravestone reads "Engineer Clergyman".
m. 4 NOV 1874 Alice Lucinda Wilson, b. 1857 Pen Hook,, Indiana, d. 17 JAN 1932 Sergent Bluff, Woodbury Co., Iowa.
Spouse NotesALICE's gravestone reads "Pastors wife Teacher".
4 children: Edgar Cornelius "Wally", William Abner, Sylvester Paul, Raymond Franklin.
(10) Edgar Cornelius "Wally" Wolcott10 (William Henry Wolcott9, Abner Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 APR 1881 Muscatine, Muscatine Co., Iowa, d. 6 NOV 1975 St. Louis, St. Louis Co., Missouri.
NotesEDGAR was pastor of the Mayflower Congregational Church at Sioux City, Iowa. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1916, residing at Sioux City, Iowa. At that time he was doing social work with boys. He was member #15. In 1921 he founded the High Twelve International of the Masonic Order which now has over 350 clubs. He served as president, secretary and treasurer, and travelled more than 400,000 miles to form 164 clubs. The clubs meet weekly at noon for lunch. He moved to Kansas City in 1922, and later to St. Louis, Missouri. He lived at Evanston, Illinois, in 1929. He rejoined the Wolcott Society in 1955 as member #568, residing at St. Louis, Missouri.

1918 Draft Registration:
Edgar Cornelius Wolcott 37, b. 22 Apr 1881 Sioux City, Woodbury Co., Iowa, YMCA Secretary, Sioux City, wife Myrtle B. Wolcott, tall, medium build, blue eyes, brown hair

1920 Woodbury Co., IL:
Edgar C Wolcott M 38y
Spouse Myrtle B Wolcott F 35y
Child Margaret Wolcott F 16y
Child Catherine Wolcott F 12y
(10) William Abner Wolcott10 (William Henry Wolcott9, Abner Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1884 Muscatine, Muscatine Co., Iowa, d. .
(10) Sylvester Paul Wolcott10 (William Henry Wolcott9, Abner Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUL 1888 Muscatine, Muscatine Co., Iowa, d. 24 AUG 1958 .
NotesSYLVESTER was at Sioux City, Iowa, in 1930 with Elsie B., Gloria E., Babette A. and Shirley P. Wolcott.

Military gravestone: Sylvester Paul Wolcott, enlisted 19 May 1915, discharged 31 Jan. 1919, SFC, Iowa, Ambulance Co. 136, b. 2 July 1887, died 7 Aug 1958; Memorial Park Sioux City IA
(10) Raymond Franklin Wolcott10 (William Henry Wolcott9, Abner Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 APR 1892 ,, Iowa, d. 6 AUG 1949 , Pima Co., Arizona.
NotesRAYMOND was at Minneapolis, Minnesota, in 1930, with Blanche, Helen E., and R. Oliver Wolcott. He moved to Tucson about 1940, where he was a barber.
(8) Roger Wolcott8 (Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 MAY 1800 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
NotesROGER is said to have "Gone South".
(8) Cornelius Wolcott8 (Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 SEP 1807 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 JAN 1848 Springfield, Hampshire, after 1812 Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesCORNELIUS Woolcott of Enfield married Sophia Hall of Longmeadow at Longmeadow. His gravestone reads: Cornelius Wolcott died Jan. 13 1848 ae. 41.
m. 25 JAN 1827 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Sophia Sweatland Hall, b. 13 JAN 1813 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 18 NOV 1858 Springfield, Hampshire, after 1812 Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesSOPHIA's last name is sometimes given as Hale, but her great-granddaughter, Lois Wolcott said it was Sophia Sweatland Hall. In 1880, Minerva Swetland, widow, born 1802 Connecticut, was living with Oliver Wolcott and listed as his aunt. Her gravestone reads: Sophia wife of Cornelius Wolcott died Nov. 18 1858 aged 71 yrs.
2 children: Oliver, Gordon Hall.
(9) Oliver Wolcott9 (Cornelius Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 MAY 1827 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 NOV 1888 Palmer, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesOLIVER was orphaned at a young age and was raised by Quakers at Enfield, Connecticut. He came to East Longmeadow, Massachusetts, in 1852, where he was a stone mason. He became foreman of a sandstone quarry at East Long Meadow. He and wife, Amelia, were at Longmeadow in 1860, with Amelia's daughter Rosa C. Wolcott. He was one of the founders of the Methodist Church there, and a trustee until his death. He was a farmer at Longmeadow in 1880. He did not have a middle name, according to his great-grandson, John Martin. It was previously thought to be Louis.
m. 18 JAN 1854 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Emily Jane "Emma" Salisbury, b. 1 JUN 1834 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 AUG 1858 East Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
(9) Oliver Wolcott9 (Cornelius Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 MAY 1827 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 NOV 1888 Palmer, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesOLIVER was orphaned at a young age and was raised by Quakers at Enfield, Connecticut. He came to East Longmeadow, Massachusetts, in 1852, where he was a stone mason. He became foreman of a sandstone quarry at East Long Meadow. He and wife, Amelia, were at Longmeadow in 1860, with Amelia's daughter Rosa C. Wolcott. He was one of the founders of the Methodist Church there, and a trustee until his death. He was a farmer at Longmeadow in 1880. He did not have a middle name, according to his great-grandson, John Martin. It was previously thought to be Louis.
m. 11 MAY 1860 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Lydia Amelia Crocker, b. 22 JUN 1829 South Wilbraham, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 2 APR 1895 East Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
1 children: Oliver Louis.
(10) Oliver Louis Wolcott10 (Oliver Wolcott9, Cornelius Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 NOV 1863 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 26 APR 1948 Ojai, Ventura Co., California.
NotesOLIVER graduated from Wilbraham Academy in 1886. He was a draftsman for the Norcross Stone Co. He was the Town Clerk and Treasurer of East Longmeadow from when it was seperated from Longmeadow until 1901. He also served in this capacity from 1914 to 1918. In 1930 he was at East Longmeadow with Quentin L., Geneva E., Shirley G., and Robert Q. Wolcott. He was East Longmeadow Assessor 1909-30, school board member 1894-1911, library trustee, agent of the Board of Health Scalier of Weights and Measures. He was a member of the Hampden Odd Fellows and the First Methodist Church. Some of the information about his descendants was provided by his descendant, Mary Downey Mossner.
(9) Gordon Hall Wolcott9 (Cornelius Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 OCT 1828 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 6 AUG 1853 Springfield, Hampshire, after 1812 Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
(8) Martha Treat Wolcott8 (Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 NOV 1809 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 21 JAN 1899 Branford, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
m. 16 SEP 1840 Andrew Gorsline Loweree, b. 21 MAY 1809 Flushing, Queens Co., New York, d. .
1 children: Lucinda Francis.
(9) Lucinda Francis Loweree9 (Martha Treat Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 MAY 1849 Flushing, Queens Co., New York, d. 8 MAR 1937 New Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
m. 7 MAY 1870 Green Tew Kenyon, b. 21 AUG 1842 Richmond,, Rhode Island, d. 15 JUL 1888 Branford, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesGREEN was a stove dealer at Hartford, Connecticut, until 1875 when he moved to Brandon.
4 children: Albert James, Rodman, Nathan, Edward.
(10) Albert James Kenyon10 (Lucinda Francis Loweree9, Martha Treat Wolcott8, Cornelius Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 JUL 1871 Bloomfield, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 18 JAN 1937 .
NotesALBERT filled out an application for the Wolcott Society, but there is no record of his joining.

NotesWILLIAM "Henry" Wolcott was a machinist at Hartford, Connecticut, in 1850 with Almyra, Ella, and Frances Wolcott. William was at East Hartford, Connecticut, in 1860, with Almira, Ella J., and Frances Wolcott.

1870 East Hartford CT:
Wm H Wolcott M 60y, blacksmith
Almira Wolcott 44y
Ella Wolcott 23y, book binder
Fanny Wolcott 20y, book binder

He was a farmer at East Hartford in 1880.

Spouse Almira Wolcott 54
Child Ella Wolcott 34

NotesWILLIAM joined the Wolcott Society in 1916, residing at Chicago, Illinois. He was member #14.
m. 25 APR 1880 Annie E. Hull, b. , d. .
(8) Mary Cornelia Burbridge8 (Rhoda Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 APR 1816 ,, Connecticut, d. 4 OCT 1903 .
NotesMARY Tillotson was with son Frances Tillotson, farmer, at Osawkie, Kansas, in 1881. Mrs. Marion L. Aten, joined the Wolcott Society as member 14 in 1914, residing at Chicago, Illinois.Possibly two different people.
m. Marion L. Aten, b. , d. .
1 children: Marion Burbridge.
(9) Marion Burbridge Aten9 (Mary Cornelia Burbridge8, Rhoda Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1840 , d. .
NotesMrs. Maria Burbridge Aten of Chicago was said to be the granddaughter of Rhoda Wolcott, born in Windsor, Connecticut, who came west when a young girl. She and Miss Stella Wolcott Aten attended the reunion of the Wolcott Society in 1914. Mrs. Marion L. Aten and Miss Stella Aten were members of the Wolcott Society in 1914. Mrs. Maria L. Aten and Stella were members in 1915. The 1918 Wolcott Society annual report gave Asa Burbridge and Elmer McLaughlin as grandsons of William and Caroline Burbridge, and cousins of Stella Wolcott Aten.
m. Maria L. , b. ABT 1850 , d. SEP 1916 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesMARIA L. Aten of Chicago was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914, and a member of the executive committee in 1915. She was referred to as Mrs. Marion L. Aten, Mrs. Maria L. Aten, Mrs. Maria B. Aten, Maria Burbridge Aten. She is said to be a granddaughter of Rhoda Wolcott who married Charles Burbridge. We are assuming that she was married to Marion Aten. She and Miss Stella Aten, possibly her daughter, attended the 1914 Society reunion.
(8) William H. Burbridge8 (Rhoda Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1818 ,, Massachusetts, d. Quincy, Adams Co., Illinois.
m. Caroline M. , b. 1819 ,, Canada, d. .
2 children: Charles S., .
(9) Charles S. Burbridge9 (William H. Burbridge8, Rhoda Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1858 ,, Illinois, d. .1 children: Asa.
(10) Asa Burbridge10 (Charles S. Burbridge9, William H. Burbridge8, Rhoda Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1900 , d. .
NotesASA, grandson of William and Caroline Burbridge and cousin of Stella Wolcott Aten. was at Camp Presidio, California, in 1918.
(9) Burbridge9 (William H. Burbridge8, Rhoda Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1875 , d. .

(10) Elmer McLaughlin10 ( Burbridge9, William H. Burbridge8, Rhoda Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1900 , d. .
NotesELMER served in the Navy during World War I.
(6) Epaphras Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 MAY 1740 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 JAN 1825 .
NotesEPAPHRAS was at East Windsor, Connecticut, in 1790, with family of 1 male over 16 and 5 females. He is said to have enlisted in Capt. Giles Wolcott's Company and died while on that unit's expedition to Canada. If, so, the death date we have for him must be wrong. He is also said to have married at Rochester NY, which also seems to be in error.
m. JUN 1762 Mabel Burnham, b. 1735 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 27 MAR 1814 .
4 children: Sarah, James, Mabel, Mary.
(7) Sarah Wolcott7 (Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JAN 1764 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 NOV 1853 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts.
m. 5 FEB 1795 Wilbraham, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Ebenezer Pomeroy, b. 1759 Of Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 26 OCT 1840 .
Spouse NotesEBENEZER served in the Revolutionary War.
1 children: Infant.
(8) Infant Pomeroy8 (Sarah Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 MAR 1796 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 11 MAR 1796 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts.
(7) James Wolcott7 (Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 APR 1766 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 APR 1849 Wheatland, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesJAMES lived at East Windsor, Connecticut, where the birth of his sons, Anson, James, and Epaphras was recorded. He was there in 1790 with a family of 1 male over 16, 2 males under 16, and 1 female. He was an officer in the militia during in the War of 1812. His sword was given to his grandson, James MacGregor Wolcott, and was passed on to James' grandaughter, Jessie Humphrey Hunt. He settled at East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, where he lived for many years. He was living at Bloomfield in 1830. He and his wife later moved to Wheatland, New York, to live with their daughter, Miriam. A monument in the Wheatland Baptist Cemetery lists his children, Anson, Epaphras, James, Norman, and Miriam, and says: Anson married Lurinda Hawley Gillett at Mendon, NY. A successful and beloved teacher of Indians, English and deaf and dumb children. They settled in East Bloomfield NY. Prospered, were honored members of Bristol Baptist Church and large contributors. They had eight children." A small book about his descendants was printed by Chandler Wolcott in 1907.
m. JAN 1786 Wheatland, Monroe Co., New York, Miriam Munsell, b. 15 JAN 1767 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 JAN 1850 Wheatland, Monroe Co., New York.
7 children: Anson, Epaphras, James, Norman, Miriam, Sarah, Sarah.
(8) Anson Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 APR 1787 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 OCT 1864 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York.
NotesANSON came from the Springfield Armory, where he was employed, to Bloomfield, New York, to join his brother, Epaphras, in operating a distillery. Epaphras moved to Rochester, and Anson was joined by his brother, Norman. In 1826, Anson and Norman of Bloomfield registered a patent for "distilling all kinds of liquor". In 1827 they registered another patent for "extracting alcohol from common spirits by steam. Anson also patented an improved still for making alcohol from apples in 1836. In 1837 he deeded land at Ontario County, New York, to his brother, James Wolcott, Jr. He and his brother, Epaphras, also started a silk business, raising their own silkworms. He was at East Bloomfield in 1860 with Lurinda, Lurinda, Esther, and Emily Wolcott. In 1860 Anson Wolcott of East Bloomfield had a storekeeper's license. A monument to the children of James and Miriam Wolcott at Wheatland Baptiat Cemetery reads: "Anson married Lurinda Hawley Gilette at Mendon, NY. A successful and beloved teacher of Indians, English and deaf and dumb children. They settled in East Bloomfield NY. Prospered, were honored members of Bristol Baptist Church and large contributors. They had eight children."
m. 29 MAR 1821 Mendon, Monroe Co., New York, Lurinda Hawley Gillett, b. 1802 , d. 17 AUG 1869 Canandaigua, Ontario Co., New York.
7 children: Mary Ann, Susan Melissa, Anson Spencer "Spencer", Lurinda Gillette, Sarah Pomeroy, Asineath Esther "Esther", Frances Emily "Emily".
(9) Mary Ann Wolcott9 (Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 APR 1823 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 2 FEB 1914 Walker, Kent Co., Michigan.
NotesMARY Ann's death certificate says she was to be buried at Canadaugua, New York.
m. 18 SEP 1849 David K. Kendall, b. 24 JAN 1816 Millbury, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 6 JUL 1862 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDAVID was a member of the Presbyterian Church at New Lebanon, and a member of the Masons.
3 children: David Wolcott, Olive Crane, Thomas Jefferson.
(10) David Wolcott Kendall10 (Mary Ann Wolcott9, Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 OCT 1851 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 16 FEB 1910 , Yucatan, Mexico.
NotesDAVID was in the furniture manufacturing business in Grand Rapids, Michigan. He was the chief designer of Reform and Mission style furniture for the Phoenix Furniture Company, and developed finishes that made oak furniture popular. The David Wolcott Kendall College of Art and Design in Grand Rapids is named for him and funded in his wife's will.
(10) Olive Crane Kendall10 (Mary Ann Wolcott9, Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 JUL 1853 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 11 NOV 1929 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
NotesOLIVE joined the Wolcott Society in 1917. She was active in the Fountain Street Baptist Church at Grand Rapids, the Society of Mayflower Descendants, and the D. A. R. Her estate was valued at $200,000.
(10) Thomas Jefferson Kendall10 (Mary Ann Wolcott9, Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 OCT 1855 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
(9) Susan Melissa Wolcott9 (Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 JAN 1825 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 27 DEC 1855 .
m. 17 OCT 1858 , Ontario Co., New York, Ezekiel J. Scudder, b. 17 FEB 1819 , d. 25 FEB 1878 .
1 children: Sarah Josephine.
(10) Sarah Josephine Scudder10 (Susan Melissa Wolcott9, Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 OCT 1860 , d. 31 AUG 1862 .
(9) Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott9 (Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 MAR 1827 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 23 AUG 1911 Fayette, Howard Co., Missouri.
NotesANSON is also said to have been born in 1821. He was at East Bloomfield, New York, in 1860, with Sarah, Charles, and Eliza Wolcott. He was a fruit grower at Prairie, Missouri, in 1880.
m. 2 AUG 1855 Sarah P. Walker, b. 13 JUN 1829 Canandaigua, Ontario Co., New York, d. 9 MAY 1882 Prairie, Howard Co., Missouri.
3 children: Charles Spencer, Eliza Lurinda, George Franklin.
(10) Charles Spencer Wolcott10 (Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott9, Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 MAY 1856 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 5 DEC 1886 Richmond, Ray Co., Missouri.
(10) Eliza Lurinda Wolcott10 (Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott9, Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 AUG 1858 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 11 AUG 1884 .
(10) George Franklin Wolcott10 (Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott9, Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 JAN 1868 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. NOV 1950 , Howard Co., Missouri.
NotesGEORGE lived at Fayette, Missouri, in 1913. In 1920 he was at Moniteau, Howard Co., Missouri.
(9) Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott9 (Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 MAR 1827 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 23 AUG 1911 Fayette, Howard Co., Missouri.
NotesANSON is also said to have been born in 1821. He was at East Bloomfield, New York, in 1860, with Sarah, Charles, and Eliza Wolcott. He was a fruit grower at Prairie, Missouri, in 1880.
m. 6 AUG 1884 Kahoka.Clark Co., Missouri, Phebe A. Church, b. , d. .
(9) Lurinda Gillette Wolcott9 (Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 FEB 1829 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 24 AUG 1896 Bristol, Ontario Co., New York.
NotesLURENDA is also said to be buried at Fayette, Missouri.
m. ABT 1850 Simon P. Hall, b. 1826 , d. 1903 Bristol, Ontario Co., New York.
Spouse NotesSIMON served in the Civil War.
1 children: Charles Wolcott.
(10) Charles Wolcott Hall10 (Lurinda Gillette Wolcott9, Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1854 Bristol, Ontario Co., New York, d. 1925 .
NotesCHARLES was a farmer at Hamlin, New York, in 1880, age 25, with wife Jennie 22, and Cora 1.
(9) Sarah Pomeroy Wolcott9 (Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 SEP 1832 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 3 JUN 1850 .
(9) Asineath Esther "Esther" Wolcott9 (Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 APR 1840 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. .
m. 15 AUG 1864 Delinar W. Scudder, b. 1840 ,, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesDELIVAN Scudder 40, farmer, was a Randolph, New York, in 1880 with wife Ella 40 and daughter Grace 12, all born in New York.
1 children: Grace Lurenda.
(10) Grace Lurenda Scudder10 (Asineath Esther "Esther" Wolcott9, Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 OCT 1867 , d. .
(9) Frances Emily "Emily" Wolcott9 (Anson Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 AUG 1842 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. .
m. 27 MAY 1866 Theodore Parker Whiting, b. , d. 20 APR 1878 Harrison Valley, Potter Co., Pennsylvania.
(8) Epaphras Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 APR 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 AUG 1852 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesEPAPHRAS was employed at the Springfield Armory. He left there and walked to New York state about 1808, and in 1811 purchased land in Wayne County, in what is now the town of Wolcott. He moved to Bloomfield, Ontario County, where he deeded land to Thomas and Benjamin Wheeler in 1814, Nathaniel, Lyman, and William Keyes in 1821, Richard Paul in 1821, nson Wolcott in 1821, Timothy Wilder in 1825, and Norman Wolcott in 1826. He appears on the Bloomfield 1820 census. His brother, Anson, joined him there in the operation of a distillery. In 1827 he moved to Rochester, where in 1830 he built the Wolcott Distillery and the Wolcott Tavern which he managed. His large frame house is still standing on the southwest corner of Mt. Hope Avenue and Clarissa St., looking much as it did in 1830 when the forest came to the very door of the house.

He is on the 1830 census at Brighton, Monroe Co., New York, which is near Rochester. Epaphras was a member of the First Baptist Church and was often called upon to speak at public meetings.
m. 25 MAY 1811 Naomi Paul, b. 19 AUG 1791 , d. 11 NOV 1853 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
7 children: Sarah Munsell, Anson Franklin, George Paul, Elvira Antoinette, Oliver Epaphras, Georgianna Melvina, Julia M..
(9) Sarah Munsell Wolcott9 (Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 OCT 1812 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 11 AUG 1903 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesSARAH was a charter member of the Second Baptist Church at Rochester, New York, in 1834.
m. 13 FEB 1834 David R. Barton, b. 4 JUL 1805 , d. 25 APR 1875 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDAVID learned the nail making trade at Rochester, and then moved to Ramapo, New York, and then returned to Rochester and set up a tool making business in 1832. He was a pioneer in the manufacture of edge tools, and built a large business, the D. R. Barton Company, employing 193 people in 1870. He was a deacon in the Baptist Church at Rochester, New York, and one of the founders of the city hospital.
8 children: Cornelia, Julia Munsell, Charles Casimir, Henry Epaphras, Augusta Anoinette, George Wolcott, Edward Munroe, Sarah Louisa.
(10) Cornelia Barton10 (Sarah Munsell Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 JUN 1836 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 21 JUN 1836 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(10) Julia Munsell Barton10 (Sarah Munsell Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 APR 1838 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 11 MAY 1865 .
(10) Charles Casimir Barton10 (Sarah Munsell Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 OCT 1840 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 28 JUN 1903 New York City, New York.
(10) Henry Epaphras Barton10 (Sarah Munsell Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 NOV 1842 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. Seattle, King Co., Washington.
(10) Augusta Anoinette Barton10 (Sarah Munsell Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 JAN 1845 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
(10) George Wolcott Barton10 (Sarah Munsell Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 DEC 1846 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 11 AUG 1847 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(10) Edward Munroe Barton10 (Sarah Munsell Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 FEB 1849 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 7 APR 1885 .
(10) Sarah Louisa Barton10 (Sarah Munsell Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 SEP 1852 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 12 JAN 1886 .
(9) Anson Franklin Wolcott9 (Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 JUN 1814 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 6 APR 1892 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesANSON lived most of his life at Rochester, New York.

1850 Rochester NY:
Anson F Wolcott M 36y
Elisa Ann Wolcott F 27y

In 1873 Anson and his brother, George, continued the distillery and tavern built by their father, as A. F & G. P. Wolcott, Distillers. In 1880 he was retired, living at Rochester, New York.
m. 13 OCT 1846 Ann Eliza Combs, b. 2 MAR 1822 ,, New York, d. 19 APR 1904 .
(9) George Paul Wolcott9 (Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 NOV 1816 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 10 AUG 1880 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesGEORGE was a partner with his brother, Anson, in the distillery business at Rochester, New York. He served in the Civil War.

1850 Rochester NY:
George P Wolcott M 33y
Caroline E Wolcott F 28y
Henry E Wolcott M 2y

Maria Dutcher F 26y

He was at Rochester in 1879 with James E., Frank A,

1880 Rochester NY
James E. Wolcott M 30
Ida J. Wolcott F 27

Maggie Gutberlet F 24
m. 26 MAY 1846 Caroline Elizabeth Moore, b. 15 APR 1822 , d. 7 OCT 1871 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
4 children: Henry Epaphras, James Ephraim, Franklin Anson, Elizabeth Georgiana.
(10) Henry Epaphras Wolcott10 (George Paul Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 OCT 1847 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 22 JUL 1889 Rochester, Monroe Co., Michigan.
NotesHENRY was a Justice of the Peace at Rochester in 1872.

a banker in Lorado, Texas.
(10) James Ephraim Wolcott10 (George Paul Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 APR 1850 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 24 NOV 1906 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesJAMES was a distiller and wholesale liquor dealer in Rochester, New York. He established the James E. Wolcott & Co. distillery there in 1827, and marketed whisky under the name of "Cornhill Rye". In 1892 he was a wholesaler at Rochester. He was at Rochester in 1900.

1892 Rochester NY:
James E. Wolcott 42, wholesaler
Ida J. Wolcott 40
Carrie R. Wolcott, 16
George P. Wolcott, 12
Charley Wolcott 11

Ida J Wolcott 48, b. NY, 3 children
Carolyn Wolcott 52, b. NY
George P Wolcott 19, b. NY

Magie Mason 38, b. NY, servant
(10) Franklin Anson Wolcott10 (George Paul Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 APR 1853 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 15 MAY 1884 .
(10) Elizabeth Georgiana Wolcott10 (George Paul Wolcott9, Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 JUN 1856 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 1937 .
(9) Elvira Antoinette Wolcott9 (Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 SEP 1820 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 24 SEP 1865 .
m. 26 JUN 1860 Edward Jackson Jenks, b. 3 MAR 1817 ,, Massachusetts, d. .
Spouse NotesEDWARD worked at Rochester, New York for 5 years and then worked 5 years as book keeper of the Bank of Brighton. He became cashier of the Woburn bank in 1853 and remained there 18 years. In 1875 he became cashier of the Hopkinton National Bank and treasurer of the Hopkinton Savings Bank.
(9) Oliver Epaphras Wolcott9 (Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 MAR 1827 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 21 OCT 1829 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(9) Georgianna Melvina Wolcott9 (Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 JUN 1834 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 15 SEP 1835 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(9) Julia M. Wolcott9 (Epaphras Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1838 , d. 11 MAY 1865 .
NotesJulia is placed here because she was buried in the pot owned by Epaphras' sons. She may be an in-law.

The funeral of the late Mrs. P.B. VIELE took place yesterday afternoon from the family residence, No. 139 North Union street. The services were conducted by Rev. Dr. RIGGS, assisted by Rev. Mr. BARSTOW. The deceased
was the daughter of the late Carlos and Billings DUTTON and is survived by
her husband, P.B. VIELE, secretary and treasurer of the East Side Savings
Bank, two sons, George B. CHASE of Cleveland and Benjamin B. CHASE, secretary
of the Title and Guarantee Company of this city, also two sisters, Mrs.
Abby G. HOWLAND of Perry, N.Y., and Mrs. Churchill H. CUTTING of Brooklyn.
m. Platt B. Viele, b. 1829 ,, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesHe was a banker and apparently a widower in 1870 living with his parents Platt C. and Phoebe Viele. A widowed banker at Rochester with his parents in 1880.
(8) James Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 MAY 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 4 APR 1866 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
NotesJAMES settled at Rome, Oneida Co., New York, where all his children were born. He had a sawmill at Rome. He was at Chicago, Illinois, in 1860, and died there in the home of his son, Ebenezer. James was a Presbyterian.
m. 13 NOV 1814 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, Lovisa Emily Gould, b. 15 JUL 1792 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. ABT 1854 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York.
9 children: Ebenezer Gould, Norman, William, Anson Gould, Chauncey Smith, Francis Story, Charles Darwin, Beulah Ann, James Henry.
(9) Ebenezer Gould Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 SEP 1815 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 30 DEC 1885 Wolcottville, LaGrange Co., Indiana.
NotesEBENEZER was at Belvedere, Illinois, in 1850, with wife Maria L. 29, and daughter, Ella, 2. He was a produce dealer at Oswego, New York, in 1859. He was at Chicago, Illinois, in 1860, recorded as Edgar G. Woolcott, with Maria L., Charles, Ellen M., and his father, James Wolcott. He was also at Chicago in 1870, recorded as Edward G., with wife Mary L., and daughter Ella. He and 5 other men together purchased 400 acres of land in Michigan in 1870. In 1880, E. G. Wolcott was a produce merchant at Chicago, Illinois.
m. 17 AUG 1843 Maria Louise Brown, b. MAY 1820 Caledonia, Monroe Co., New York, d. 29 NOV 1905 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesMARIA joined the Belcoda Baptist Church at Wheatland, New York, in 1845.
3 children: Ella, Charles Theron, Ebenezer Gould.
(10) Ella Wolcott10 (Ebenezer Gould Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1848 ,, Wisconsin, d. .
(10) Charles Theron Wolcott10 (Ebenezer Gould Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 AUG 1851 Belvidere, Boone Co., Illinois, d. 3 JAN 1861 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
(10) Ebenezer Gould Wolcott10 (Ebenezer Gould Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 JAN 1856 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. 25 JUN 1860 .
(9) Norman Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 SEP 1817 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. .
(9) William Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 SEP 1817 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 30 SEP 1817 Rome, Oneida Co., New York.
(9) Anson Gould Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 OCT 1819 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 10 JAN 1907 Wolcott, White Co., Indiana.
NotesANSON began teaching school in Ontario County, New York, at the age of 15. When he was 21 he went to Claibourne Parish, Louisiana, and studied law with Judge Peets. He was admitted to the New York bar at Buffalo, New York, in 1842, and to the Supreme Court in 1852. He was a lawyer, farmer, and grain merchant. He purchased 2,000 acres of land from the Holland Land Co. in Royalton Township, Niagra Co., New York, and settled on it in 1847. He dug a well and built a steam sawmil, He employed a large number of men in cutting and processing lumber, and built a boarding house for them to live in. He was living at Lockport, New York, in 1850. Lockport is adjascent to Royalton. In 1851 he deeded his land to four trustees who divided the land into small plots. He came to Indiana as an attorney for a railroad company, and purchased several square miles of land where the railroad would be located. The town of Wolcottsville was laid out in 1861, next to the Toledo, Logansport, and Burlington Railroad, later part of the Pennsylvania Railroad. It was named in his honor. On an errand to Washington, D.C. in 1861, he heard of the Confederate attack on the Union Army at Bull Run and hastened to the battle area to assist in the fight, receiving a minor wound. He and his brother, Ebenezer, settled in Princeton Township, White Co., Indiana, in 1858, and laid out a town that became Wolcott, Indiana, in 1861. Here Anson built a large 14 room home in 1864, later occupied by his son, Eben. The home is still standing at 500 N. Range St., and is listed on the National Registry of Historical Places. He had a large farm called Wolcott Farm. In 1956 it was given by his grandson, Roger Wolcot, to Princeton Township. It is now the home of the Anson Wolcott Historical Society, who began restoring it in 1974. In 1868 Anson was elected as a Republican to the Indiana State Senate, where he was Chairman of the Finance Committee. He was reelected in 1871, and was Chairman of the Finance Committee . In 1872, his trustees in New York sold lots to seventy five families from Prussia, who drew lots for the land. Anson moved his sawmill from Wolcottsville, New York, to Erie Co., New York, at that time. In 1876 he was nominated for Governor on the Greenback Party ticket., but in later years returned to the Republican party. In 1880 he was an attorney, living in a boarding house at Logansport, Indiana. He later resided in Denver, Colorado, where he owned considerable mining property.
m. 12 JUL 1848 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, Elizabeth Walbridge, b. 2 APR 1823 Geneva, Ontario Co., New York, d. 26 APR 1909 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York.
1 children: Henry Walbridge.
(10) Henry Walbridge Wolcott10 (Anson Gould Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 SEP 1849 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. Blackstone, Nottoway Co., Virginia.
NotesHENRY W. Wolcott was an agent for the T., W. & W. Railroad at Logansport, Indiana, in 1874. He was a laborer at Fremont, Sandusky Co., Ohio, in 1880: Henry W. Walcott 30 born NY, laborer. Helen 27 born Scotland, Helen 4, Hugh 2, son 1 month, all born Scotland, Jane McTyre 60, Ranson Wolcott, brother, 16, born Ohio.
(9) Anson Gould Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 OCT 1819 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 10 JAN 1907 Wolcott, White Co., Indiana.
NotesANSON began teaching school in Ontario County, New York, at the age of 15. When he was 21 he went to Claibourne Parish, Louisiana, and studied law with Judge Peets. He was admitted to the New York bar at Buffalo, New York, in 1842, and to the Supreme Court in 1852. He was a lawyer, farmer, and grain merchant. He purchased 2,000 acres of land from the Holland Land Co. in Royalton Township, Niagra Co., New York, and settled on it in 1847. He dug a well and built a steam sawmil, He employed a large number of men in cutting and processing lumber, and built a boarding house for them to live in. He was living at Lockport, New York, in 1850. Lockport is adjascent to Royalton. In 1851 he deeded his land to four trustees who divided the land into small plots. He came to Indiana as an attorney for a railroad company, and purchased several square miles of land where the railroad would be located. The town of Wolcottsville was laid out in 1861, next to the Toledo, Logansport, and Burlington Railroad, later part of the Pennsylvania Railroad. It was named in his honor. On an errand to Washington, D.C. in 1861, he heard of the Confederate attack on the Union Army at Bull Run and hastened to the battle area to assist in the fight, receiving a minor wound. He and his brother, Ebenezer, settled in Princeton Township, White Co., Indiana, in 1858, and laid out a town that became Wolcott, Indiana, in 1861. Here Anson built a large 14 room home in 1864, later occupied by his son, Eben. The home is still standing at 500 N. Range St., and is listed on the National Registry of Historical Places. He had a large farm called Wolcott Farm. In 1956 it was given by his grandson, Roger Wolcot, to Princeton Township. It is now the home of the Anson Wolcott Historical Society, who began restoring it in 1974. In 1868 Anson was elected as a Republican to the Indiana State Senate, where he was Chairman of the Finance Committee. He was reelected in 1871, and was Chairman of the Finance Committee . In 1872, his trustees in New York sold lots to seventy five families from Prussia, who drew lots for the land. Anson moved his sawmill from Wolcottsville, New York, to Erie Co., New York, at that time. In 1876 he was nominated for Governor on the Greenback Party ticket., but in later years returned to the Republican party. In 1880 he was an attorney, living in a boarding house at Logansport, Indiana. He later resided in Denver, Colorado, where he owned considerable mining property.
m. 11 FEB 1863 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, Georgiana De Ismisquero Sayne, b. Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. 4 AUG 1877 Wolcott, White Co., Indiana.
1 children: Eben Henry.
(10) Eben Henry Wolcott10 (Anson Gould Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 MAY 1866 Wolcott, White Co., Indiana, d. 21 AUG 1941 Indianapolis, Marion Co., Indiana.
NotesEBEN graduated from Wabash College in 1886. He was in the grain business, and later involved in the Western Motor Co. of Logansport, manufacturer of the Reutenber Motor. He was President of the State Savings and Trust Co. at Indianapolis, and later Chairman of the Board of that bank. He was a member of the State Board of Tax Comissioners, State Bank Comissioner under 3 different Governors, President of the Standard Investments and Security Co. of Indianapolis, and was a Trustee of Wabash College beginning in 1906. He was a grain dealer at Princeton Township, White Co., Indiana, in 1900, where his wife as called Ellen. Eben was elected a state senator for White, Newton, and Jasper Counties in 1900. He was considered an eloquent speaker. He resided at Logansport, Indiana, in 1908, Marion, Indiana, in 1909, and at Indianapolis in 1914-25. In 1916 he left his job as State Assessor for Indiana to become President of the State Savings and Trust Co. of Indianapolis. He was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1908, chairman of the Historical Committee and speaker at the Wolcott reunion in 1909, president of the 1910 reunion, President of the Wolcott Society 1910-1911, and 1916-1917, vice-president for Indiana 1909-17, and spoke at several of the reunions. For 23 years he was the executive director of the Indianapolis Volunteers of America.
(9) Chauncey Smith Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 NOV 1821 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 28 DEC 1890 Portland, Ionia Co., Michigan.
NotesCHAUNCEY was a farmer at Lockport, New York, in 1850 with wife Sarah M. and daughter Sarah M. Wolcott. He later worked in sales and manufacturing. For the last 22 years of his life he was in the shoe business and the grocery business at Portland, Michigan.
m. 24 SEP 1849 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, Sarah M. Wakeman, b. 3 JUL 1828 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. 16 JUL 1850 .
1 children: Sarah M..
(10) Sarah M. Wolcott10 (Chauncey Smith Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1850 ,, New York, d. .
(9) Chauncey Smith Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 NOV 1821 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 28 DEC 1890 Portland, Ionia Co., Michigan.
NotesCHAUNCEY was a farmer at Lockport, New York, in 1850 with wife Sarah M. and daughter Sarah M. Wolcott. He later worked in sales and manufacturing. For the last 22 years of his life he was in the shoe business and the grocery business at Portland, Michigan.
m. 1850 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, Adaline Brockway, b. 20 JUN 1830 ,, New York, d. 20 AUG 1898 Portland, Ionia Co., Michigan.
1 children: Florence I..
(10) Florence I. Wolcott10 (Chauncey Smith Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 SEP 1854 Lansing, Ingham Co., Michigan, d. 12 JAN 1890 .
(9) Francis Story Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 NOV 1821 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 4 JAN 1822 .
(9) Charles Darwin Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 JUN 1825 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 16 JUN 1844 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York.
NotesCHARLES drowned.
(9) Beulah Ann Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 AUG 1827 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 17 NOV 1891 Erie, Erie Co., Pennsylvania.
m. 21 AUG 1845 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, Benjamin Hawley Fletcher, b. 13 NOV 1913 Bridport, Addison Co., Vermont, d. 1 MAR 1991 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York.
3 children: Frances Emily, Celia Wright, Mary.
(10) Frances Emily Fletcher10 (Beulah Ann Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 NOV 1850 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. 12 NOV 1902 .
(10) Celia Wright Fletcher10 (Beulah Ann Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 DEC 1857 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. 20 JAN 1927 Trenton, Mercer Co., New Jersey.
NotesCELIA was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914 residing at Erie, Pennsylvania.
(10) Mary Fletcher10 (Beulah Ann Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 NOV 1859 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. 5 DEC 1881 Erie, Erie Co., Pennsylvania.
(9) James Henry Wolcott9 (James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 MAR 1831 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 24 NOV 1895 La Grange, Cook Co., Illinois.
NotesJAMES was a broker. He helped his father run a sawmill in Rome, New York, and then moved to New York City where he had a wholesale dry goods business. He then moved to Galena, Illinois and operated a meat packing business. In 1858 he moved to Chicago and had a meat packing business at the Chicago Stock Yard. He lived at Pepin, Wisconsin, where he was in 1860, with wife Kate and daughter, Beulah L. Wolcott. He was at Chicago in 1870 with Kate R., Beulah L., James G., Katie W. and Ebenezer G. He helped organize the Chicago Board of Trade. He moved from Galena, Illinois, to LaGrange, Illinois, about 1880, where he built a home at Maple and Madison Aves.
m. 27 OCT 1857 Galena, Jo Daviess Co., Illinois, Kathryn "Kate" Reinwald, b. 19 OCT 1834 Baltimore, Baltimore Co., Maryland, d. 15 OCT 1926 LaGrange, DuPage Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesKATHRYN came by covered wagon to Chicago with her family in 1836, and travelled up the Mississippi River to Galena, where they built a log cabin. Her name is spelled Catherine Reinwalt on her marriage record.
4 children: Beulah Louise, James Griffith "Jim", Kathryn Wilimina "Kate", Ebenezer Gould "Eben".
(10) Beulah Louise Wolcott10 (James Henry Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 MAR 1859 Galena, Jo Daviess Co., Illinois, d. 29 MAY 1938 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
NotesBEULAH was a member of the Wolcott Society 1911-15, and member of the Executive Committee in 1915. She was the 16th President of the Society of Descendants of Henry Wolcott, 1926-27. She lived at Chicago 1911-38.
(10) James Griffith "Jim" Wolcott10 (James Henry Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 MAR 1861 Galena, Jo Daviess Co., Illinois, d. 18 DEC 1926 LaGrange, DuPage Co., Illinois.
NotesJAMES moved to LaGrange with his parents in 1879, and began working for the post office. He then worked in the County Clerk's Office for over 30 years. In 1892, he was elected tax assessor for Lyons Township, serving for 34 years. For the last 16 years of his life, he worked in the Tax Redemption Department. He became county comissioner in 1921. He was active in many civic organizations, including the Masons, Woodsmen, Elks. He was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914, and Chairman of the Executive Committee in 1915.
(10) Kathryn Wilimina "Kate" Wolcott10 (James Henry Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 OCT 1863 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesKATHRYN was a member of the Wolcott Society 1911-15 and she or her husband was a member of the Society executive committee in 1915. She lived at Chicago 1911-26, and re-registered as member #105 in 1925.
(10) Ebenezer Gould "Eben" Wolcott10 (James Henry Wolcott9, James Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 FEB 1866 Galena, Jo Daviess Co., Illinois, d. 10 JAN 1905 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
NotesEBEN lived at Chicago in 1926.
(8) Norman Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 APR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 OCT 1852 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky.
NotesNORMAN came to Bloomfield, New York, to help his brother, Anson, operate a silkworm business. He moved to Warren County, Ohio, about 1819. Norman, his wife and infant son, and the Henry family, left there on a flatboat, en route to New Orleans. Coming down the Ohio River they encountered a lot of ice, so they spent the winter of 1820 camped at the mouth of the Green River. The Henry family continued down the river, but left their son, James, with the Wolcotts. James later married Norman's daughter. In the spring, Norman, continued up the Green River and settled at a place on the Green River, 6 miles north of South Carrollton, Kentucky. This became known as Wolcott's Landing. There he built a grist mill. He operated the mill until he got his arm crushed in the mill machinery. He later died of the injury.

1850 Ohio, Ohio Co. KY:Norman Walcott 56 Massachusetts, miller
Mary A Walcott F 54 North Carolina
Oliver H Walcott M 22 New York, Distiller
Nancy J Walcott F 19 New York
Isabella Cole F 65 North Carolina
next to James Walcott,29, b. OH, distiller
Louisa Walcott, 15
m. 1 FEB 1820 , Warren Co., Ohio, Mary Ann Mac Gregor, b. 1797 Aberdeen,, Scotland, d. 24 OCT 1862 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky.
5 children: James MacGregor, Christina, Anson, Oliver Hector, Nancy Jane,
(9) James MacGregor Wolcott9 (Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 NOV 1820 , Warren Co., Ohio, d. 24 AUG 1896 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
NotesJAMES operated his father's mill at Wolcott's Landing. Later he was Captain of a Green River steamer, called "The Enterprise", on which he built a saw mill. He traveled the Green River sawing lumber for landowners who lived along the river. During the Civil War, he organized and was Capt. of the home militia. He built a grist mill at South Carrolton, Kentucky. In 1880 he was a Miller and Engineer at South Carrollton.
m. 10 JAN 1850 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky, Louisa Jane "Jennie" Bullock, b. 25 AUG 1832 ,, Kentucky, d. 22 APR 1875 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
5 children: Hortense Amelia, George Alfred, Louisa Jane, Charles Edgar, James Franklin.
(10) Hortense Amelia Wolcott10 (James MacGregor Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 OCT 1850 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 2 FEB 1922 Marion, Marion Co., Indiana.
(10) George Alfred Wolcott10 (James MacGregor Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 JAN 1853 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 5 FEB 1901 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
NotesGEORGE and his wife were living with Susan Strother, age 63, at South Carrollton in 1880. Susan was probably his wife's aunt or stepmother. His middle name is also given as Albert. In 1900 he was a wholesale merchant at South Carrollton with 3 children.
(10) Louisa Jane Wolcott10 (James MacGregor Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAR 1855 , Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky, d. 28 OCT 1931 Big Clifty, Grayson Co., Kentucky.
(10) Charles Edgar Wolcott10 (James MacGregor Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 AUG 1857 , Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky, d. 29 AUG 1932 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
NotesCHARLES was a partner with his brothers in the familyflour milling and shipping business at South Carrollton. He managed the mill while they ran the steamboat. The mill was built in 1887, and was the first roller mill in Muhlenberg County. It operated for 50 years. He was a miller at South Carrollton in 1900.

1920 Muhlenburg Co. KY:
Charles E Wolcott M 62y
Spouse Mollie Wolcott F 50y
(10) James Franklin Wolcott10 (James MacGregor Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 APR 1859 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky, d. 6 DEC 1950 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
NotesJAMES and two of his brothers owned a steam boat with a saw mill on it called "The Lumberman". They cut 2 1/2 million feet of lumber for the government, which was used in making concrete forms for the locks at Glenmore, Kentucky. They also owned and operated a flour mill at South Carrollton, Kentucky, begun in 1887, and operated by the Wolcotts for 50 years. In 1895 the brothers built the steamship "Three Brothers", 100 feet long, one of the largest boats on the Green River. They had a saw mill on the boat, which they later removed and used the boat only for carrying freight. They then operated the boat as part of a wholesale grocery business, delivering food to stores all along the Green River. George was the Captain, and James the engineer. After George's death in 1900, James studied for his captain's license and later became captain. James sold the boat sold the boat, and devoted their attention to the flour milling business, which James managed until 1933. James was President of the Citizens Bank at South Carrollton.

1920 Muhlenberg Co. KY:
James F Wolcott M 60y
Spouse Betty Wolcott F 60y
Child Rena Wolcott F 23y
Timothy H Brown M 46y
Ilene Brown F 17y
Sarah Brown F 11y
(9) Christina Wolcott9 (Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 NOV 1822 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 27 NOV 1886 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
m. 2 APR 1846 James Henry, b. 1822 ,, Ohio, d. 2 MAR 1867 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
Spouse NotesJAMES came to Kentucky as a young man, settling at South Carrolton. He was a shoemaker and farmer.
6 children: J. S., W.C., Albert M., Mary E., Samuel N., Mattie.
(10) J. S. Henry10 (Christina Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 MAR 1848 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky, d. 1911 Marion,, Kentucky.
NotesJ. W. graduated from Bethel College in 1869, and then moved to Evansville, Indiana, where he learned the stone cutting trade. He was ordained a minister in the United Baptist Church in 1870, and was clerk of the Ohio River Baptist Association for 28 years. He preached all over Western Kentucky. He had a stone business at Madisonville, Kentucky from about 1872 to 1882, and then moved to Marion, Kentucky, where he opened a stone and marble business in 1881. In 1896 he sold the business to his brothers, S. N. and Albert, who ran it until 1905, when they sold it to J. W.s sons.
(10) W.C. Henry10 (Christina Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Albert M. Henry10 (Christina Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Mary E. Henry10 (Christina Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Samuel N. Henry10 (Christina Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Mattie Henry10 (Christina Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(9) Anson Wolcott9 (Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 FEB 1825 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 8 JUL 1826 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky.
(9) Oliver Hector Wolcott9 (Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 JAN 1828 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. APR 1863 .
Notes1850 Ohio KY:


Oliver Walcot was a farmer, age 33, born New Jersey, at Point Pleasant, Ohio Co., Kentucky, in 1860, with Sarah 30, Christina 7, Augustus 6, Alva 5, Millard F. 3, and Marinda 1, all born in Kentucky. Oliver served in the Union Army during the Civil War. He was severely wounded at the Battle of Shilow. A crucial part of this battle took place in a peach orchard where the trees were in bloom. As the battle raged, petals fell like snow. It was here that Oliver was wounded. He received a disability discharge at Pittsburg Landing 7 April 1862, and never fully recovered from his wounds. The gun carried in the war by Oliver, and a bowie knife belonging to him, were owned by his niece, Rena Wolcott Crabtree.
m. 1851 Sarah Ellen "Sally" Dexter, b. 1830 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 1862 , Ohio Co., Kentucky.
6 children: Christina Isabelle, William Augustus "Gus", Alva Arista, Millard Winfield, Mary Ellen, Robert Vaughn.
(10) Christina Isabelle Wolcott10 (Oliver Hector Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. NOV 1852 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. FEB 1875 .
NotesCHRISTEN's name is Catherine on a record transcription of marriages at Ohio Co., Kentucky.
(10) William Augustus "Gus" Wolcott10 (Oliver Hector Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1854 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 1899 .
NotesWilliam was wounded during the Civil War. He learned the stonecutting trade at Madisonville, Kentucky. He and his brothers, Alva and Robert, established a stonecutting business at McKinney, Texas, called "W. W. Wolcott and Bros., Monuments, Tablets and Headstones".
(10) Alva Arista Wolcott10 (Oliver Hector Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 AUG 1855 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 14 MAY 1929 Wetherford, Parker Co., Texas.
NotesALVA was a stonecutter. In 1883, his father-in-law, J. B. Pond, deeded him land at McKinney, Texas. After the death of his brother, William, in 1899, he took over the management of their stone cutting business, specializing in tombstones, at McKinney.

Alva Walcott was at Smith Co., Texas, in 1920, with his son, Joe M. Wolcott.
(10) Millard Winfield Wolcott10 (Oliver Hector Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 FEB 1857 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. .
(10) Mary Ellen Wolcott10 (Oliver Hector Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 NOV 1858 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 17 AUG 1886 .
(10) Robert Vaughn Wolcott10 (Oliver Hector Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 SEP 1860 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 24 MAR 1939 San Augustine, San Augustine Co., Texas.
NotesROBERT was a stone cutter and worked with his brothers at McKinney, Texas. He then moved to Helen, Montana. In 1930 he was at San Augustine, Texas.
(9) Nancy Jane Wolcott9 (Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 FEB 1831 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. .
m. 19 AUG 1857 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, Reason H. Everly, b. , d. .
2 children: James Oliver, Ida.
(10) James Oliver Everly10 (Nancy Jane Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 MAR 1860 , d. .
(10) Ida Everly10 (Nancy Jane Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 MAR 1862 , d. CHILD .

m. 2 JUL 1865 John A. Townes, b. , d. .
2 children: Mary, Nettie.
(10) Mary Townes10 (Nancy Jane Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1866 , d. 1883 .
(10) Nettie Townes10 (Nancy Jane Wolcott9, Norman Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1868 , d. .
(8) Miriam Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 NOV 1795 ,, Connecticut, d. 28 JUL 1878 .
m. 22 MAR 1820 Rawson Harmon, b. 3 SEP 1794 Mumford, Monroe Co., New York, d. 24 JUN 1873 Mumford, Monroe Co., New York.
Spouse NotesRAWSON's was a noted wheat farmer and his farm was called Wheatland Farm. He was awarded a gold meadal at the first World Fair held in the Crystal Palace near London, England for his display of 35 varieties of wheat all grown on his Wheatland Farm. He served in the War 1812. In 1846 he opened an agricultural school on his farm, of which he was principal.
3 children: Hortense, Antoinette Louise, Norman.
(9) Hortense Harmon9 (Miriam Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1822 , d. 1897 .
m. 16 SEP 1845 John Murdock, b. , d. .
(9) Hortense Harmon9 (Miriam Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1822 , d. 1897 .
m. 2 FEB 1881 Nicholas Keeney, b. , d. .

(10) Walter Wood Goddard10 (Antoinette Louise Harmon9, Miriam Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 APR 1863 , d. .
(10) Paul Rawson Goddard10 (Antoinette Louise Harmon9, Miriam Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 APR 1865 Mumford, Monroe Co., New York, d. 8 JUL 1944 Washington, Tazewell Co., Illinois.

(10) Horace MacIntyre Goddard10 (Antoinette Louise Harmon9, Miriam Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Epaphras Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 JUL 1872 Hastings, Mills Co., Iowa, d. 26 NOV 1936 Corry, Erie Co., Pennsylvania.
NotesHORACE was a printer and newspaper worker. He worked for the Chicago Evening Post, and in the advertising departments of the New York Times and The Annalist in New York City. During WWI he worked for the War Industry Board. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1930 as member #154, residing at Bridgeport, Connecticut.
