m. 26 NOV 1795 Wilbraham, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Aaron Davis, b. , d. .
(6) Mary Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 APR 1742 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 22 APR 1764 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, Jesse Goodell, b. 8 DEC 1738 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 14 JUN 1776 .
Spouse NotesJESSE studied divinity at Yale University and was licensed to preach in 1763. He organized at church at Westminister, Vermont, and was installed as pastor in 1767. "His carer at Westminister was cut short by the discovery of some immoralities in which he had been concerned, and he left town secretly, without a dismission from his office about the first of December, 1769. Mrs. Goodell's brothers are said to have taken her back to their home in Connecticut with her two children. ("Biographical Sketches of the Graduates of Yale College"). He was a chaplain in the Revolutionary Army, and may have died during the War.
3 children: Martha, Thomas, Sarah.
(7) Martha Goodell7 (Mary Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 AUG 1762 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. .
(7) Thomas Goodell7 (Mary Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 AUG 1764 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. .
(7) Sarah Goodell7 (Mary Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 MAY 1767 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. .
(6) Emeline Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 OCT 1744 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 FEB 1745 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Parmenio Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 APR 1746 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 9 JAN 1812 Rome, Oneida Co., New York.
NotesPARMENIO moved to Rome, New York, shortly after his marriage. He had a farm there. However, he appears on the 1790 census at East Windsor, with a family of 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, and 3 females. Information about his family is found in an 1825 Bible, apparently recorded by his daughter, Mary Wolcott Stone.
m. 1767 Wallingford, New Haven Co., Connecticut, Mary Ballard, b. 11 OCT 1750 Lancaster, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 2 MAR 1833 Rome, Oneida Co., New York.
8 children: Alfred, Parmenio, Prudence, , Josiah, Mary "Polly", Prudence, Lydia.
(7) Alfred Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 APR 1769 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 20 NOV 1835 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED came to the Western Reserve, which later became Ohio, in 1796. He had been hired as a surveyor by John Young, the founder of Youngstown. He also surveyed the towns of Canfield and Bristol, for which the Connecticut Land Co. gave him 350 acres of land as payment. He erected the first building in Bristol Township. His marriage to Mary Gilson in 1800 was the first marriage in the county, but the ceremony was actually performed in Pennsylvania as there was no minister in Mahoning County. Mary must have died soon after their marriage, for by 1806 he had bought half of Boston Township in Portage County, and had gone there to clear the ground for his farm, and to build a log house for his new bride, Margaret Craig Wolcott. Alfred was a taxpayer in Portage Co. in 1808. This part of Portage County later became Summit County. Alfred was elected Justice of the Peace in the first election, and also serving as a fence-viewer. His old record book containing all cases that came to him as Justice was in the possession of his great-grandson, Oliver Wolcott, of Copley, Ohio. The Wolcott's daughter Malinda was the first white child born in Boston Township. In 1816 a log schoolhouse was built in the Wolcott neighborhood, and Alfred Wolcott was the first schoolmaster. It is said that there was a tiny school near his home in which he taught as early as 1812. Alfred served in Capt. Rial McArthur's Co. from August to October 1812, during the War of 1812. His will left his land, about 119 acres, to his wife, Margaret, with the exception of a half acre left as a burial ground for the township of Boston, now called the Fairview Cemetery, established in 1890.
m. 1800 Mary Gilson, b. , d. .
1 children: Lydia.
(8) Lydia Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1804 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1 JUN 1834 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesLYDIA died of Tuberculosis, age 32.
m. 23 FEB 1823 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, George Leach, b. 1798 Goshen, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 31 JUL 1853 .
5 children: Clarissa, Eliza, Lydia, Luman George, George.
(9) Clarissa Leach9 (Lydia Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. Allen Ingersoll, b. , d. .
(9) Clarissa Leach9 (Lydia Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. S. Gaylord, b. , d. .
(9) Eliza Leach9 (Lydia Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
(9) Lydia Leach9 (Lydia Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. Conrad Schoch, b. , d. .
1 children: Maud.
(10) Maud Schoch10 (Lydia Leach9, Lydia Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1867 , d. FEB 1948 .
(9) Luman George Leach9 (Lydia Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1829 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 31 JAN 1832 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(9) George Leach9 (Lydia Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. JUN 1833 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 31 JUL 1833 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(7) Alfred Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 APR 1769 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 20 NOV 1835 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED came to the Western Reserve, which later became Ohio, in 1796. He had been hired as a surveyor by John Young, the founder of Youngstown. He also surveyed the towns of Canfield and Bristol, for which the Connecticut Land Co. gave him 350 acres of land as payment. He erected the first building in Bristol Township. His marriage to Mary Gilson in 1800 was the first marriage in the county, but the ceremony was actually performed in Pennsylvania as there was no minister in Mahoning County. Mary must have died soon after their marriage, for by 1806 he had bought half of Boston Township in Portage County, and had gone there to clear the ground for his farm, and to build a log house for his new bride, Margaret Craig Wolcott. Alfred was a taxpayer in Portage Co. in 1808. This part of Portage County later became Summit County. Alfred was elected Justice of the Peace in the first election, and also serving as a fence-viewer. His old record book containing all cases that came to him as Justice was in the possession of his great-grandson, Oliver Wolcott, of Copley, Ohio. The Wolcott's daughter Malinda was the first white child born in Boston Township. In 1816 a log schoolhouse was built in the Wolcott neighborhood, and Alfred Wolcott was the first schoolmaster. It is said that there was a tiny school near his home in which he taught as early as 1812. Alfred served in Capt. Rial McArthur's Co. from August to October 1812, during the War of 1812. His will left his land, about 119 acres, to his wife, Margaret, with the exception of a half acre left as a burial ground for the township of Boston, now called the Fairview Cemetery, established in 1890.
m. 27 MAY 1806 Youngstown, Trumbull Co., Ohio, Margaret Craig, b. 1785 Wheeling, Ohio Co., West Virginia, d. 28 FEB 1863 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
8 children: Malinda, Edytha, Parmenio, Alfred, Josiah, Darius, Mary, Simon Perkins.
(8) Malinda Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 APR 1807 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1878 .
m. 9 OCT 1828 Hudson, Columbia Co., New York, John Sherman Oviatt, b. 18 JUL 1805 Goshen, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 1861 .
Spouse NotesJOHN was the grandson of Samuel Oviatt who hired Alfred Wolcott to survey 4,000 acres in the Western Reserve.
(8) Edytha Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 OCT 1808 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 12 APR 1878 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
m. 10 JAN 1828 , Portage Co., Ohio, Zebulon Stow, b. 8 APR 1802 Middletown, Middlesex Co., Connecticut, d. 28 SEP 1871 Cascade, Kent Co., Michigan.
5 children: Russel J., Alfred Wolcott, Lucy Abiah, L.C., Laura.
(9) Russel J. Stow9 (Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 AUG 1837 , Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
NotesRUSSELL was a table manufacturer at Grand Rapids, Michigan, in 1880, with wife Harriet, and daughter Ella.
m. 27 OCT 1864 Paris Township, Kent Co., Michigan, Harriet H. Henshaw, b. 1 OCT 1846 , Summit Co., Ohio, d. 31 MAY 1918 .
1 children: Ella A..
(10) Ella A. Stow10 (Russel J. Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1869 ,, Michigan, d. .
(9) Alfred Wolcott Stow9 (Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1838 , Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. 8 FEB 1862 Cascade, Kent Co., Michigan, Clara Augusta Beckley, b. 28 AUG 1841 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 18 MAR 1910 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
4 children: Lucy Sarah, Millie Miriam, Julia Augusta, Ralph Albert.
(10) Lucy Sarah Stow10 (Alfred Wolcott Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 NOV 1864 Cascade Township, Kent Co., Michigan, d. .
(10) Millie Miriam Stow10 (Alfred Wolcott Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 DEC 1869 Caledonia, Kent Co., Michigan, d. .
(10) Julia Augusta Stow10 (Alfred Wolcott Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 NOV 1877 Caledonia, Kent Co., Michigan, d. 3 APR 1974 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
(10) Ralph Albert Stow10 (Alfred Wolcott Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAR 1881 Caledonia, Kent Co., Michigan, d. .
(9) Lucy Abiah Stow9 (Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 DEC 1841 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 9 FEB 1904 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
m. 17 DEC 1863 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, William Bellamy, b. 11 AUG 1839 London,, England, d. 18 NOV 1905 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
6 children: Clara Alice, Ida Anna, George Albert, Wilber Everett, William A., Claude C..
(10) Clara Alice Bellamy10 (Lucy Abiah Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 SEP 1864 Cascade Township, Kent Co., Michigan, d. 27 APR 1904 .
(10) Ida Anna Bellamy10 (Lucy Abiah Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 OCT 1869 , d. .
(10) George Albert Bellamy10 (Lucy Abiah Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 SEP 1872 Cascade, Kent Co., Michigan, d. 8 JUL 1960 Chagrin Falls, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesGEORGE graduated from Hiram College and came to Cleveland in 1896. In that year he founded Hiram House, an experimental school and summer camp at Chagrin Falls, near Cleveland. During the first World War he was head of the War Dept's. Committee on Training Camp Activities, charged with establishing recreational facilities for the soldiers. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1926 as member #117, residing at Cleveland, Ohio, and was reccorded as member #84 in 1930, residing at Cleveland. He and Harry Bliis were the founders of the Henry Wolcott Foundation.

"Bellamy's immediate family had little money, and from the day George
left home, he found it necessary to earn his own living. He worked his way
through Hiram College in northeastern Ohio with various selling jobs and
graduated in 1896. The idea of founding a settlement, or neighborhood house in a congested area that would provide various social services to the community, was conceived by Bellamy while still in college. Two years before graduation, he
met Graham Taylor who had just founded the Chicago Commons settlement
and had written the Y.M.C.A. Handbook used by members of a club studying sociological questions at Hiram College. Later Bellamy was to creditTaylor with "the motivation of my life work."4 In the spring of 1896 this club voted to study the need for a social settlement in Cleveland. A quick trip to Cleveland convinced them that the need did in fact exist. In the summer Bellamy and two other members of the club moved to Cleveland to begin a settlement which they named Hiram House because the first
residents were graduates of Hiram College. Four others joined them to
make an initial group of seven residents, or social workers who lived in
the neighborhood they were trying to help. Bellamy's financial resources during the first few years were slender. To finance the fledgling project, he solicited contributions, but the largest amount given by anyone during the first year was $75.00. He rented a
small house which provided only enough space for a nursery and the clubs,
forcing him to find living space across the street. In the spring, the settlement was evicted from its first home because too many people were using
the house and causing too much wear on it, in the opinion of the landlord.
The rent had been paid, but Bellamy had fallen behind in paying salaries, including his own. In order to buy a badly needed suit, he had to take a temporary job collecting pledges for the Anti-Saloon League. By 1898, the settlement in its second location had expanded to includenine clubs, a nursery, and a kindergarten with sixty-five children enrolled.

Also, with incorporation in 1898, the house began to receive gifts from
prominent Cleveland philanthropists, led by Samuel Mather, and in 1899
ground was broken for its own building near Twenty-seventh and Orange.
Bellamy was then at last able to relax secure in the knowledge that Hiram
House was going to have a place where the settlement work could proceed.
To Bellamy and many of his contemporaries, the key to social problems
was the environment--improve the environment and social problems will
be alleviated, or so they thought. Specifically, Bellamy blamed congestion
in the slums for health problems, law-breaking, low morals, and truancy.
In response to these and other social problems, settlements offered facilities
and programs which were intended to be of a remedial nature. They also
supported the rehabilitative efforts of other charities and organizations,
and they became closely connected with the social gospel and progressivemovements. However, from the beginning of the first settlement in the world, Toynbee Hall founded by Samuel Barnett in London, the settlement approach differed from that of other organizations.

"Bellamy was forced to be practical about money matters and did not stay in the public
recreation department. Francis F. Prentiss, chairman of the Hiram House
board, had recognized his financial need. When Bellamy had been offered
the job of secretary of the Playground Association in 1910, Prentiss held
out the possibility of a salary increase and mentioned picking up the deficit
on Bellamy's farm if he would not leave the settlement.16 By the depression years Bellamy's salary reached $7500 plus "other benefits"--Samuel Mather and others also paid for the college education of his daughters. Even so, Bellamy probably made less money than if he had gone into business with his ability as a salesman and fund raiser."


"George Bellamy was a master at the art of fundraising. He once remarked to Francis F. Prentiss, "As a boy, our churchalways used to get me to sell tickets."31 By 1899, Bellamy had gone from selling church tickets to soliciting large sums of money from Samuel Mather and John D. Rockefeller. The list of contributors to Hiram House soon
read like a "Who's Who in Cleveland."
(10) Wilber Everett Bellamy10 (Lucy Abiah Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 SEP 1874 , d. 25 OCT 1881 .
(10) William A. Bellamy10 (Lucy Abiah Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 SEP 1874 , d. .
(10) Claude C. Bellamy10 (Lucy Abiah Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1880 , d. 30 OCT 1881 .
(9) L.C. Stow9 (Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 JAN 1847 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 9 JAN 1922 Greeley, Weld Co., Colorado.

1 children: Bertha.
(10) Bertha Stow10 (L.C. Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 JUL 1875 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio, d. 1948 .
NotesBERTHA joined the Wolcott Society in 1946 as member #329, residing at Hanford, California.
(9) Laura Stow9 (Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 JAN 1849 Stowe, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 27 APR 1937 .
m. 16 APR 1868 Franklin Patterson, b. 5 DEC 1844 , d. .
1 children: Mattie.
(10) Mattie Patterson10 (Laura Stow9, Edytha Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 FEB 1871 Cascade, Kent Co., Michigan, d. .
NotesMATTIE joined the Wolcott Society in 1946 as member #336, residing at St. Petersburg, Florida.
(8) Parmenio Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 MAY 1810 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 17 JUL 1871 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesPARMENIO was a farmer. He was a town trustee of Norfolk, Ohio, from 1862 to 1871. In 1870 Parmenio was at Northfield, Summit Co., Ohio, with Emeline and James M. Wolcott. He purchased a house and land in Summit Co., Ohio, from George Thompson in 1853. It was a stone farmhouse in the Greek Revival style and is now on the Ohio Historic Registry. Three generations of Wolcotts lived here, and operated a cheese factory on the property. It was owned by his son, James, who deeded it to Avis G. Wolcott in 1898. Avis sold it to Henry E. Bourne in 1913.
m. 10 JUN 1835 , Portage Co., Ohio, Emeline Tupper, b. 27 MAY 1815 Parishville, St. Lawrence Co., New York, d. 27 JUN 1894 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesEMELINE lived with her son, James, in 1880.
6 children: Malinda, Alfred Newton, Phoebe Lorette, James Monroe, Daniel, Margaret Lucinda.
(9) Malinda Wolcott9 (Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 DEC 1838 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1907 .
m. 2 JUL 1857 , Summit Co., Ohio, Sylvester P. Ozmun, b. , d. .
3 children: James, Sylvester, Levina.

(9) Alfred Newton Wolcott9 (Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 MAY 1840 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. FEB 1893 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.

Alfred N. Wolcott, 40, born Connecticut, was a carpenter at Boston, Ohio, in 1880. With him was Nellie 35, Eloada 16, Herbert 13, Alice 9, Ara 6, and Arthur 6, all born Ohio.
m. 31 DEC 1863 ,, Ohio, Ella A. "Nellie" Wells, b. 1 JAN 1845 Bedford, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 25 MAR 1900 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
6 children: Elzada M., Herbert Rockwell "Bert", Alice Gertrude, Arthur Lee, Avis Lenore, Herman A..
(10) Elzada M. Wolcott10 (Alfred Newton Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 NOV 1864 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 21 FEB 1936 Macedonia, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesAfter Elzada's divorce, she worked in Cleveland as a housekeeper and a seamtress. Two quilts that she made are in the family of her great granddaughter, Barbara Tatham (1998).
(10) Herbert Rockwell "Bert" Wolcott10 (Alfred Newton Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 JUL 1866 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1 MAY 1924 Cuyahoga Falls, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesHERBERT, his wife, May E., and their son Alfred R. were living with his mother-in-law Sarah Phillips, at Bedford Township, Cuyahoga Co. Ohio, in 1900. Herbert Rockwell Wolcott homesteaded 320 acres of land at McKenzie Co., North Dakota, in 1919, and was a retired rancher when he died 1 May 1924 age 57 yrs., 8 mo., 11 d..
(10) Alice Gertrude Wolcott10 (Alfred Newton Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 APR 1871 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 30 JUN 1944 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(10) Arthur Lee Wolcott10 (Alfred Newton Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 JUN 1874 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 9 JUN 1952 Ravenna, Portage Co., Ohio.
NotesARTHUR was a farmer and raised rabbits.

Arthur Wolcott M
Parent Stella Wolcott F

(10) Herman A. Wolcott10 (Alfred Newton Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 OCT 1881 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 22 AUG 1882 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(9) Phoebe Lorette Wolcott9 (Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 JAN 1843 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 7 NOV 1920 .
m. 4 JAN 1863 , Summit Co., Ohio, Louis Gay, b. 17 APR 1839 Bedford, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. .
Spouse NotesLOUIS was a farmer at Bedford, Ohio, in 1880.
2 children: Hettie E., Lottie.
(10) Hettie E. Gay10 (Phoebe Lorette Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 SEP 1867 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 17 OCT 1954 .
(10) Lottie Gay10 (Phoebe Lorette Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1875 ,, Ohio, d. .
(9) James Monroe Wolcott9 (Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 AUG 1845 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 15 AUG 1892 , Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesJAMES was a farmer in Summit Co., Ohio. He took over his father's farm. In 1880 he was a farmer at Northampton Township, Summit Co., Ohio, with wife Avis 27 and mother Emeline 65. His wife sold the farm in 1913 to the Presbyterian Church, who established a "fresh air camp", known as the Goodrich Social Settlement there.
m. 1880 Northfield-Macedonia Cemetery, Northfield, Summit Co., Ohio, Avis Gertrude Phyle, b. 25 FEB 1852 Macedonia, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 2 APR 1931 Bedford, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
2 children: Henry Monroe, Lewis M..
(10) Henry Monroe Wolcott10 (James Monroe Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 MAR 1884 Northfield, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 26 MAR 1974 Bedford, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
Notes1918 Draft Registration:
Henry Monroe Wolcott , 34, b. 18 Mar 1884 , Bedford, Cuyahoga, Ohio, traffic Maimtenance?, McMyler Intersstate Co., wife Elsie Agnes Wolcott, Bedford, medium height, stout, blue eyes, brown hair.

HENRY joined the Wolcott Society in 1941 as member 237, residing at Bedford, Ohio.
(10) Lewis M. Wolcott10 (James Monroe Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 DEC 1888 Northfield, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 22 FEB 1973 Twinsburg, Summit Co., Ohio.

Lewis M. Wolcott 45 was at Bedford Village, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, in 1930, with wife, Jessie L. 45, and son, Carroll M. 19, all born Ohio.
(9) Daniel Wolcott9 (Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1847 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
(9) Margaret Lucinda Wolcott9 (Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 AUG 1862 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. 17 FEB 1880 , Summit Co., Ohio, Henry Jones, b. , d. .
2 children: Clarence, Lulu.
(10) Clarence Jones10 (Margaret Lucinda Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Lulu Jones10 (Margaret Lucinda Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(8) Alfred Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 JAN 1812 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 17 MAR 1892 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED and his 15 year old wife set up housekeeping in a log cabin on his father's farm at Boston Township, Ohio. The log cabin was replaced by a large farm house, and was expanded into a four hundred acre farm. Alfred served several terms in the Ohio legislature, and he saw to it that those of his children who wished it had a college education and professional training. In 1880 he was at Boston, Ohio, with Mary Ann, John, Anna A., Alfred, and Fremont Wolcott. His farm is now the Boston Mills Golf Course.
m. 18 APR 1831 Mary Ann Scoville, b. 1816 ,, Connecticut, d. 23 JUN 1882 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesMARY came to Hudson, Ohio, with her mother.
11 children: Simon Perkins, Andrew Augustus, George Young, Andrew Augustus, Darius Young, Lucinda Marie, Thomas Darius, John Mead, Anna Augusta, Alfred E., Fremont Charles.
(9) Simon Perkins Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 JAN 1837 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 6 APR 1901 Kent, Portage Co., Ohio.
NotesSIMON graduated from Western Reserve College with an AM degree in 1862. He studied law at Hudson and Akron, Ohio, and was admitted to the bar in Summit County in 1864. He moved to Kent, Ohio, in 1867, where he was an attorney for the Atlantic & Great Western Railroad. In 1870 he was at Franklin, Portage Co., Ohio, with Mary, Nellie, and Jennie Wolcott. He was a personal friend of Presidents McKinley and Garfield. He was City Solicitor for Kent for two terms, a member of the school board for nine years, and a member of the Board of Examiners. For 9 years he was Deputy State Supervisor of Elections for Portage County. Simon was said to have been a great orator. He was elected Mayor of Kent in 1866, and was elected to the Ohio State Senate in 1881 as a Republican, and reelected in 1883. He built a house at 450 West Main St. in Kent, Ohio, in 1869.
m. 17 JUL 1866 Hudson, Summit Co., Ohio, Mary Helen Brewster, b. 29 DEC 1841 Hudson, Summit Co., Ohio, d. JAN 1910 Kent, Portage Co., Ohio.
3 children: Nellie Brewster, Jennie Brewster, Duncan Brewster.
(10) Nellie Brewster Wolcott10 (Simon Perkins Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 FEB 1868 , d. 14 MAY 1955 Akron, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesNELLIE joined the Wolcott Society in 1943 as member #257, residing at Kent, Ohio.
(10) Jennie Brewster Wolcott10 (Simon Perkins Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 MAY 1870 , d. .
(10) Duncan Brewster Wolcott10 (Simon Perkins Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 MAY 1873 Kent, Portage Co., Ohio, d. 14 MAR 1930 Kent, Portage Co., Ohio.
NotesDUNCAN graduated from Adelbert College in 1896, and from the law school of Western Reserve University in 1899 where he was a member of Beta Theta Pi fraternity. He was an attorney in Kent, Ohio, and was Prosecuting Attorney of Portage Co. for six years. He also had an insurance business. He moved to Kent, Ohio, in 1901. In 1906 he moved into the house his father had built on West Main St. Duncan served on the Kent Board of Education from 1918 to 1929, and was a vestryman of Christ Episcopal Church. He spoke at the 1909 Wolcott Reunion at Niagra Falls, was presiding officer at the 1914 reunion, and was President of The Society of Descendants of Henry Wolcott, 1915-1916 and 1921-1922.

1918 Draft Registration
Duncan Brewster Wolcott 45, b. 9 May 1873 White Kent, Portage, Ohio, Attorney at law, Kent OH, kin Mrs. Daisy L. Wolcott, Kent OH, tall , medium build, gray eyes, brown hair.
(9) Andrew Augustus Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 JAN 1839 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 8 DEC 1841 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(9) George Young Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 FEB 1841 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 27 FEB 1841 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(9) Andrew Augustus Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 FEB 1842 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 11 MAY 1862 Strasburg, Shenadoah Co., Virginia.
NotesANDREW enlisted in Co. D, 29th Ohio Inf. Regt. from Summit, Ohio. He also served in Co. H., 20th Ohio Infantry Regt. He died during the war at Strasburg, Virginia. His epitaph says he "died for his country."
(9) Darius Young Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 MAY 1845 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 12 AUG 1849 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(9) Lucinda Marie Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 JUL 1847 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 9 AUG 1849 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(9) Thomas Darius Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 JUL 1850 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 11 AUG 1854 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(9) John Mead Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 APR 1853 Hudson, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1939 Washington, District of Columbia.
NotesJOHN learned to play the drum at age nine, and left home to join his brother, Andrew, who was in the army at Cleveland. His brother put him on the train and sent him home. He attended Western Reserve College, and at age 21 went to Grand Rapids, Michigan, to be a travelling salesman for a furniture manyfacturer. He and his wife lived with her parents at Grand Rapids in 1880. John moved to Washington, D.C., for his wife's health, and went to work for the Post Office, and later the Department of Commerse. He worked for the government for 25 years. He served in the U.S. Navy in both World War I and II. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1917, and was District of Columbia state vice president of the Wolcott Society.

1910 Washington DC

1920 Washington DC
m. 16 OCT 1878 Ada, Kent Co., Michigan, Rose Arabella Woodworth, b. 1855 Ada, Kent Co., Michigan, d. 1931 Washington, District of Columbia.
3 children: Nina, Neil Bernard, John Woodworth.
(10) Nina Wolcott10 (John Mead Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1880 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio, d. .
(10) Neil Bernard Wolcott10 (John Mead Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 APR 1884 , Kent Co., Michigan, d. 19 JAN 1967 North Fort Myers, Lee Co., Florida.
NotesNEIL enlisted in the Naval Reserves in 1917, and turned over to the Navy the cruising yacht owned by him and his brother, John. He was given command of this boat, and did patrol duty at Norfolk, Virginia. In June 1917 he was sent to Annapolis, Maryland, for training, comissioned Ensign, and assigned to the USS Texas. He went to Europe Jan. 1918, was promoted to Lieutenant, and was signal officer, observation officer, and assistant navigation officer on the Texas, before the fleet returnd home. He was sent to London and France as naval attache, and then to Venice as communication officer, and then to Trieste. He was Vice President of Frederic P. Humphries. Inc., naval architects and yacht builders. Neil B. Wolcott and wife, Clara, were living at Red Bank, New Jersey, in 1938. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1947 as member #420, residing at Fairhaven, New Jersey.
(10) John Woodworth Wolcott10 (John Mead Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 FEB 1886 , d. 26 AUG 1954 .
Notes1918 Draft Registration:
John Woodworth Wolcott 32, b. 1 Feb 1886 clerk in cash room, Treasury Dept., Washington, District of Columbia, Mrs. Rose Wolcott, mother, Wash. DC, tall, slender, hazel eyes, light brown hair slightly bald..


JOHN was at Arlington, Virginia, in 1930, with Rosina V., Rose M., and Barbara S. Wolcott.
(9) Anna Augusta Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 FEB 1856 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
(9) Alfred E. Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 MAR 1858 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 8 MAR 1908 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED was a lawyer and a judge at Grand Rapids, Michigan. In 1888 he was a Circuit Court Commissioner. He was a two term Prosecuting Attorney from Kent Co., Michigan in 1892, and from 1900 to 1908 a Circuit Judge of 17th Judicial District of Michigan. He was the first Juvenile Court Judge in the State of Michigan. At the time of his death he was a judge of the Superior Court at Grand Rapids. He was prominent in securing indeterminate sentence laws and parole.

In 1900 he was a curcuit judge at Grand Rapids with Carrie B., Mabel L., and Hazel C. Wolcott.

He gave the principal speech at the third Wolcott reunion at Warren, Ohio, in 1907, and was elected the second President of the Society in that year.
m. 21 OCT 1885 Akron, Summit Co., Ohio, Carrie B. Hauk, b. 17 JUN 1858 Suffield, Portage Co., Ohio, d. 10 NOV 1943 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesCARRIE was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914 residing at Grand Rapids, Michigan.
2 children: Mabel Louise, Hazel Katherine.
(10) Mabel Louise Wolcott10 (Alfred E. Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 JUL 1886 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio, d. .
NotesMABEL was a member of the Wolcott Society 1909-20, residing at Grand Rapids, Michigan.
(10) Hazel Katherine Wolcott10 (Alfred E. Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 DEC 1889 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio, d. 5 APR 1983 .
NotesHAZEL lived in Los Angeles in 1920. She was carried on the roster of the Wolcott Society 1914-17, residing at Grand Rapids, Michigan.
(9) Fremont Charles Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 MAY 1863 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 10 AUG 1895 Canton, Stark Co., Ohio.
NotesFREMONT was a farmer in Summit Co., Ohio. He inherited the family homestead. He moved from Boston to Canton, Ohio in 1892. When he died in 1895, his family moved to Akron.

1910 Akron OH
Metta Walcott 44, b. OH
Lena F Wolcott 23, b. OH, stenographer
Olivar H Wolcott 21, b. OH, clerk, rubber factory
Kenneth W Wolcott 17, b. OH
Mary P Wolcott 15, b. OH
m. 25 NOV 1885 , Summit Co., Ohio, Metta E. "Mettie" Hand, b. 17 JAN 1866 Fairlawn, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 29 MAY 1936 Akron, Summit Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesMETTA wrote poetry. Sh was probably Marietta Hand, born 1866, daughter f W. H. Hand 47, market gardner born New York, and Mary Hand 45 born Ireland, who were at Portage, Summit Co., Ohio in 1880. She attended the 1914 Wolcott reunion at Cleveland, Ohio, with her children, Oliver, Kenneth and Mary.
4 children: Lena Florence, Oliver Hand, Kenneth Wight, Mary Pauline.
(10) Lena Florence Wolcott10 (Fremont Charles Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 AUG 1886 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
(10) Oliver Hand Wolcott10 (Fremont Charles Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 AUG 1888 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 4 DEC 1961 Copley, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesOLIVER was at Summit Co., Ohio, in 1820 with Annette and Fremont. He worked in the rubber industry for 27 years. He was office manager for the Miller Rubber Co., assistant manager of Goodyear Tires' distribution department, and distribution manager for Seiberlings Tires. He retiredin 1960. Oliver began collecting stamps when he was a child, and amasses an impressive collection. He later collected historic letters and documents as well. He owned hundreds of letters written from Civil War battlefields. His collection also contained letters written by President Garfield, one addressed to Simon Perkins Wolcott at Kent, Ohio. Oliver attended the 1914 Wolcott Society reunion with his mother in 1914. He was vice president of the Wolcott Society in 1936, and president in 1937.

1918 Draft Registration:
Oliver Hand Wolcott 28, b. 13 Aug 1888 Boston Twp. OH, lives Akron, Summit, Ohio, office manager, Miller Rubber Co., Akron, tall, medium build, grey eyes, dark hair
(10) Kenneth Wight Wolcott10 (Fremont Charles Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 AUG 1892 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 27 JUN 1959 Elizabeth, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesK. W. Wolcott of Akron, Ohio, attended the Wolcott Society reunion at Cleveland in 1914. Kenneth joined the Society in 1917, residing at Akron. He served with the 334th Field Hospital, 309th Sanitary Train, with the Army Expeditionary Force in France in 1918. He was an outstanding amateur golfer at Akron, Ohio. He was at Akron in 1930, with Doris, Cynthia, and Ellen Wolcott. He moved to Trenton, New Jersey, in 1930. He won the Trenton Country Club Championship 1931 to 1937, 1941, and 1943, and the Frank K. Fischer Cup in 1948-50, and 1954 . The Wolcott Memorial Golf Tournament was named in his honor. He rejoined the Wolcott Society in 1946 as member #321, residing at Trenton, New Jersey.
(10) Mary Pauline Wolcott10 (Fremont Charles Wolcott9, Alfred Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 JUN 1895 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
(8) Josiah Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 FEB 1814 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 15 MAR 1828 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(8) Darius Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 DEC 1816 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 29 AUG 1894 Thompson, Geauga Co., Ohio.
NotesDARIUS and Sophia were at Thompson, Ohio, in 1870. He was appointed a Justice of the Peace at Thompson in 1873. He was a farmer at Thompson, Ohio, in 1880. Buried with him and his wife at Maple Grove Cemetery was Minnie Wolcott, possibly a daughter.
m. 30 APR 1841 , Lorain Co., Ohio, Sophia Simpson, b. 1819 ,, New York, d. 1 OCT 1890 Thompson, Geauga Co., Ohio.
2 children: Mary, Addie.
(9) Mary Wolcott9 (Darius Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1843 ,, Ohio, d. .
m. 14 AUG 1862 , Ashtabula Co., Ohio, Hiram Sanders, b. , d. .
(9) Addie Wolcott9 (Darius Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1849 ,, Ohio, d. 30 JAN 1924 .
m. 11 MAR 1869 Thompson, Geauga Co., Ohio, Rufus Hurlburt, b. 1845 Thompson, Geauga Co., Ohio, d. 10 JUN 1928 .
3 children: Hoyt W., Wade Oakley, John R..

NotesHOYTH was at Thompson, Ohio, 1910-20.
(10) Wade Oakley Hurlbert10 (Addie Wolcott9, Darius Wolcott8, Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 OCT 1876 Thompson, Geauga Co., Ohio, d. 12 JAN 1959 .

Spouse NotesELI was a farmer at Stow, Ohio, in 1880, with wife Mary W..
(8) Simon Perkins Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 AUG 1821 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 26 OCT 1821 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio.
(7) Parmenio Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 DEC 1770 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. ,, New York.
NotesPARMENIO Wolcott, Jr., of Cayuga County, served as ensign in Capt. Ellis' Co., New York militia, in 1810-1812. He was later a farmer at Yorkshire, Cattaraugus Co., New York. In 1840 he moved to Michigan, buying land in Washtenaw and Barry Counties, and living in Washtenaw County. He later returned to New York and resided with his son, Alfred.
m. 9 AUG 1798 Westmoreland, Oneida Co., New York, Anna "Annie" Fulkerson, b. 1779 Freehold, Monmouth Co., New Jersey, d. 24 JUL 1874 Orangeville, Barry Co., Michigan.
Spouse NotesANNA was with her son, Alfred, at Orangeville, Michigan, in 1870. Anna Wolcott, widow, died 1874, Orangeville, Michigan, age 97 years, 8 mo., 10 days.
8 children: Lydia, Laura, Littoria, Alfred, Henry "Harry", Parmenio, Samuel B., Clarinda Matilda.
(8) Lydia Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 APR 1799 ,, New York, d. APR 1870 , Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. DEC 1819 Nicholas Rowe, b. 8 NOV 1778 , Dutchess Co., New York, d. 11 OCT 1841 , Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
(8) Laura Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 JUL 1801 Albany, Albany Co., New York, d. FEB 1861 .
m. 29 NOV 1821 Worcester, Otsego Co., New York, Stephen Vanrensselaer Freeman, b. 25 APR 1801 Albany, Albany Co., New York, d. 10 MAR 1877 LaGrange, Lorain Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesStephen was a carpenter.
10 children: Parmenio Vanrensselaer, Lydia Ann, Dorliska J., George E., Coroden W., Ellen M., Stephen E., Laura Seville, Susan Dorliska, Casius M..
(9) Parmenio Vanrensselaer Freeman9 (Laura Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 JUL 1823 , d. 18 SEP 1889 .

(9) Susan Dorliska Freeman9 (Laura Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 JAN 1844 , d. 4 MAR 1927 Lorain, Lorain Co., Ohio.
m. 16 SEP 1871 Alexander Porter, b. 16 MAR 1843 Lorain, Lorain Co., Ohio, d. 4 JAN 1919 .
(9) Casius M. Freeman9 (Laura Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 MAR 1847 , d. 25 DEC 1848 .
(8) Littoria Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 FEB 1804 ,, New York, d. .
m. 19 DEC 1829 Henry Allen, b. , d. .
(8) Alfred Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 JUN 1806 , Tompkins Co., New York, d. LaGrange, Lorain Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED moved from Tompkins County, New York, to Erie County in 1840, where he had a hotel and a farm. He then had a hotel at Cattaraugus county, New York, for 10 years. He was a farmer at Prairieville, Michigan, in 1850. He was a farmer at Orangeville, Michigan, in 1860, with Mary and Anna, his mother. He was at Prairieville, Michigan in 1870 with Mary H. and Anne. He moved to join his son, William, at La Grange and in 1880 was farming at LaGrange, Ohio.
m. 20 MAR 1834 Mary Henrietta Ledoyt, b. 1834 ,, Connecticut, d. .
1 children: William Franklin.
(9) William Franklin Wolcott9 (Alfred Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 JAN 1835 LaGrange, Lorain Co., Ohio, d. 9 APR 1922 LaGrange, Lorain Co., Ohio.
NotesWILLIAM came to Lorain Co., Ohio, at age 18 and settled at La Grange . About 1859 went to Michigan but didn't like it there and returned to Ohio. He was at Orangeville, Ohio, in 1860, with Melissa and Lewis. He enlisted 25 Aug. 1864 in Btry E, 1st Ohio Lt. Arty. Regt., discharged 10 July 1865. After the war he purchased a hotel which he ran for 10 years. He was at La Grange, Ohio, in 1870 with Melissa, Lewis, and Mary E. Woolcott. He was then a travelling salesman for lightning rods for 5 years. He was a laborer at La Grange, Ohio, in 1880. He was appointed justice of the Peace in 1888. He served as postmaster 1898-1908, and Mayor of LaGrange for 12 years, also city councilman and constable. W. F. Wolcott of LaGrange, Ohio, attended the 1909 Wolcott reunion at Niagara Falls, and was a member in 1914.

William F Wolcott
Birth Date: 15 Jan 1835
Spouse: Malissa Hastings
Marriage Date: 22 Feb 1857
Parents: Alfred and Mary Henrietta Ledoyt
Notes: Civil War Veteran

In the 1840s he and his brother, Samuel, settled in White Oak Twp. Ingham Co., Michigan. They were on the tax rolls there in 1844.

(8) Parmenio Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 JUL 1813 ,, New York, d. Orangeville, Barry Co., Michigan.
NotesPARMENIO was a farmer. In the 1830's he and his brother, Henry, moved to Washtenaw Co., Michigan. In 1837 Parmenio Wolcott Jr. of Washtenaw Co., Michigan, bought 80 acres of federal land in Washtenaw Co.. In the 1840's he settled in Barry Co., Michigan. He was a farmer at Orangeville, Michigan, in 1850 with Azina and Alfred Woolcott. He was living in Michigan in 1863. In 1860 he was a farmer at Orangeville, Barry Co., Michigan, with Alzina L. and Jerome.
m. 15 JAN 1841 , Jackson Co., Michigan, Alzina L. Turner, b. 1816 ,, New York, d. .
1 children: Alfred Jerome "Jerome".

NotesALFRED was a physician.
m. 17 SEP 1868 , Mc Henry Co., Illinois, Anna W. Knapp, b. Bedford, Westchester Co., New York, d. .
2 children: Constance Mary, Jo.

(10) Jo Wolcott10 (Alfred Jerome "Jerome" Wolcott9, Parmenio Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. 1971 .
(8) Samuel B. Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 JUL 1815 ,, New York, d. 16 SEP 1870 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
NotesSAMUEL and his brother, Henry, were among the earliest settlers in White Oak Township, Ingham Co., Michigan. They were on a tax list there in 1844. He was a farmer at Sharon, Washtenaw Co. from 1850 to 1870. In 1860 he was with Marian, Frances, Marian, and Venning.
m. 24 FEB 1849 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, Maria Ellen Matthews, b. 1829 ,, Michigan, d. ABT 1861 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
3 children: Frances, Florence, Venning Dodge,

1 children: Jennie.
(10) Jennie Gillette10 (Florence Wolcott9, Samuel B. Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1877 Tecumseh, Lenawee Co., Michigan, d. .
(9) Venning Dodge Wolcott9 (Samuel B. Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 SEP 1860 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 31 JUL 1929 Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa.
NotesVENNING moved from Michigan to Iowa about 1880. He was at Ida, Iowa, in 1885, with Hattie and Fred Wolcott. He owned the Maple Grove Stock Farm. "His farm comprised 155 acres in the vicinity of Battle Creek, Iowa. His house was a story and a half with an L, and he had two barns. Mr. Wolcott made a specialty of fine horses and secured the best breeds of draft horses. His French Draft, "Captain", a black Percheron, weighed 1,850 pounds, and his French coach was a bay of good style and action." He is buried in the same cemetery with Mabel E. Wolcott 1873-1961, and


Birth: Sep. 16, 1860
Death: Jul. 31, 1929

Venning Dodge Wolcott was born in Sharon, Michigan, Sept. 16. 1860, to Samuel and Maria (Matthews) Wolcott, and died in Battle Creek, Iowa, on July 31, 1929, aged 68 years, 10 months, and 15 days.

On April 9, 1880, he came to Battle Creek and continued this residence here for the past 50 years with the exception of 2 years 1895-6 which he spent in Harrison County, Iowa. It was here that he was married to Mabel F. Lawrence of Magnolia, Iowa, on Dec. 2, 1896.

Mr. Wolcott had been ill many years with kidney trouble. Several years ago one kidney had to be removed, but relief was very temporary as his health had been poor ever since.

He was a member of Perserverance Lodge No. 446, A.F. and A.M. Benevolence Chaper No. 336, O.F.S. Sioux City Consistory Chaptr No 5, Scottish Rite Masons and Abu Bekr Temple of Masonic Order, and was faithful to his duties in order.

Mr. Wolcott owned a farm here which was later made into town lots and residences built and has helped make the town.

Funeral Services were held at the Presbyterian Church Friday, August 2, at 2:30 with Rev. Claude Fausnaugh officiating. Burial was in the Mt. Hope Cemetery, Battle Creek.

Survivors include his widow and 4 children, Fred C. of Audubon, Iowa; D. W. Eugene and Gary of Des Moines, Iowa; and Mrs. Lucille Modrell of Battle Creek, and a host of friends.

Burial:
Mount Hope Cemetery
Battle Creek
Ida County
Iowa, USA
m. 1879 , Ingham Co., Michigan, Harriet J. "Hattie" Teel, b. , d. .
4 children: Fred W., Fred Charlie, W. Eugene "Gene", Gene.
(10) Fred W. Wolcott10 (Venning Dodge Wolcott9, Samuel B. Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1879 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. .
(10) Fred Charlie Wolcott10 (Venning Dodge Wolcott9, Samuel B. Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 JAN 1883 , d. .
Notes1918 Draft Registration:
Fred Charley Wolcott 35, b. 21 Jan 1883 , Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa, farmer, wife Ossie Wolcott, medium height and build, blue eyes, dark hair.

1920 Maple IA
Fred C Wolcott 28, b. IA, farm labor
Ocia H Wolcott 25, b. IA
Leonard E Wolcott 3, b. IA
Hazel G Wolcott 1 6/12
(10) W. Eugene "Gene" Wolcott10 (Venning Dodge Wolcott9, Samuel B. Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 AUG 1881 Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa, d. 3 SEP 1952 Council Bluffs, Pottawattamie Co., Iowa.
NotesEUGENE served at a 1st Lt. in World War I. He received his MD degree from the University of Iowa. In 1928 he established a medical practice in Des Moines. He retired from medical practice and did research at the University of Virginia. He organized a home for crippled children.
(10) Gene Wolcott10 (Venning Dodge Wolcott9, Samuel B. Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(9) Venning Dodge Wolcott9 (Samuel B. Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 SEP 1860 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 31 JUL 1929 Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa.
NotesVENNING moved from Michigan to Iowa about 1880. He was at Ida, Iowa, in 1885, with Hattie and Fred Wolcott. He owned the Maple Grove Stock Farm. "His farm comprised 155 acres in the vicinity of Battle Creek, Iowa. His house was a story and a half with an L, and he had two barns. Mr. Wolcott made a specialty of fine horses and secured the best breeds of draft horses. His French Draft, "Captain", a black Percheron, weighed 1,850 pounds, and his French coach was a bay of good style and action." He is buried in the same cemetery with Mabel E. Wolcott 1873-1961, and


Birth: Sep. 16, 1860
Death: Jul. 31, 1929

Venning Dodge Wolcott was born in Sharon, Michigan, Sept. 16. 1860, to Samuel and Maria (Matthews) Wolcott, and died in Battle Creek, Iowa, on July 31, 1929, aged 68 years, 10 months, and 15 days.

On April 9, 1880, he came to Battle Creek and continued this residence here for the past 50 years with the exception of 2 years 1895-6 which he spent in Harrison County, Iowa. It was here that he was married to Mabel F. Lawrence of Magnolia, Iowa, on Dec. 2, 1896.

Mr. Wolcott had been ill many years with kidney trouble. Several years ago one kidney had to be removed, but relief was very temporary as his health had been poor ever since.

He was a member of Perserverance Lodge No. 446, A.F. and A.M. Benevolence Chaper No. 336, O.F.S. Sioux City Consistory Chaptr No 5, Scottish Rite Masons and Abu Bekr Temple of Masonic Order, and was faithful to his duties in order.

Mr. Wolcott owned a farm here which was later made into town lots and residences built and has helped make the town.

Funeral Services were held at the Presbyterian Church Friday, August 2, at 2:30 with Rev. Claude Fausnaugh officiating. Burial was in the Mt. Hope Cemetery, Battle Creek.

Survivors include his widow and 4 children, Fred C. of Audubon, Iowa; D. W. Eugene and Gary of Des Moines, Iowa; and Mrs. Lucille Modrell of Battle Creek, and a host of friends.

Burial:
Mount Hope Cemetery
Battle Creek
Ida County
Iowa, USA
m. 2 DEC 1896 Magnolia, Harrison Co., Iowa, Mabel Emma Lawrence, b. 18 DEC 1873 Magnolia, Harrison Co., Iowa, d. 23 AUG 1961 Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa.
2 children: Lucille June, Gary Venning.
(10) Lucille June Wolcott10 (Venning Dodge Wolcott9, Samuel B. Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JUN 1900 Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa, d. 29 AUG 1964 Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa.
NotesLucille June (Wolcott) Modrell, daughter of W.D. and Mabel Lawrence Wolcott, was born at Battle Creek, Iowa, June 29, 1900, and passed away Aug. 27, 1964.

She graduated from Battle Creek High School in 1918, was a student at Morningside College, and became a rural school teacher.

She married John Samuel Modrell Feb. 14, 1923. They had 2 children, Delores and John Modrell, Jr.

Preceding her in death was one son, as an infant in 1931.
(10) Gary Venning Wolcott10 (Venning Dodge Wolcott9, Samuel B. Wolcott8, Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 JUL 1902 ,, Iowa, d. 20 OCT 1994 Onawa, Monona Co., Iowa.
NotesGARY was at Des Moines, Iowa, in 1930.
(8) Samuel B. Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 JUL 1815 ,, New York, d. 16 SEP 1870 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
NotesSAMUEL and his brother, Henry, were among the earliest settlers in White Oak Township, Ingham Co., Michigan. They were on a tax list there in 1844. He was a farmer at Sharon, Washtenaw Co. from 1850 to 1870. In 1860 he was with Marian, Frances, Marian, and Venning.
m. 12 APR 1866 , Washtenaw Co., Michigan, Sarah A. Ames, b. 1820 ,, New York, d. .
(8) Clarinda Matilda Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 AUG 1819 ,, New York, d. .
(7) Prudence Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 AUG 1772 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 2 AUG 1776 Rome, Oneida Co., New York.
(7) Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1774 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. INFANT Rome, Oneida Co., New York.
(7) Josiah Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 APR 1776 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 27 AUG 1797 Rome, Oneida Co., New York.
(7) Mary "Polly" Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 OCT 1778 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 27 JAN 1856 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
m. 17 DEC 1802 Nathan Stone, b. 14 OCT 1780 Brimfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 18 APR 1851 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
Spouse NotesNATHAN was a stone and brick mason, and a farmer. He settled at Homer, New York shortly after 1800. In 1820 he was elected a deacon of the Congregational Church. The Stone/Wolcott Bible, printed in 1825, was in the possession of Porter Bennett of Cortland, New York. He was at Homer, New York, in 1850, with Mary 71, Haydern 39, Vernon27, and Emily.
8 children: Hadassah, Melissa, Josiah Wolcott, Hadassah, Almira, Alphonso, Emily A., Vernon Thompson.
(8) Hadassah Stone8 (Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 SEP 1803 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 25 NOV 1806 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
(8) Melissa Stone8 (Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 DEC 1805 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 5 JUL 1883 .
m. APR 1835 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, David Corey, b. 14 MAY 1798 , d. 16 AUG 1874 .
3 children: David Brainerd, Benjamin, Nathan Stone.
(9) David Brainerd Corey9 (Melissa Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 SEP 1837 , d. 9 JAN 1877 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesDavid B. Corey was a partner of Augustus H. Bennett until he died an untimely death in 1877.
m. Frances M. Benedict, b. 17 JUN 1844 , d. 11 MAY 1917 .
(9) Benjamin Corey9 (Melissa Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 SEP 1839 , d. 8 MAR 1843 .
(9) Nathan Stone Corey9 (Melissa Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 MAR 1845 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 29 MAY 1885 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
(8) Josiah Wolcott Stone8 (Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 OCT 1807 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 10 MAY 1877 Glen Haven, Cayuga Co., New York.
NotesJOSIAH was a wagon maker, foundry worker and furnace maker. His obituary says his early years spent on his father's farm east of Homer. He learned wagon manufacturing from Mr. David Coye. Then he removed to Phelps, Ontario Co. where he resided 2 or 3 years. Immediately after his marriage in 1835, he returned to Homer and went into business with Mr. Coye and lived on Pine St. In 1838 removed to Moravia where he stayed until spring of 1853, when he returned to Homer and went into the foundry business with his brother Alphonso until 1872. He joined the Homer Congregational church in 1856. In 1873 he built a house on Main St. He was trustee of the First Religious Society of Homer.
m. FEB 1835 ,, New York, Elizabeth Ringer, b. 1816 , Ontario Co., New York, d. 21 JAN 1857 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
Spouse NotesElizabeth Ringer's surname has also been found as Rieger and Resger.
(8) Josiah Wolcott Stone8 (Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 OCT 1807 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 10 MAY 1877 Glen Haven, Cayuga Co., New York.
NotesJOSIAH was a wagon maker, foundry worker and furnace maker. His obituary says his early years spent on his father's farm east of Homer. He learned wagon manufacturing from Mr. David Coye. Then he removed to Phelps, Ontario Co. where he resided 2 or 3 years. Immediately after his marriage in 1835, he returned to Homer and went into business with Mr. Coye and lived on Pine St. In 1838 removed to Moravia where he stayed until spring of 1853, when he returned to Homer and went into the foundry business with his brother Alphonso until 1872. He joined the Homer Congregational church in 1856. In 1873 he built a house on Main St. He was trustee of the First Religious Society of Homer.
m. 2 FEB 1859 Marie Antoninette Whitney, b. 1824 , d. 28 AUG 1907 Syracuse, Onondaga Co., New York.
1 children: Mary Elizabeth.

m. 10 NOV 1886 Cortland, Cortland Co., New York, Arthur Lyon Hoesen, b. , d. .
2 children: Margaret, Helen.
(10) Margaret Hoesen10 (Mary Elizabeth Stone9, Josiah Wolcott Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Helen Hoesen10 (Mary Elizabeth Stone9, Josiah Wolcott Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(8) Hadassah Stone8 (Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 DEC 1810 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 17 JAN 1853 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesHadassah was a school teacher in Dist. No. 10. She never married.
(8) Almira Stone8 (Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 MAR 1815 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 3 NOV 1879 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesALMIRA and her brothers, Josiah and Vernon, were charter member of the Congregational Church at Homer in 185.
m. 5 APR 1837 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, Lorenzo Bennett, b. 19 MAR 1812 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 9 JUL 1891 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
Spouse NotesLORENZO attended Cortland Academy at Homer and was a school teacher in New Jersey. In 1845 he established a business selling shoes.
4 children: Cleora Melissa, Augustus Henry, Mary Hadassah, Edward Lorenzo.
(9) Cleora Melissa Bennett9 (Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 APR 1838 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 2 DEC 1906 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesCleora Melissa Bennett was a graduate of Homer Academy in 1857. She belonged to the Congregational Church. She and her husband had no children of their own but many of her nieces and cousins used to stay with them, especially during summer vacations. She was "Aunt Coe" to the family.
m. 22 MAY 1862 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, Porter C. Kingsbury, b. 8 JUL 1833 , d. 17 MAR 1910 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
Spouse NotesPorter was a dry goods merchant.
(9) Augustus Henry Bennett9 (Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 APR 1840 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 25 MAY 1904 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesAUGUSTUS was a merchant and President of the Homer Bank. He was Treasurer of the Homer Village, and a member of the school board there.
m. 27 JUN 1866 Albany, Albany Co., New York, Emma Gertrude Pratt, b. 20 SEP 1843 Pratts Hollow, Madison Co., New York, d. 5 JUN 1911 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
5 children: Adeline Castle, Lester Pratt, Edward Lorenzo, Frederick Vernon, Ralph Stone.
(10) Adeline Castle Bennett10 (Augustus Henry Bennett9, Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 DEC 1867 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 10 MAY 1942 San Diego, San Diego Co., California.
(10) Lester Pratt Bennett10 (Augustus Henry Bennett9, Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 JAN 1870 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 9 JUN 1930 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
(10) Edward Lorenzo Bennett10 (Augustus Henry Bennett9, Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 JAN 1872 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 25 AUG 1872 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
(10) Frederick Vernon Bennett10 (Augustus Henry Bennett9, Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 MAY 1873 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 1 NOV 1952 West Palm Beach, Palm Beach Co., Florida.
NotesThe Bennett family moved to Minnesota to run the Eckenberg Company. The company made Teko Pancake Flour and malted milk and was later sold to Borden Company. Fred was in Palm Beach on vacation when he was involved in a fatal accident.
(10) Ralph Stone Bennett10 (Augustus Henry Bennett9, Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 OCT 1880 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 15 SEP 1956 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
(9) Mary Hadassah Bennett9 (Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 JAN 1845 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 3 FEB 1907 Albany, Albany Co., New York.
m. 11 NOV 1868 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, Benjamin William Johnson, b. 16 JUN 1844 , d. 9 OCT 1914 Albany, Albany Co., New York.
Spouse NotesBenjamin was a Treasurer in a bank.
3 children: Florence Bennett, Benjamin Robert, Harriet B. "Hattie".
(10) Florence Bennett Johnson10 (Mary Hadassah Bennett9, Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 SEP 1872 Albany, Albany Co., New York, d. 3 JUN 1949 Washington, District of Columbia.
(10) Benjamin Robert Johnson10 (Mary Hadassah Bennett9, Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 DEC 1874 Albany, Albany Co., New York, d. 9 MAY 1952 Washington, District of Columbia.
NotesBenjamin was a Patent lawyer in Washington, DC and never married.
(10) Harriet B. "Hattie" Johnson10 (Mary Hadassah Bennett9, Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 OCT 1876 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 22 MAR 1923 Washington, District of Columbia.
(9) Edward Lorenzo Bennett9 (Almira Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 FEB 1851 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 3 SEP 1852 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
(8) Alphonso Stone8 (Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 APR 1818 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 23 MAR 1885 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesAlphonso, for many years operated the Stone foundry on South Main Street, inconjunction with his sons, C.C. & L.A. Stone.
m. 2 OCT 1850 Auburn, Cayuga Co., New York, Maria Mariah A. Beach, b. 25 AUG 1820 ,, New York, d. 9 DEC 1905 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
5 children: Charles C., Louis A., Eliott L., Florence, Frank Eugene.

m. 13 MAR 1873 Methodist Church, Cuyler, Cortland Co., New York, Emma E. Hoyt, b. JUL 1854 ,, New York, d. 1928 .
4 children: Bertha M., Florence E., Mabel B., Olive B..

(10) Olive B. Stone10 (Charles C. Stone9, Alphonso Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. MAY 1886 ,, New York, d. .
(9) Louis A. Stone9 (Alphonso Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1855 ,, New York, d. 15 NOV 1896 ,, New York.
m. 27 JUN 1887 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, Anna Staats, b. ABT 1860 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 3 JAN 1927 .
(9) Eliott L. Stone9 (Alphonso Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1857 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 18 MAY 1933 Auburn, Cayuga Co., New York.
NotesElliott was a lawyer. He resided in Syracuse, New York for 20 years after leaving Homer, New York. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1915, residing at Syracuse.
(9) Florence Stone9 (Alphonso Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1859 ,, New York, d. 1859 ,, New York.
(9) Frank Eugene Stone9 (Alphonso Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ,, New York, d. 20 SEP 1933 Skaneateles, Cayuga Co., New York.
NotesFRANK was a lawyer at Skaneateles. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1915 residing at Skaneateles.
(8) Emily A. Stone8 (Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1824 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 2 AUG 1903 .
(8) Vernon Thompson Stone8 (Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 FEB 1824 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 12 DEC 1900 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesVernon Thompson Stone was born on the farm east of Homervillage on Feb 6, 1824. He was educated at Cortland Academy and spent his entire live in Homer with the exception of two years spent in Hamilton, Canada and two years in Aurora, Illionis. He was married July 20, 1847 to Miss Emily Eliott. He was engaged in the mercantile business for some years with George J.J. Barber and C.O. Newton and also in the manufacture of wagons and other business enterprises. He was VP of Homer National Bank from its organization. He served as supervisor of Homer, superintendant of the poor from 1887-1890, village trustee, etc. He was a member of the board of education of Homer Academy. He was a member of the Congregational Church of Homer.
Vernon Stone's will contains the following information: "Vernon T. Stone of Homer gives to Glenwood Cemetery $150 in trust for care for his lot. To Mrs. Jennetta Cutway, niece of my wife Emily, of Tonawanda, Erie Co. NY $5 00. Remainder to wife Emily A. Stone for her life. After death of wife he gives to daughter Lottie M. Schermerhorn of Homer $5000 and remainder of his personal estate. If she is not living, the $5000 to go to adopted daughter. After deaths of wife and adopted daughter, gives to nephew Charles L. Stone of Homer $500 and residue of personal estate. To nephew Agustus H. Bennett and to nephew Eliot L. Stone of Homer and to niece May E. Van Hoesen, wife of Arthur Van Hoesen of Syracuse, NY. If Augustus Bennett not living, then to Lester P. Bennett and Frederick V. Bennett sons of Augustus. Wife Emily A. Stone and Augustus H. Bennett executors. After death of wife, adopted daugther, Dottie M. Schermerhorn in place of wife." 6 Jan 1899. Wit: S.S. Knox and Charles F. Brown residents of Cortland, NY. Codicil. Revokes bequest to Jennie Cutway. 3 Nov 1899. Wit: S.S. Knox and L.P. Hollenbeck of Cortland, NY.
m. 20 AUG 1847 Emily A. Elliott, b. 16 OCT 1823 ,, New York, d. 2 AUG 1903 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
Spouse NotesEmily Stone's will says: Emily A. Stone of Homer. "All to husband. After death of husband, to adopted daughter Lottie M. Schermerhorn. If Lottie dead, then to niece Mollie Brown of Suceltomt[?], Nevada Co. CA and Mary E. Von Hoesen, niece of husband of Syracuse, NY. Husband to be executor, or if he is death, Augustus H. Bennett, and Lottie M. Schermerhorn, executors."
2 children: Charlotte M. "Lottie", Frederick B..
(9) Charlotte M. "Lottie" Stone9 (Vernon Thompson Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1851 , d. .
m. BEF 1896 Schermerhorn, b. , d. .
(9) Frederick B. Stone9 (Vernon Thompson Stone8, Mary "Polly" Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 SEP 1854 Cortland, Cortland Co., New York, d. 1860 .
(7) Prudence Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 MAY 1789 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 28 NOV 1869 .
m. 1811 Chauncey Keep, b. 5 NOV 1784 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 OCT 1853 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
Spouse NotesCHAUNCEY was one of the first Trustees of Cortland Academy in 1819 . He was a Whig and was elected a member of the New York State legislature in 1830 and again in 1836. Chauncey and his wife, Prudence, were 4th cousins.
9 children: William, Sophia, Mary Wolcott, Chauncey, Henry, Charles, Albert, Augustus, George R..
(8) William Keep8 (Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 MAY 1812 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 29 JUL 1865 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York.
m. AUG 1841 Frances Rhoads, b. , d. MAY 1878 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York.
5 children: Sarah Rhoades, William Fleming, Frances Rhoades, Frederick Augustus, Alice Rose.

(9) Frederick Augustus Keep9 (William Keep8, Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAR 1854 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. .
(9) Alice Rose Keep9 (William Keep8, Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 OCT 1857 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. .
m. NOV 1883 Watson F. Blair, b. Of Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. .
Spouse NotesWATSON lived at Chicago, where he was President of the Chicago Club.
4 children: Beatrice, Alice, Watson F., Wolcott.
(10) Beatrice Blair10 (Alice Rose Keep9, William Keep8, Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. 1888 .
(10) Alice Blair10 (Alice Rose Keep9, William Keep8, Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. 1888 .
(10) Watson F. Blair10 (Alice Rose Keep9, William Keep8, Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Wolcott Blair10 (Alice Rose Keep9, William Keep8, Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. Of Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesWOLCOTT is described in the announcement of his wedding as "heir to a considerable fortune. He is a Polo enthusiast and acted as host to the Prince of Wales when the latter visited Chicago a year ago". In 1930, Mr. and Mrs. Wolcott Blair were living at the Ritz Tower, in New York City and were listed in the Social Register.

NotesEDWARD graduated from Harvard University in 1885.
m. FEB 1895 Paris, Seine, France, Edith Smalley, b. London,, England, d. .
(8) Henry Keep8 (Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 OCT 1820 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 4 MAY 1897 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
NotesHENRY graduated from Union College in Schenectady, New York in 1839, and practiced law for several years. He was a partner with Philander Peck and Albert Keep in a dry goods business in Whitewater, Wiscosin. Im 1851 he opened a similar business in Chicago, called Peck, Keep & Co.
m. 5 MAY 1846 Phebe McClure, b. , d. 15 NOV 1896 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
3 children: Dora, Mary Wolcott, Chauncey.

NotesCHARLES graduated from Harvard University in 1882 and the law school in 1885. He served as a Assistant Secretary of Treasury under President Theodore Roosevelt from 1903-1907.

(9) Roger Wolcott Keep9 (Charles Keep8, Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 OCT 1865 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. 5 JUN 1897 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York.
NotesROGER graduated from Harvard University in 1887. Ten years later after extensive travel, both here and abroad, he took his own life with a shot throught the heart.
(8) Albert Keep8 (Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 APR 1826 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 1908 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
NotesALBERT came from Fredonia to Whitewater with his brother, Henry, in 1847. He formed a parnership with Philander Keep to operate a retail business. In 1851 Peek & Keep entered the wholsale dry goods trade at Chicago. In 1856 Albert turned to real estate, and was hired to secure a right of way through Chicago for the Chicago & Nothwestern Railroad. He became a director of the railroad in 1865, and became President of the Chicago & Northwestern Railroad in 1883.
m. 6 APR 1853 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, Susan A. Williams, b. , d. 29 NOV 1859 .
(8) Albert Keep8 (Prudence Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 APR 1826 Homer, Cortland Co., New York, d. 1908 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
NotesALBERT came from Fredonia to Whitewater with his brother, Henry, in 1847. He formed a parnership with Philander Keep to operate a retail business. In 1851 Peek & Keep entered the wholsale dry goods trade at Chicago. In 1856 Albert turned to real estate, and was hired to secure a right of way through Chicago for the Chicago & Nothwestern Railroad. He became a director of the railroad in 1865, and became President of the Chicago & Northwestern Railroad in 1883.

(6) Amelia Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 OCT 1750 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Carlisle, Schoharie Co., New York.
m. 30 MAY 1771 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Marvin Lord, b. 19 JUL 1748 Lyme, Middlesex Co., Connecticut, d. 2 MAY 1801 Lyme, Middlesex Co., Connecticut.
9 children: Roger Wolcott, Emelia, Sophas, Marvin, Mary, Marvin, Ursula, Betsey, Tryphena.
(7) Roger Wolcott Lord7 (Amelia Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 JAN 1778 Lyme, Middlesex Co., Connecticut, d. .
NotesROGER came from New London, Connecticut to Carlisle, New York, where he purchased a farm. He opened an inn and tavern in 1804. He married a grandaughter of Gov. Roger Sherman. "But the loss of property and love of ardent spirits brought him down to poverty in a few years, and he became dependant upon his four sisters, who followed him in a short time and established themselves as milliners, the first in town.... hen the shop was dull they taught school and gave lessons in fancy work, and were active in church work.

John L. Lord, age 55, was at Schoharie in 1855
m. Sherman, b. , d. .
(7) Emelia Lord7 (Amelia Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 FEB 1780 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. .
