MOTH Harriet E Wolcott F 78y Ohio
m. SEP 1892 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, Harriet Wright "Hattie" Baldwin, b. 4 MAR 1867 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 12 JAN 1951 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio.
5 children: Arthur Baldwin, Francis Bryan, Donald Treat, Robert Lemuel, Louis Porter.
(10) Arthur Baldwin Wolcott10 (Bryan Treat Wolcott9, Lemuel Porter Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 APR 1894 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1 OCT 1982 Navarre, Stark Co., Ohio.
NotesARTHUR graduated from the agriculture school at Ohio State University. Following his father's death in 1923, he went home to farm the family farm until he sold it about 1960.
(10) Francis Bryan Wolcott10 (Bryan Treat Wolcott9, Lemuel Porter Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 MAY 1895 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 16 JUL 1973 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesFRANCIS' obituary appeare in the Akron Beacon Journal: "At the age of 54 he walked from Tallmadge Circle to Akron during the record 1950 snowstorm to open the doors of the Akron National Bank. That was the kind of dedication that marked the 47 year banking career of Francis B. Wolcott, retired executive vice president of the bank. Mr. Wolcott died early today at his home 22 Northwest av. after a one-year illness. He was 78. Banking was the lifetime love of Wolcott who joined the National City Bank as a statement clerk in 1916. He retired in 1963. Wolcott was the fifth generation of a family which helped settle Tallmadge, but he showed no liking for farming. Instead he got a sales job with B. F. Goodrich in Akron and after six months joined the National City bank. Over the years he served as a vice president for five Akron banking institutions including the National City, First Central Trust, Bank of Akron and Akron Dime. He worked in almost every phase of the business. Wolcott preferred banking to working on the family farm which was founded by his great-great-grandfather in 1817. He took time off in World War I to serve with the 77th Division in a field artillery unit. In 1920 he lived at Akron, where he joined the Wolcott Society. At National City he was successively a teller, bookkeeper, assistant casier and a vice president. His friend J. Penfield Seiberling, former president of Seiberling Rubber once said Wolcott knows more about banking than anyone in Akron. Wolcott helped shape Akron banking development as he watched the city grow from a farm machinery center into the worlds rubber capital. He was with First Central when the stock market crashed in 1929 and remembered the 1933 bank holiday when President Roosevelt closed the nations banks. Wolcott stayed with First Central nine years while the State liquidated the troubled banks assets. We never lost faith in the country and its ability to bounce back, Wolcott said then. When it was all over First Central paid off its obligations 100 cents on the dollar. In 1942 Wolcott went with the Bank of Akron as a vice president. He later was named its first executive vice president and kept that title when Dime Bank was merged with the Bank of Akron in 1960. He once said he devoted most of his time to reading banking publications and had no time for fiction and other light reading. After living in Cuyahoga Falls 25 years, Wolcott returned to his native Tallmadge in 1949 to remodel the original Tallmadge Congregational Church parsonage near the circle, one of the few remaining old homes in the city. In 1940 the Wolcotts repurchased the farm belonging to an original family settler Guy Wolcott on N. Monroe Rd. in Tallmadge. The place was adjacent to the family farm where Wolcott was born and raised. He enjoyed being a gentleman farmer until the buildings were destroyed by fire in 1953. In 1954 he was chief coordinator of financing when a new church parish house was built. It is now the Tallmadge Municipal Building. Wolcott was church treasurer for many years and was active in the celebration of Tallmadges sesquicentennial in 1957. He was a graduate of Tallmadge High School; the Board of the Tallmadge Historical Society; Tallmadge Lions Club. Congregational Church, past president of the Tallmadge Alumni Association and was treasurer of the Tallmadge Business & Industrial Commission. His wife Florence died in May, 1972, shortly after they celebrated their 55th wedding anniversary." He was probably the Francis B. Wolcott who joined the Wolcott Society in 1920 as member #40.
(10) Donald Treat Wolcott10 (Bryan Treat Wolcott9, Lemuel Porter Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 JUN 1897 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1 MAR 1976 Chesterland, Geauga Co., Ohio.
NotesDONALD was in the wholesale grocery business at Tallmadge, Ohio. He was there in 1930, with Ethel G., Helen D., Brice G. Wolcott.
(10) Robert Lemuel Wolcott10 (Bryan Treat Wolcott9, Lemuel Porter Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 JUL 1898 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 13 DEC 1991 Kent, Portage Co., Ohio.
NotesROBERT was at Talmadge Township, Ohio, in 1930, with Emma E., Robert F., and Matilyn Wolcott. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1977 as member #1080, residing at Kent, Ohio.

Obituary: "Kent - Robert L. Wolcott, 93, of Munroe Falls Rd., died Friday at Robinson Memorial Hospital. He was born July 3, 1898 in Tallmadge to Bryan and Harriet (Baldwin) Wolcott. He was a former employee of the Summit Wholesale Grocery in Akron, then he was a farmer in Randolph from 1942 - 1975. He was a descendant of the early settlers of Tallmadge and a life member of Tallmadge Congregational Church. He was a past member of the Randolph Farm Bureau Council, Randolph Hayseed Club and the Tallmadge AARP. He is survied by his sons, Robert F. of Beaumont, Texas, and Richard A. of Manhattan Beach, Calif.; daughters, Marilyn D. Kilgore of Tallmadge and Margery L. Balthis of Kent; 17 grandchildren and 24 great- grandchildren. He was preceded in death by his wife, Emma E. (Atwater) in 1973 and by his four brothers.... Burial at Hillside Cemetery in Randolph."
(10) Louis Porter Wolcott10 (Bryan Treat Wolcott9, Lemuel Porter Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 MAY 1903 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 4 SEP 1977 Bonita Springs, Le Co., Florida.
NotesLOUIS was in a real estate agent and owned a real estate firm in Akron, Ohio.
(8) Elizur V. Wolcott8 (Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 JUL 1833 Tallmadge, Portage Co., Ohio, d. 20 DEC 1873 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesELIZUR was a student at the Western Reserve College in 1850, and graduated from Yale in 1854. He became a tutor at Western Reserve College in 1856. In 1857 he entered Andover Theological Seminary. Due to failing health he left the seminary before completing his studies. He bought the Pierce farm, and live there until his death. In 1870 he was at Tallmadge, Ohio, with Clara P., and Byron and his mother, Annie Wolcott.
m. 29 NOV 1860 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, Fannie L. Pierce, b. 1834 Woodbury, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 23 SEP 1906 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesFANNY P. Wolcott was Tallmadge, Ohio, in 1880, with Clara P., Kate E., Emily P., and Josephine M. Wolcott. Her mother, Jan P. Sackett, was living with her. Her second husband was minister at Tallmadge at the time her husband died.
4 children: Clara Pierce, Kate Eloise, Emily Porter, Josephine Minor.
(9) Clara Pierce Wolcott9 (Elizur V. Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 DEC 1861 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 6 NOV 1944 Ormond Beach, Volusia Co., Florida.
NotesCLARA attended design school at Cleveland and worked for a furniture manufacturer before moving to New York City to attend the Metropolitan Museum of Art School. By 1888 she was a designer and glass mosiac worker for the Tiffany Studios in New York City. In 1898 she became head of the Glass Mosaic Department which supervised women who created some of Tiffany's best known glass objects. She won an award for a dragonfly lampshade design at the 1900 Paris Arts Exhibition. An exhibition focused around her work and papers was put on by the New York Historical Society Feb. - May 2007.
m. 28 NOV 1889 New York City, New York, Francis S. Driscoll, b. , d. 21 FEB 1892 .
(9) Clara Pierce Wolcott9 (Elizur V. Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 DEC 1861 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 6 NOV 1944 Ormond Beach, Volusia Co., Florida.
NotesCLARA attended design school at Cleveland and worked for a furniture manufacturer before moving to New York City to attend the Metropolitan Museum of Art School. By 1888 she was a designer and glass mosiac worker for the Tiffany Studios in New York City. In 1898 she became head of the Glass Mosaic Department which supervised women who created some of Tiffany's best known glass objects. She won an award for a dragonfly lampshade design at the 1900 Paris Arts Exhibition. An exhibition focused around her work and papers was put on by the New York Historical Society Feb. - May 2007.
m. 1 SEP 1909 Montclaire, Essex Co., New Jersey, Edward A. Booth, b. , d. .
(9) Kate Eloise Wolcott9 (Elizur V. Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 DEC 1863 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 8 FEB 1903 .
(9) Emily Porter Wolcott9 (Elizur V. Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 OCT 1866 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 8 DEC 1953 .
NotesEMILY's letter have been published in a book by Elizabeth A. Yeargin, entitled "The Pierce and Wolcott Letters". Emily never married. In 1880 she lived with Rev. Jonathan Upton, brother-in-law of her aunt. She studied at Mt. Holyoke and taught school at Baltimore, Maryland, and Akron, Ohio. She then attended Michigan State University at Ann Arbor, Michigan, and taught school in New York City for most of the rest of her life.
(9) Josephine Minor Wolcott9 (Elizur V. Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 OCT 1871 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 22 APR 1896 .
(8) Eleanor Wolcott8 (Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 JUL 1833 Tallmadge, Portage Co., Ohio, d. 14 JUL 1834 Tallmadge, Portage Co., Ohio.
(8) Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8 (Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 FEB 1837 Tallmadge, Portage Co., Ohio, d. 8 MAY 1896 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska.
NotesFRANKLIN went to Nebraska in 1856. He took up 160 acres of land in Center Precinct, where he engaged in real estate and loaning money for 7 years. He returned to Ohio in 1862, and married. He purchased 220 acres of land near Weeping Water in 1864. In the fall of 1864 he moved West, shipping some sheep and cattle to Ottumwa, Iowa, where the railroad then ended. He drove the livestock overland, while his new wife continued by stage coach to the Missouri River. They crossed the river to Patsmouth on a flatboat. Then continue on to Nebraska, and lived in the second floor of the log cabin of Philander Beardsley, in Cass Co., a mile west of the present town of Weeping Water. They built a small log cabin, and a short time later built a frame house in front of it. He was elected to the Nebraska House of Representatives in 1870. Frank M. Wolcott was at Weeping Water in 1870, with wife Henrietta and daughters Lucy R. and Creda A. Wolcott. In 1880 Franklin became the county agent for the B & M Railroad Land Department Company in Cass and Otoe counties, showing the company's land grant lands to newly arrived pioneers and acting as real estate agent. In 1881 he was appointed notary public. Frank was instrumental in building the first church in Weeping Water. It later became the Weeping Water Academy, of which his daughter, Lucy, was in the second graduating class, in 1889. He died of a stroke while resting on a creek bank. His son, Lloyd, thought his father's middle name was Marshall, rather than Maginnis.
m. 10 MAY 1864 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, Henrietta M. Brooks, b. 14 AUG 1845 New Rochelle, Westchester Co., New York, d. 16 FEB 1925 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska.
Spouse NotesHENRIETTA was sent to be raised by an aunt at Talmadge, Ohio, when her mother died. She joined the First Congregational Church at Weeping Water, Iowa in 1865. "My grandmother was so afraid of the Indians. She came as a young and sheltered girl to Nebraska, and was little prepared for the life on the frontier. As I remember it they were the second family to move to this neighborhood and formed the town of Weeping Water. There were few trees at the time and she often told how Mr. Wolcott went out and planted the maple trees that edged their property by lantern light. The Indians would come up from the creek where they camped to her cabin door and beg for food. They were not particularily dangerous in that neighborhood, but seemed so dirty and terrible. At that time Plattsmouth was the nearest town; twenty-two miles over the trails meant a two day journey for all provisions." - from granddaughter, Jeanette Teegarden.
3 children: Lucy Rowena, Creda Annis, Lloyd Porter.
(9) Lucy Rowena Wolcott9 (Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 DEC 1868 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. 7 MAY 1898 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska.
m. 28 SEP 1892 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, Isaac William Teegarden, b. 10 MAR 1866 , Columbiana Co., Ohio, d. 25 SEP 1943 Long Beach, Los Angeles Co., California.
2 children: Jeanette, Lucy Wolcott.
(10) Jeanette Teegarden10 (Lucy Rowena Wolcott9, Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 AUG 1895 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. .
(10) Lucy Wolcott Teegarden10 (Lucy Rowena Wolcott9, Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 MAY 1898 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. ABT 1928 .
NotesLUCY died age 29 years, 4 mo., 29 days.
(9) Creda Annis Wolcott9 (Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 APR 1870 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. 2 SEP 1902 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska.
NotesCREDA never married. She lived with her mother and gave piano lessons, driving her horses to neighboring small towns. She also did china painting. She died of a heart attack at her brothers' wedding.
(9) Lloyd Porter Wolcott9 (Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 MAR 1879 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. 4 JUL 1952 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska.
NotesLLOYD was cashier of the First National Bank, retiring in 1925. During World War II he was a watchman at the Glen L. Martin Bomber Plant near Omaha. He was very active in the Masonic lodge. He was Wolcott Society vice-president for Nebraska in 1909.

1918 Draft Registration:
Lloyd Porter Wolcott, 39
County: Cass NB
Birth Date: 8 Mar 1879
banking, First National Bank, Weeping Water NB
wife Olive H. Wolcott, Weeping Water
medium height and build, blue eyes, light hair.
m. 2 SEP 1903 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, Olive Hitchman, b. 1 SEP 1880 Mount Pleasant, Westmoreland Co., Pennsylvania, d. 1967 .
5 children: Franklin Marshall "Frank", Elizabeth Henrietta "Betty", Robert Hitchman, Doris, Warren James.
(10) Franklin Marshall "Frank" Wolcott10 (Lloyd Porter Wolcott9, Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 JUN 1908 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. 10 OCT 1995 Indianapolis, Marion Co., Indiana.
NotesFRANKLIN graduated from the University of Nebraska in 1931. During World War II he was an inspector in a war plant in New Jersey. In 1947 he went to work for the Bureau of Reclamation, and worked most of the time in Huron, South Dakota.
(10) Elizabeth Henrietta "Betty" Wolcott10 (Lloyd Porter Wolcott9, Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 JUL 1911 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. 1971 .
(10) Robert Hitchman Wolcott10 (Lloyd Porter Wolcott9, Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 FEB 1913 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. 1974 .
NotesROBERT served in the South Pacific during World War II, then graduated from the University of Nebraska in Engineering and was employeed by the Nebraska State Highway Department.
(10) Doris Wolcott10 (Lloyd Porter Wolcott9, Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 SEP 1918 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. .
NotesDORIS worked at the Glenn L. Martin Bomber Plant in Omaha during World War II.
(10) Warren James Wolcott10 (Lloyd Porter Wolcott9, Franklin Maginnis "Frank" Wolcott8, Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 JAN 1921 Weeping Water, Cass Co., Nebraska, d. 21 SEP 1951 .
NotesWARREN, known as Jim, was a U.S. Army Glider pilot during World War II and served in Italy and Europe. He was a very successful salesman for Devoe and Raeynolds Paint Company headquartered in Sioux City, Iowa. While returning home one night, his car overturned into a rain swollen river and he was drowned.

Military Gravestone: Warren James Wolcott, enlisted 29 June 1942, discharged 24 Sep 1946, 2nd LT. NB, 349th Troop Carrier, Glider Pilot 1026, USAAF, bur Oakwood Cemetery, Weeping Water NB
(8) Ellen Coe Wolcott8 (Guy Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 OCT 1844 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 5 APR 1871 .
NotesEllen was a graduate of Lake Erie Seminary.
m. 8 JUN 1870 Lyman Walker Peet, b. 14 JAN 1838 Cornwall, Addison Co., Vermont, d. 4 JAN 1917 Cornwall, Addison Co., Vermont.
Spouse NotesLYMAN attended Burr and Burton Seminary, and was a teacher at Tarrytown, New York, Hoboken, New Jersey, Nashville, Tennessee, Weeping Water, Nebraska, and Nebraska City 1861-77. He was a farmer at Cornwall 1877-1819. He served in the House of Representatives 1898-9. John Peet 1597-1684 of Stratford, Connecticut & his descendants, by Terry Charles Peet (Baltimore: Gateway Press, 1986), p. 87-88, 137
(7) James Wolcott7 (Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 NOV 1789 Torrington, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JAN 1873 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesJAMES supervised the construction of a woolen mill on the Waterbury River for his father in 1813. In 1818 he moved to Delaware, Ohio, where he and Joseph S. Hughes constructed a woolen mill at Delaware, Ohio, which he managed fot two years. Here he joined the Episcopal church. He then moved to St. Louis, Missouri, where he married, and then settled at Fort Wayne, Indiana. He purchased 300 acres of land in Allen Co., Indiana in 1826 at Ft. Wayne. He and his wife and all their household goods were put in a boat and paddled down the Maumee River from Fort Wayne to Waynesfield, Ohio. In 1827 he purchased 300 acres of government land in Waynesfield Township for $1.25 an acre, and 377 acres in Lucas Co. He build a log house in what was then a wilderness and sold land to other settlers. In 1834-6 he built a two story frame house on the north bank of the river at Maumee in which he and his wife lived and died. He operated the Central House, Maumee's first "hotel" before establishing himself as a merchant. By 1837, his business, receiving and forwarding merchandise to Ft. Wayne and points west, was one of the largest in the area. He paid personal property taxes in Waynesfield Township in 1838. In 1838 he was elected to the first Maumee City Council, where he served as president. He also built wharves and shipyards along the river near his home. James commissioned construction of two steamboats, the "General Harrison", with a 150 ft. keel, launched in 1840, and the "James Wolcott". They operated between Maumee and Buffalo, New York, via Lake Erie. James was the first president of Maumee City Council in 1838. The following year he was elected Judge of the Lucas County Court of Common Pleas. In 1843 he was Mayor of Maumee. He was a founder of the Ohio Whig political party and a supporter of William Henry Harrison and Henry Clay. In 1860 he was at Maumee, with Fred K. and James Wolcott. James, William W., Eliza J., Zoe W., Byron, and James M. Wolcott were at Maumee in 1870. After his death, his home was occupied by his daughter Mary, and was willed to the Episcopal church about 1960. It is now a museum.
m. 8 MAR 1821 , St. Charles Co., Missouri, Mary Ann "Polly", "Ahmaquahzahquah" Wells, b. 10 MAY 1800 Fort Wayne, Allen Co., Indiana, d. 19 FEB 1843 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesMARY was the grand daughter of Chief Little Turtle of the Miami tribe. Her Indian name was "Ahmahquazahka".
7 children: William Wells, Robert Fulton, Mary Ann, Henry Clay, Frederick Calhoun "Fred", James Monroe "Tip", Emily B..
(8) William Wells Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 DEC 1821 Louisville, Jefferson Co., Kentucky, d. 30 APR 1905 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesWILLIAM came to Maumee, Ohio, in 1826 with his parents. As a young man, he intended to study law, but the death of his mother changed that plan. In 1840 he went to the Great Lakes where be became captain of some of the finest ships of those days. One of the boats he captained was the "General Harrison", built and owned by his father. He lived at Toledo OH from 1847 to 1850, and then moved back to Maumee, Ohio, where he was a general contractor of public works and a farmer. In 1860 he was at Maumee with Eliza, Effa, and Byron Wolcott. In 1880 he and his wife were living at Toledo with their son, Byron. His obituary describes him as the "second eldest son of Judge James Wolcott"
m. 11 FEB 1848 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, Eliza Jane Border, b. 1825 ,, England, d. 1898 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
3 children: Effie E., Zoe Wells, Byron William.
(9) Effie E. Wolcott9 (William Wells Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1849 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. .
m. William Douglas Randall, b. 1841 , d. JUL 1917 Liberty Center, Henry Co., Ohio.
1 children: Eva Wolcott.
(10) Eva Wolcott Randall10 (Effie E. Wolcott9, William Wells Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
NotesEVA was in the Perrysburg, Ohio, hospital in 1914, due to a serious illness.
(9) Zoe Wells Wolcott9 (William Wells Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JUL 1851 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. 6 FEB 1923 ,, Ohio.
NotesZOE and her husband attended the 1912 Wolcott Society reunion at Detroit residing at Maumee, Ohio.
m. Edward E. Church, b. 4 JUL 1850 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. 21 MAR 1921 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesE. E. Church was a farmer at South Toledo, Ohio, in 1880, with Zoe, Carrie, and Grace.
2 children: Carrie, Grace.
(10) Carrie Church10 (Zoe Wells Wolcott9, William Wells Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1877 ,, Ohio, d. .
(10) Grace Church10 (Zoe Wells Wolcott9, William Wells Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. JUL 1879 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. 1909 .
(9) Byron William Wolcott9 (William Wells Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1852 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
Notes1910 Maumee OH:
Name: Byron Wolcott
Birthplace: Ohio
Relationship to Head of Household: Self
Residence: Maumee Ward 3, Lucas, Ohio
Marital Status: Single
Father's Birthplace: Kentucky
Mother's Birthplace: England
(8) Robert Fulton Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 SEP 1824 Fort Wayne, Allen Co., Indiana, d. 1836 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesROBERT drowned in the Maumee River.
(8) Mary Ann Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 JUN 1827 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. 30 APR 1891 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesMARY lived in her father's home after his death.
m. 1848 Fort Wayne, Allen Co., Indiana, Smith Gilbert, b. 29 OCT 1815 Newtown, Fairfield Co., Connecticut, d. 30 MAR 1879 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
3 children: Frederica Eliza "Freddie", Albert Wolcott, Smith Wells.
(9) Frederica Eliza "Freddie" Gilbert9 (Mary Ann Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 APR 1850 Fort Wayne, Allen Co., Indiana, d. 17 JUL 1934 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesFREDERICA was born and died in the house James Wolcott built at Maumee. She and her daughter lived there, and her funeral was held there. She was buried with military honors by the American Legion. She was a member of St. Paul's Episcopal Church and of the Relief Corps of the G. A. R. She was a member of the Wolcott Society 1912-15, and attended the 1912 and 1914 reunions.
m. 22 DEC 1875 William Curtis Hull, b. 8 AUG 1852 , d. 2 APR 1903 .
1 children: Rilla E..
(10) Rilla E. Hull10 (Frederica Eliza "Freddie" Gilbert9, Mary Ann Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 FEB 1880 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. 1957 .
NotesRILLA was the last resident of the James Wolcott house in Maumee City, Ohio. She willed the house to the Episcopal Church and requested that it be preserved as a museum for local history. They sold it to the city of Maumee for $15,000 in 1960. She joined the Wolcott Society in 1937 as member #211, residing at Maumee, Ohio.
(9) Albert Wolcott Gilbert9 (Mary Ann Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1852 ,, Ohio, d. 1926 .
m. Mary Elizabeth Power, b. , d. .
2 children: William, Albert Wolcott.
(10) William Gilbert10 (Albert Wolcott Gilbert9, Mary Ann Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Albert Wolcott Gilbert10 (Albert Wolcott Gilbert9, Mary Ann Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
NotesALBERT lived at Toledo, Ohio, in 1934.
(9) Smith Wells Gilbert9 (Mary Ann Wolcott8, James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1854 ,, Ohio, d. 1925 .
(8) Henry Clay Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 OCT 1830 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. 7 APR 1882 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesHENRY had black hair and dark eyes, reflecting his mother's Indian bloodline. He was living at Wayne Co., Michigan, when he enlisted in Co. E, 16th Michigan Inf. Regt., serving for 2 years and fighting at the Battle of Manassas. He then returned to Ohio. In Jan. 1864, he enlisted in Co. E, 3rd Ohio Cav. Regt. Part of this service was a a Brigade teamster, delivering supplies. He was mustered out at Nashville on 14 Aug. 1865. His life after the war was said to have been " difficult". In 1880 he was single and living alone at Maumee, age 52, with no occupation.
m. Annie , b. 7 JUL 1846 , d. 16 JUN 1925 .
(8) Frederick Calhoun "Fred" Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 NOV 1834 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. 24 JUL 1864 Atlanta, Fulton Co., Georgia.
NotesFREDERICK served in the 47th Ohio Inf. Regt., and was killed at the Battle of Atlanta. His name is also given as Frederick Allyn Wolcott.
(8) James Monroe "Tip" Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 DEC 1839 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. 24 NOV 1917 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesJAMES served in the 130th Ohio Inf. Regt. in the Union Army during the Civil War. He was a dentist by profession, and served as Justice of the Peace. He filed a number of legal suits claiming property in the city of Fort Wayne based on old Indian treaties. In 1887 he was Waynesfield Township clerk and justice of the peace. He was appointed Mayor of Maumee in 1885, and elected to that office in 1887. He was also Secretary of the Maumee Board of Education in 1887. James was a Mason, a Democrat, and an Episcopalian. He spoke at the 1912 Wolcott Society reunion, and read an account of his family which was printed in the society's annual report..
m. Emma Randall, b. , d. .
(8) Emily B. Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. INFANT .
(7) James Wolcott7 (Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 NOV 1789 Torrington, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JAN 1873 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesJAMES supervised the construction of a woolen mill on the Waterbury River for his father in 1813. In 1818 he moved to Delaware, Ohio, where he and Joseph S. Hughes constructed a woolen mill at Delaware, Ohio, which he managed fot two years. Here he joined the Episcopal church. He then moved to St. Louis, Missouri, where he married, and then settled at Fort Wayne, Indiana. He purchased 300 acres of land in Allen Co., Indiana in 1826 at Ft. Wayne. He and his wife and all their household goods were put in a boat and paddled down the Maumee River from Fort Wayne to Waynesfield, Ohio. In 1827 he purchased 300 acres of government land in Waynesfield Township for $1.25 an acre, and 377 acres in Lucas Co. He build a log house in what was then a wilderness and sold land to other settlers. In 1834-6 he built a two story frame house on the north bank of the river at Maumee in which he and his wife lived and died. He operated the Central House, Maumee's first "hotel" before establishing himself as a merchant. By 1837, his business, receiving and forwarding merchandise to Ft. Wayne and points west, was one of the largest in the area. He paid personal property taxes in Waynesfield Township in 1838. In 1838 he was elected to the first Maumee City Council, where he served as president. He also built wharves and shipyards along the river near his home. James commissioned construction of two steamboats, the "General Harrison", with a 150 ft. keel, launched in 1840, and the "James Wolcott". They operated between Maumee and Buffalo, New York, via Lake Erie. James was the first president of Maumee City Council in 1838. The following year he was elected Judge of the Lucas County Court of Common Pleas. In 1843 he was Mayor of Maumee. He was a founder of the Ohio Whig political party and a supporter of William Henry Harrison and Henry Clay. In 1860 he was at Maumee, with Fred K. and James Wolcott. James, William W., Eliza J., Zoe W., Byron, and James M. Wolcott were at Maumee in 1870. After his death, his home was occupied by his daughter Mary, and was willed to the Episcopal church about 1960. It is now a museum.
m. 21 NOV 1844 Caroline B. , b. 1815 ,, New Hampshire, d. .
1 children: Joseph Luke.
(8) Joseph Luke Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1845 Maumee, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesJOSEPH served as a musician in Co. B, 67th Ohio Inf. Regt., during the Civil War. In 1865 he was a lieutenant in the Loyal Legion of the United States. Joseph L. Wolcott of Toledo, Ohio, was an officer of the Paltrier Oil Company in 1897.
(7) Elizur "Eli" Wolcott7 (Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 JUL 1792 Torrington, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. Enfield, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesELIZUR is said to have lived at Thompsonville. He was probably the Elizur Wolcott, age 50, born in Connecticut, who was living at a hotel in Enfield, Connecticut in 1850.

1850 Enfield, Harftford Co. CT: Elizur Wolcott 50y, b. CT, lodger at Harris family hotel.

1860 Eli Wolcott was a machinist living at Enfield, Connecticut, in 1860. Living with him was Sophia Moulton 57.
m. 1817 ,, Connecticut, Esther Lewis, b. , d. .
(7) Frederick Wolcott7 (Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 JAN 1795 Torrington, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 24 JUL 1895 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesFREDERICK or another Frederick Woolcott owned 277 acres at Ashtabula, Ohio, in 1833, which he rented to Eli Sanford.
He was a farmer at Stow, Ohio, in 1850.

(8) Lucy Ann Wolcott8 (Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1830 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
NotesLUCY A. Wolcott of Monroe Falls, Ohio, was a student at Steubenville Female Seminary in 1845.
m. 14 JAN 1864 , Summit Co., Ohio, John A. Knolton, b. 1824 Arlington, Bennington Co., Vermont, d. .
Spouse NotesJOHN was a physician at Akron, Ohio, in 1880.
1 children: Frank W..
(9) Frank W. Knolton9 (Lucy Ann Wolcott8, Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1867 ,, Ohio, d. .
(8) Frederick Wolcott8 (Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1834 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 23 MAY 1903 Cuyahoga Falls, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesFREDERICK was at Stow, Ohio, in 1870 with Catherine and Marchant Wolcott. He and his wife went from Ohio to Kansas by wagon train with a family named Hoit.. While crossing the Mississippi River they were attacked by Indians and several wagons were nearly lost. In Kansas home they built a sod house, enduring locusts, Indians, droughts and "The Great Prairie Fire". In 1880 Frederick was a farmer at Trego Co., Kansas. They later returned to Ohio.
m. 3 JAN 1866 Cuyahoga Falls, Summit Co., Ohio, Katherine Finley, b. South Bend, St. Joseph Co., Indiana, d. 5 NOV 1915 Troy, Bradford Co., Pennsylvania.
Spouse NotesKATHERINE wrote an accout of her move to Kansas in a covered wagon train which was published in Harpers Magazine. She andher father taught music at Trego Co., Kansas, in 1880. Katharyn was a niece of Martha Finley, author of the Elsie Dinsmore series of books.
1 children: Marchant Finley,
(9) Marchant Finley Wolcott9 (Frederick Wolcott8, Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 OCT 1866 Munroe Falls, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 7 DEC 1913 Troy, Bradford Co., Pennsylvania.
NotesMARCHANT was foreman in a brass factory at Franklin, New York, in 1913 when he purchased a farm at Armenia, New York, where he moved with his wife, mother, and four daughters. He attended the 4th Wolcott reunions held at Silver Lake, Ohio, in 1908.
m. Cora Winkes, b. ABT 1870 , d. .
2 children: , Coral Lee.
(10) Wolcott10 (Marchant Finley Wolcott9, Frederick Wolcott8, Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 FEB 1893 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. .
(10) Coral Lee Wolcott10 (Marchant Finley Wolcott9, Frederick Wolcott8, Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1895 , d. 23 NOV 1918 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(9) Marchant Finley Wolcott9 (Frederick Wolcott8, Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 OCT 1866 Munroe Falls, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 7 DEC 1913 Troy, Bradford Co., Pennsylvania.
NotesMARCHANT was foreman in a brass factory at Franklin, New York, in 1913 when he purchased a farm at Armenia, New York, where he moved with his wife, mother, and four daughters. He attended the 4th Wolcott reunions held at Silver Lake, Ohio, in 1908.
m. 14 SEP 1898 Cuyahoga Falls, Summit Co., Ohio, Myrtle Luella Poulson, b. 28 MAY 1878 Holmesville, Holmes Co., Ohio, d. .
4 children: Katharyn Poulson, Mildred Ann, Martha Finley, Nancy.
(10) Katharyn Poulson Wolcott10 (Marchant Finley Wolcott9, Frederick Wolcott8, Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 AUG 1899 Chrystal Falls, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1 MAR 1976 .
NotesKATHARYN attended Columbia University. She was a poet. Her poetry was published in the book, "Wind Across the Threshold", and in many national magazines. She joined the Wolcott Society in 1934 as member #191, residing at Weehawken, New Jersey. and was poet for the Wolcott Society for over 25 years. She wrote in 1935 that she remembered "attending the first Wolcott reunion held at Silver Lake, Ohio, as a child. I have in fact a picture taken that day of all the children present." This would actually have been the 4th reunion, held at Cuyahoga Falls. During World War II she was supervisor of the Red Cross program at Weehawken, New Jersey, with over 4,000 volunteer workers.
(10) Mildred Ann Wolcott10 (Marchant Finley Wolcott9, Frederick Wolcott8, Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 NOV 1900 Cuyahoga Falls, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
NotesMILDRED joined the Wolcott Society in 1956 as member #581, residing at Mahopac, New York, and rejoined in 1969 as member #814 residing at Black Mountain, North Carolina..
(10) Martha Finley Wolcott10 (Marchant Finley Wolcott9, Frederick Wolcott8, Frederick Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 JUL 1907 , d. .

NotesNANCY joined the Wolcott Society in 1968 s member #813, residing at Lakewood, New Jersey.

NotesHOBART Wolcott was a voter at Tallmadge, Ohio, in 1880. His death record gives him as a single retired gardner.
(7) Anna Wolcott7 (Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 MAY 1797 Torrington, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 21 JUL 1881 Bryan, Williams Co., Ohio.
NotesANN lived with her daughter, Elizabeth, at Bryan, Ohio, in 1880.
m. 6 JUN 1830 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, John Emery, b. 15 JUL 1788 Of Swanton,, Ohio, d. 2 NOV 1862 Swanton, Fulton Co., Ohio.
4 children: Elizabeth, Henrietta, John Wolcott, Rush.
(8) Elizabeth Emery8 (Anna Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 JUL 1831 Wadsworth, Medina Co., Ohio, d. 12 MAR 1918 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesThe revised genealogical records of the descendants of John Emery of Newbury, Massachusetts, compiled by Judith Elaine Burns (Baltimore: Gateway Press, 1982), p. 220, 427
m. 6 JUN 1854 Swanton, Fulton Co., Ohio, John Adam Simon, b. 20 MAY 1819 Kinderheim, Bavaria, Germany, d. 22 FEB 1885 Bryan, Williams Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesJOHN was a lawyer at Bryan, Ohio, in 1880.
3 children: Flora E., Katherine P. O., Phillip Wolcott.

m. 8 OCT 1890 ,, Ohio, Ernest J. Hoyt, b. , d. .
3 children: Helen Elizabeth, Anna Louise, Marian Dorothy.
(10) Helen Elizabeth Hoyt10 (Katherine P. O. Simon9, Elizabeth Emery8, Anna Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JUN 1892 , d. .
NotesHELEN was author of "Te Simon and Otterbein Families", published 1952.
(10) Anna Louise Hoyt10 (Katherine P. O. Simon9, Elizabeth Emery8, Anna Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 MAR 1894 , d. .

Spouse NotesALBERT enlisted in Co. G, 12th Ohio Cav. Regt. Nov. 1863 and was discharged as Sgt. Nov. 1854 He was a farmer at Richland, Ohio, in 1880, next to John B. Elliot, born 1838, and family, including brother Samuel born 1845 . Their father was born in Ireland, and their mother in Pennsylvania. In 1890 he was at Defiance Co., Ohio.

NotesCECELIA "was one of the early members when the local Ohio chapter was the only chapter in existance, about 1900, and the meetings were held in little Ohio towns such as Hudson and Silver Lake, Ohio." She lived at Hudson, Ohio.

(8) Ellen Arabella Hitchcock8 (Eleanor Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 FEB 1831 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 27 MAY 1832 .
(8) Elizur Hitchcock8 (Eleanor Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 AUG 1832 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
NotesThe following sketch appears in History of Summit County, With an Outline Sketch of Ohio, edited by William Henry Perrin (Chicago: Baskin & Battey, 1881), p. 716:
"Dr. Elizur Hitchcock, physician, Akron; is a native of Summit County. He was born on his fathers farm in Tallmadge, Aug. 15, 1832, and is the fourth of seven children born to Lucius W. and Eleanor (Wolcott) Hitchcock. His parents were natives of Connecticut, his father coming on foot in 1822, to Tallmadge, where he bought a farm, married and raised his family. In 1873, he lost his wife, and left the farm, coming to Akron, where he now resides. Dr. Hitchcock remained at home until the spring of 1850, working on the farm and gaining such education as the schools of the neighborhood afforded. At 18, he entered the Western Reserve College at Hudson, where he studied two years, and then entered the Junior Class in Yale College, graduating there in 1854. During the next four years, he taught select schools in Tallmadge and Gustavus, dividing the time between them. In 1857, he began reading medicine with Dr. Dudley Allen, at Kinsman, Ohio, and in 1860, graduated at the Medical Department of the Western Reserve College, at Cleveland, having taken a course previously at Ann Arbor, Mich. He began his practice at Mecca, but in the following spring located at Orwell, where he remained two years. He then went into the army as Surgeon of the 7th O.V.I., and resigned after serving about sixth months. In the fall of 1863, he located in West Williamsfield, Ohio, where he remained until 1869, when he sold out his business and attended the Bellevue Hospital. In 1870, he came to Akron and has since practiced his profession here. He is a member and President of the Summit County Medical Society, and also a member of the Union Medical Association of Northeastern Ohio. On Nov. 24, 1861, he married Miss Hattie Reed, a native of Mecca, Trumbull Co., Ohio, by whom he had one child, Gertrude R. His wife died in May, 1864. In November, 1864, he married Miss Lucretia Kellogg, a native of West Andover, Ashtabula Co., Ohio, by whom he has two children -- Halbert K. and Lucius W."
m. 24 NOV 1861 Mecca, Trumbull Co., Ohio, Hattie Reed, b. Mecca, Trumbull Co., Ohio, d. 20 MAY 1864 West Williamsfield, Ashtabula Co., Ohio.
1 children: Gertrude Reed.
(9) Gertrude Reed Hitchcock9 (Elizur Hitchcock8, Eleanor Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 NOV 1862 , d. .
m. 24 DEC 1883 Daniel Dickle, b. , d. .
(8) Elizur Hitchcock8 (Eleanor Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 AUG 1832 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
NotesThe following sketch appears in History of Summit County, With an Outline Sketch of Ohio, edited by William Henry Perrin (Chicago: Baskin & Battey, 1881), p. 716:
"Dr. Elizur Hitchcock, physician, Akron; is a native of Summit County. He was born on his fathers farm in Tallmadge, Aug. 15, 1832, and is the fourth of seven children born to Lucius W. and Eleanor (Wolcott) Hitchcock. His parents were natives of Connecticut, his father coming on foot in 1822, to Tallmadge, where he bought a farm, married and raised his family. In 1873, he lost his wife, and left the farm, coming to Akron, where he now resides. Dr. Hitchcock remained at home until the spring of 1850, working on the farm and gaining such education as the schools of the neighborhood afforded. At 18, he entered the Western Reserve College at Hudson, where he studied two years, and then entered the Junior Class in Yale College, graduating there in 1854. During the next four years, he taught select schools in Tallmadge and Gustavus, dividing the time between them. In 1857, he began reading medicine with Dr. Dudley Allen, at Kinsman, Ohio, and in 1860, graduated at the Medical Department of the Western Reserve College, at Cleveland, having taken a course previously at Ann Arbor, Mich. He began his practice at Mecca, but in the following spring located at Orwell, where he remained two years. He then went into the army as Surgeon of the 7th O.V.I., and resigned after serving about sixth months. In the fall of 1863, he located in West Williamsfield, Ohio, where he remained until 1869, when he sold out his business and attended the Bellevue Hospital. In 1870, he came to Akron and has since practiced his profession here. He is a member and President of the Summit County Medical Society, and also a member of the Union Medical Association of Northeastern Ohio. On Nov. 24, 1861, he married Miss Hattie Reed, a native of Mecca, Trumbull Co., Ohio, by whom he had one child, Gertrude R. His wife died in May, 1864. In November, 1864, he married Miss Lucretia Kellogg, a native of West Andover, Ashtabula Co., Ohio, by whom he has two children -- Halbert K. and Lucius W."
m. 30 NOV 1864 Lucretia Kellogg, b. West Andover, Ashtabula Co., Ohio, d. .
2 children: Herbert Kellogg, Lucius Wolcott.

NotesLUCIUS was an artist, and an instructor at the Art Student's League in New York. He painted landscapes and illustrations.

(9) Lorena Eleanor Hitchcock9 (Herbert Pascal Hitchcock8, Eleanor Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 NOV 1867 , d. 12 JUL 1875 .
(9) Eva Pearl Hitchcock9 (Herbert Pascal Hitchcock8, Eleanor Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 AUG 1876 , d. .
(7) George Wolcott7 (Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 JUL 1806 Torrington, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 31 MAR 1857 Wolcottville, LaGrange Co., Indiana.
NotesGEORGE's father died when he was 15, leaving him in charge of the family farm at Tallmadge Ohio. In 1828, he went to Wadsworth, Ohio, where he purchased 100 acres of land at four dollars per acre, and began clearing it and building a log cabin. He bought half interest in a sawmill in 1832, and engaged in the manufacture of fanning mills. George moved to La Grange Co., Indiana, in 1837, and built a log cabin on the Elkhart River. He homesteaded 160 acres in LaGrange Co. jointly with Smith C. Sherman in 1838. Here he built a sawmill and gristmill, adding a store and a frame barn in 1839. The town was called Wolcott's Mills, but in 1848 the name was changed to Wolcottville, named after George. In 1845 he built a larger gristmill, bringing the machinery by wagon from Ann Arbor, Michigan, a distance of one hundred and sixty-five miles. In 1847 he built a larger store, putting into it a full stock of goods and conducting seven different branches of business; milling, sawing, coopering, blacksmithing, mercantile,and potash production. George also had a large farm. He requested the National Educational Society to send a teacher as governess for his family. The next year he built a school building that he named the Wolcottville Young Ladies Seminary. Later young men were admitted as well. Soon after this he built a boarding house with rooms for the students. The money used in these enterprises was from his own resources. The 1850 census has him as a miller at Johnson Township, LaGrange Co., Indiana, age 43, with Margaret 46, Abby A. 19, Esther R. 16, Elton 14, Marshall 12, and Amelia 8.
m. 6 AUG 1828 Tallmadge, Summit Co., Ohio, Margaret Hine, b. 12 NOV 1803 North Milford, New Haven Co., Connecticut, d. 2 FEB 1892 Wolcottville, LaGrange Co., Indiana.
Spouse NotesHine genealogy and history of the descendants of Thomas Hine of Milford, Conn., 1639, by Robert C. Hine (1899), p. 65-66
7 children: Anna Louisa "Ann", Abigail Amanda, Julia Almira, Esther Rowena, Elton Romeo, Marshall Franklin, Amelia.

(8) Elton Romeo Wolcott8 (George Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 SEP 1836 , Medina Co., Ohio, d. Sheridan Township, Poweshiek Co., Iowa.
NotesELTON was of Wolcottsville, Indiana, at the time of his marriage. He lived at Wolcottvile in 1864. He had land for 32 lots and 4 streets annexed to the town of Wolcottville in 1872. In 1880 he was a farmer at Sheridan, Iowa.
m. 26 NOV 1864 Walton, Delaware Co., New York, Emily F. Jones, b. 1837 ,, New York, d. 6 JAN 1892 Franklin, Delaware Co., New York.
Spouse NotesEMILY was "of Guillian, Iowa" when she died of pneumonia at Franklin, New York.
1 children: Florence A..

NotesELTON was of Wolcottsville, Indiana, at the time of his marriage. He lived at Wolcottvile in 1864. He had land for 32 lots and 4 streets annexed to the town of Wolcottville in 1872. In 1880 he was a farmer at Sheridan, Iowa.
m. Lettie M. , b. , d. .
(8) Marshall Franklin Wolcott8 (George Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 OCT 1838 Johnson, Lagrange Co., Indiana, d. 19 NOV 1902 Moreno, Riverside Co., California.
NotesMARSHALL was at Geneseo, Illinois, in 1860, with Fanny and Alfred P. Wolcott. He was a merchant at Geneseo, Illinois, in 1880.
m. 9 MAY 1866 , Cook Co., Illinois, Fannie L. Perry, b. 5 OCT 1843 Geneseo, Henry Co., Illinois, d. .
3 children: Alfred Perry, George Elton, Frank Barton.
(9) Alfred Perry Wolcott9 (Marshall Franklin Wolcott8, George Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 JUL 1867 Geneseo, Henry Co., Illinois, d. 7 AUG 1944 , Clackamas Co., Oregon.
NotesALFRED was a member of the Wolcott Society 1914-15, residing at Omaha, Nebraska, but was not on the 1916 roster. He was a clerk in Portland, Oregon, in 1919, and was living in Portland in 1944.
m. 9 MAY 1894 Santa Clara, Santa Clara Co., California, Julia Clarkson, b. 8 DEC 1867 ,, Nebraska, d. 14 FEB 1920 , Multnomah Co., Oregon.
3 children: Lucile, Mary Matteson, Frances Clara.
(10) Lucile Wolcott10 (Alfred Perry Wolcott9, Marshall Franklin Wolcott8, George Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 APR 1895 Moreno, Riverside Co., California, d. .
NotesLUCILE worked as a multigraph operator in Porland, Oregon, in 1919.
(10) Mary Matteson Wolcott10 (Alfred Perry Wolcott9, Marshall Franklin Wolcott8, George Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 JUN 1898 Omaha, Douglas Co., Nebraska, d. .
(10) Frances Clara Wolcott10 (Alfred Perry Wolcott9, Marshall Franklin Wolcott8, George Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 FEB 1901 Omaha, Douglas Co., Nebraska, d. 18 MAR 1918 .
(9) George Elton Wolcott9 (Marshall Franklin Wolcott8, George Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 MAY 1869 , d. 1 JUN 1869 .
(9) Frank Barton Wolcott9 (Marshall Franklin Wolcott8, George Wolcott7, Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 APR 1871 Geneseo, Henry Co., Illinois, d. 9 JAN 1943 Riverside, Riverside Co., California.
NotesFRANK" left Wolcottville, Indiana, more than 50 years ago. and after great irrigation difficulties developed the Hemet Valley, famous for its scenery, beauty and fruits. At one time the family suffered a $200,000 loss through failure of the water supply." Survivors were his widow and a brother, Alfred Perry Wolcott. (1944 Wolcott Society Annual Report) Two infants listed here and buried in Riverside Co. are probably his children.
m. 10 JUN 1895 San Bernardino, San Bernardino Co., California, Clara J. Foster, b. 26 OCT 1864 ,, New York, d. 11 JAN 1944 San Bernardino, San Bernardino Co., California.

(7) Allyn Ellsworth Wolcott7 (Guy Wolcott6, Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 MAR 1809 Torrington, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. .
NotesALLen E. Wolcott of Stow, Ohio, was a student at Kenyon College in 1833-4. He was a lawyer at Stow in 1850.
(6) Elizabeth Wolcott6 (Alexander Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 JAN 1763 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 12 OCT 1817 Center Cemetery, South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. Elizur Wolcott, b. 12 APR 1760 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 SEP 1828 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesELIZUR and his wife, Elizabeth, were 2nd cousins. They had no children, but adopted her niece, Lucy Wolcott. In 1790 his family at East Windsor consisted of 1 male over 16, and 1 female.

(10) Roger Wolcott Davis10 (Frederick Wendell Davis9, Lucy Terry Strong8, William Strong7, John Strong6, Hepzibah Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 JAN 1890 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. APR 1959 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER graduated from Yale College in 1911, and received his law degree from Yale in 1913. He practiced law ar Hartford and was an alderman at Hartford from 1917 to 1919. He moved to Windsor, Connecticut, where he practiced law and became a judge.

(10) Drummond Williamson Little10 (Charlotte Wolcott Dennis9, Clara Strong8, William Strong7, John Strong6, Hepzibah Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .

m. Parker, b. , d. .

(10) Charlotte Dobson Goodrich10 (George Dobson Goodrich9, Charlotte Dobson8, Sophia Strong7, John Strong6, Hepzibah Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 FEB 1878 , d. .
(10) George Talcott Goodrich10 (George Dobson Goodrich9, Charlotte Dobson8, Sophia Strong7, John Strong6, Hepzibah Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 DEC 1883 , d. .

(6) Sarah Strong6 (Hepzibah Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 NOV 1761 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(5) Josiah Wolcott5 (Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 FEB 1719 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 JUN 1802 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesJOSIAH served in Capt. E. Grant's Co. during King George's War. He apparently never married, although he is listed at East Windsor in 1790 with a household of 1 male over 16 and 2 females. He left an estate valued at 8,034L.
(5) Erastus Wolcott5 (Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 FEB 1721 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 MAY 1722 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(5) Epaphras Wolcott5 (Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 FEB 1721 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 APR 1733 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(5) Erastus Wolcott5 (Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 SEP 1722 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 SEP 1793 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesERASTUS was a Representative to the General Assembly for South Windsor for many terms, and was Speaker of the Assembly. He was a Justice of the Peace, Judge of Probate, and Chief Judge of the County Court. Erastus was sent to Boston in 1775, to observe the British troops. He commanded a Regiment of Connecticut militia in 1776, which helped raise the siege of Boston. After the British left, he took his troops to New London where he supervised the erection of fortifications and garrisoned Fort Trumbull and Fort Griswold. In 1777 Erastus was in charge of the troops guarding the Hudson River. He led the 1st Connecticut Brigade in the expedition to Peekskill, New York, and then to Danbury, Connecticut. Erastus, leader of the agrarian faction in the state, was chosen a delegate to the Continental Congress, but did not accept. He was a member of the Court Martial selected by Washington for the trial of Major Andre. After the war, he was a Judge of the Connecticut Supreme Court. Yale College gave him an honorary degree. In 1790 he was at East Windsor with family consisting of 3 males over 16 and 1 female. Erastus' will, dated 14 Dec. 1792, left a silver tankard to his son, Erastus, 500L each to his daughters, Flavia and Jerusha, and the residue to be divided between his sons, Erastus, Arodi, and Albert. He was said to been of large frame, with light gray eyes and light hair, reserved in conversation, with a reputation for sagacity. He was affectionately known as "Old Long Head". Erastus and his wife, Jerusha, were 2nd cousins.
m. 10 FEB 1746 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Jerusha Wolcott, b. 18 JAN 1719 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 JUN 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
7 children: Erastus, Flavia, Erastus, Flavia, Jerusha, Arodi, Albert.
(6) Erastus Wolcott6 (Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 DEC 1747 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 16 AUG 1751 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Flavia Wolcott6 (Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 MAY 1750 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 AUG 1751 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Erastus Wolcott6 (Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 JUL 1752 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 JAN 1797 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesERASTUS was a Captain in the Connecticut Line, and commanded a regiment at Boston. He was taken prisoner by the British and suffered a long confinement. He lived in his father's house at Windsor, where he was a Justice of the Peace, a Representative to the General Assembly, and Judge of Probate. In 1790 he was at East Windsor with a family consisting of 1 male over 16, 2 males under 16, and 1 female. His estate was valued at $39,918. A land warrant was issued in 1799 to his wife, Chloe, guardian of his minor children, Erastus, Chloe, Edward, Julia, and Helen Wolcott, based on his military service. He was tall and thin, with light complexion, and light flaxen hair. Erastus and his wife were second cousins.
m. 27 DEC 1783 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Chloe Bissell, b. 30 AUG 1758 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 16 FEB 1802 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
5 children: Erastus, Chloe, Edward, Juliana, Helen.
(7) Erastus Wolcott7 (Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 OCT 1784 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 27 FEB 1812 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Chloe Wolcott7 (Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 APR 1786 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(7) Edward Wolcott7 (Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 OCT 1788 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 9 NOV 1832 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesEDWARD was at Hartford Co., Connecticut, in 1810, as head of family consisting of 2 males age 16-25 (Erastus and Edward), 1 female 26-44, and 3 females age 16-25 (Chloe, Julianna, and Helen). He was captain of a company in Col. Shepard's Regt. in the War of 1812. His grave stone gives his rank as Captain.
(7) Juliana Wolcott7 (Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 APR 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 NOV 1832 .
m. 13 MAY 1823 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Elihu Wolcott, b. 12 FEB 1784 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 DEC 1858 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesELIHU was a Representative to the Connecticut Legislature for East Windsor. He sold the family farm and moved to Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois in 1830. It was said that had a two room cabin, but that their furniture was shipped via New Orleans and did not arrive until the next spring. Elihu was a merchant and land owner. He purchased a large amount of land in 6 counties in Illinois between 1831 and 1849, including 952 acres at Orland Township, Cook Co., in 1835. In 1839 Elihu Woolcott of Morgan Co., Illinois, purchased 950acres of government land at Cook Co., Illinois, and 160 acres at Morgan Co., Illinois. He surveyed the route of the Sangamon and Morgan Railroad. Elihu was President of the Board of Trustees of the Jacksonville Female Academy in 1836. He ran as a candidate for Congress for the Liberty Party in 1846, against Abraham Lincoln and Cartwright. His estate was valued at $100,000. He won prizes at the 1853 Illinois State Fair for his cow and poultry. His son Elizur Wolcott was executor of his estate.
3 children: Helen Maria, Julia Ann, Ellen Louise "Ella".
(8) Helen Maria Wolcott8 (Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 JUN 1824 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 13 MAY 1831 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Julia Ann Wolcott8 (Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 JUN 1826 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 JUL 1910 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesJULIA was a student at the Jacksonville Female Academy, graduating in 1845.
m. 19 NOV 1846 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, William Chauncy Carter, b. 2 APR 1820 New Canaan, Fairfield Co., Connecticut, d. 9 DEC 1896 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM came to Illinois in 1833. The family settled on a farm four miles south of Jacksonville in Morgan Co. He graduated from Illinois College in 1845 and taught school for a few years. He then purchased a farm next to his father's farm. His barn was a way station on the "Underground Railroad". In 1873 he moved into Jacksonbville, where he served eight years on the city council and Director of the school.
9 children: Samuel Wolcott, William Chauncey, Edwin, William Wallace, Ella Marian, Walter Lee, Truman Post, Herbert, Helen Hooker.
(9) Samuel Wolcott Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 APR 1849 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesSAMUEL was a farmer at Joy Prarie.
m. 14 MAR 1876 Hannah Joy, b. , d. .
3 children: Ernest Chauncy, Sylvester Joy, Samuel Wilford.
(10) Ernest Chauncy Carter10 (Samuel Wolcott Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 FEB 1877 , d. .
(10) Sylvester Joy Carter10 (Samuel Wolcott Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 NOV 1880 , d. .
(10) Samuel Wilford Carter10 (Samuel Wolcott Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 JAN 1893 , d. .

(9) Herbert Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 OCT 1870 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 24 MAY 1899 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania.
NotesHERBERT graduated from Illinois College in 1892, and from Hahnemann Medical College in Philadelphia in 1895. He had a druggist business in Jacksonville for a few yearsm and then returned to Philadelphia to study diseases of the nose and throat.
(9) Helen Hooker Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 OCT 1870 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 11 JUN 1871 .
(8) Ellen Louise "Ella" Wolcott8 (Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 JUN 1828 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 APR 1912 Elmira, Chemung Co., New York.
NotesELLEN had a dermatalogical illness and spent much time undergoing various cures. After the death of her father she had financial problems. She worked for the Sanitary Comission as a nurse during the Civil War, where she was a correspondent of Dorthea Dix. After the war she was a librarian at Elmira, New York. In 1880 she was living alone at Elmira. Her letters and papers are in the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, at the University of Connecticut Library. Ellen L. Wolcott of Elmira, New York, is reported deceased in the 1912 Society report, and is described as "a loyal member of the society from its beginning."
m. McVaugh, b. , d. .
1 children: Archie.
(9) Archie McVaugh9 (Ellen Louise "Ella" Wolcott8, Juliana Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. 28 JUN 1912 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesARCHIE was killed.
(7) Helen Wolcott7 (Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 MAR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 4 APR 1840 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesHELEN attended Mrs. Royce's School for Girls at Hartford, as did her cousin, Ursula Wolcott.
m. 3 SEP 1822 , Ontario Co., New York, Horace Hooker, b. 5 JUL 1794 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 NOV 1865 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
Spouse NotesHORACE came to Carthage, New York, from Windsor, Connecticut, in 1821, and was engaged in comercial ventures. Carthage became part of Rochester.
8 children: Julia Wolcott, Henry Edward, Frances, James Wolcott, John Chaffee, Charles M., Thomas, Horace B..
(8) Julia Wolcott Hooker8 (Helen Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 APR 1823 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
m. 12 JUL 1844 Josiah Wolcott Bissell, b. 3 MAY 1818 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
Spouse NotesJOSIAH was engaged before the Civil War in banking, and in architectural and engineering work. During the war he was colonel of an engineer regiment attached to Gen. Pope's army, and superintended the construction of the canal that enabled the national gunboats to approach the confederate works on Island No. 10, in the Mississippi River.
6 children: Josiah Wolcott, Willard Parker, Helen Wolcott, Edward Hooker, Francis, George Perkins.
(9) Josiah Wolcott Bissell9 (Julia Wolcott Hooker8, Helen Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 JUN 1845 , d. .

NotesJAMES was a Lt. in the 1st Regiment Missoui Engineers during the Civil War. He committed suicide by hanging himself.

NotesHORACE was a Lt. and acting Capt. in the 1st Regiment Missouri Engineers during the Civil War.
m. 14 NOV 1861 Susan Pamelia Huntington, b. 18 AUG 1841 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 1928 .
Spouse NotesSUSAN's biography was published in 1952 as "Susan Huntington Hooker, a Biography", by Kenneth Ward Hooker. Her letters and family papers are at the University of Rochester.

NotesMARGARET was an artist and a teacher.
(9) Elon Huntington Hooker9 (Horace B. Hooker8, Helen Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 NOV 1869 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 1938 .
NotesELON was a chemist, hydrodynamic engineer, and founder of the Hooker Electrochemical Co., founded in 1909. He was a candidate for the Republican nomination for Governor of New York in 1920.

m. Trimble, b. , d. .
(9) Thomas Hooker9 (Horace B. Hooker8, Helen Wolcott7, Erastus Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 MAY 1883 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 12 SEP 1884 .
(6) Flavia Wolcott6 (Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 JAN 1754 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 MAY 1827 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 20 AUG 1783 ,, Connecticut, Roswell Grant, b. 9 MAR 1746 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 31 DEC 1834 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesROSWELL graduated from Yale in 1765. It is thought that he commanded the "Connecticut" in the naval engagement on Lake Champlain in 1776. He enlisted in the Continental service in 1778, and in the same year was appointed Captain. He served from July 1780 to December 1780 as commanding officer of the commissary of a Brigade of the Continental Army appointed by the Connecticut Legislature October 1780, for which he received a pension. After the war he served as paymaster and Judge Advocate. In 1794 he was appointed Lt. Col. of the 19th Connecticut Regiment. In 1812 he was the Captain of a company of volunteers.
8 children: Harry, Ebenezer, Henrietta, Ann, Roswell Henry, Sidney Algernon, Paschal Winthrop, Frederick William.
(7) Harry Grant7 (Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 NOV 1783 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 13 JUN 1787 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Ebenezer Grant7 (Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 FEB 1785 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 FEB 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Henrietta Grant7 (Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 MAR 1787 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 FEB 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Ann Grant7 (Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 SEP 1788 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 21 NOV 1851 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Roswell Henry Grant7 (Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 MAR 1790 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 SEP 1836 Conneaut, Ashtabula Co., Ohio.
(7) Sidney Algernon Grant7 (Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 FEB 1792 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 18 MAY 1827 St. Louis, St. Louis Co., Missouri.

(7) Frederick William Grant7 (Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 DEC 1797 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 21 FEB 1886 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesFREDERICK took over his father's farm. He served as Corporal, Sgt., 2nd Lt., and Capt. of the 2nd Co., 1st Cav. Regt. He was appointed Major in the 1st Cav. Regt. in 1832.

(9) Frederick William Grant9 (Roswell Grant8, Frederick William Grant7, Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 AUG 1876 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(9) Roger Wolcott Grant9 (Roswell Grant8, Frederick William Grant7, Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 SEP 1881 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(8) Elizabeth Grant8 (Frederick William Grant7, Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 JUL 1848 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. AUG 1849 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Elizabeth Lucy Grant8 (Frederick William Grant7, Flavia Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 AUG 1850 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 SEP 1851 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Jerusha Wolcott6 (Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 NOV 1755 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 19 MAR 1844 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesJERUSHA was receiving a military pension in 1840, residing at East Windsor, Connecticut, with her daughter, Ursula Skinner.
m. 29 DEC 1774 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Samuel Wolcott, b. 4 APR 1751 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 JUN 1813 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesSAMUEL served in the Commissary of the 8th Connecticut Line during the Revolutionary War, and his wife, Jerusha, later received a military pension. He occupied a house in East Windsor, now South Windsor, where his children and grandchildren were born. This house stood on the home site of his grandfather, Henry Wolcott. Some of the materials used in the house are said to be from the original home. In 1790, his family at East Windsor consisted of 5 males over 16, 2 males under 16, and 6 women. Samuel was said to have been nearly six feet high, with robust frame, dark hair, and dark hazel eyes. His estate was valued at $30,669. His widow, Jerusha, age 81, applied for a military widow's pension in 1836 at Hartford, Connecticut.
8 children: Jerusha, Naomi, Samuel, Elihu, Sophia, Ursula, Elizabeth, Horace.
(7) Jerusha Wolcott7 (Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 OCT 1775 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Avon, Genesee Co., New York.
m. 30 NOV 1794 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Epaphras Bissell, b. 24 JUL 1765 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 NOV 1826 Avon, Genesee Co., New York.
6 children: Frances, Edward, Frederick, Sidney, Theodore, Leverett.
(8) Frances Bissell8 (Jerusha Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. SEP 1795 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .

(10) Maud Gleason10 (Mary Bissell9, Edward Bissell8, Jerusha Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 MAY 1869 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, d. .
(9) Henry Tudor Bissell9 (Edward Bissell8, Jerusha Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 AUG 1834 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. 9 SEP 1863 Louisville, Jefferson Co., Kentucky.
NotesHENRY enlisted 22 August 1862 in the 111th Ohio Volunteer Regiment and was Adjustant of the regiment and participated in Gen. Buell's campaign in pursult of Bragg's army. He died of extra fatigue and exposure in The Sisters' Hospital. He was educated at Brown University in Rhode Island and studied law in Cincinnati, Ohio. Source #70, Vol. 2, page 97.
