(10) Nellie Cheever10 (Laura Edna Bissell9, Theodore Bissell8, Jerusha Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. NOV 1872 , d. MAR 1890 .
(9) Henry Bissell9 (Theodore Bissell8, Jerusha Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. MAY 1840 , d. .
(8) Leverett Bissell8 (Jerusha Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. SEP 1807 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 21 SEP 1872 .
m. 26 NOV 1840 Julia Watson, b. , d. .
(7) Naomi Wolcott7 (Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 OCT 1777 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 MAR 1831 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York.
m. 23 OCT 1804 , Ontario Co., New York, James Wadsworth, b. 20 APR 1768 Durham, Middlesex Co., Connecticut, d. 7 JUN 1844 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York.
Spouse NotesJAMES was the a nephew of James Wadsworth, a Major General in the Continental Army. James graduated from Yale College in 1787. He briefly taught school at Montreal, Canada. He and his brother, William Wadsworth each obtained 2,000 acres of land in the Genesee Valley of New York. They moved there in 1790 and built a log cabin. By 1800 they owned 35,000 acres between them, most of which stayed in the family for many generations. James built a home for his new bride, Naomi, who he married in 1804. It was called "The Homestead". He was the chief founder of the town of Geneseo. He gave the proceeds from articles and lectures to establish the town's first library; advocated the idea of normal schools in 1811; accomplished the passage of a school library law in 1838, and established an institution for scientific lectures to which he gave an endowment fund of $10,000. He was the owner of vast tracts of land and in disposing of the same made the condition that 125 acres in every township be gratuitously set aside for a church, and an equal amount for a school. Over his life time, in contributed over $100,000 to education. He was a Brigadier General in the New York militia in the War of 1812.
5 children: Harriet, James Samson, William Wolcott, Cornelia, Elizabeth.
(8) Harriet Wadsworth8 (Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 SEP 1805 , d. 1834 .
m. Martin Brimmer, b. , d. .
Spouse NotesMARTIN graduated from Harvard University in 1814. He was Mayor of Boston, Massachusetts.
1 children: Martin.
(9) Martin Brimmer9 (Harriet Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
NotesMARTIN graduated fron Harvard University in 1849.
(8) James Samson Wadsworth8 (Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 OCT 1807 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. 6 MAY 1864 Wilderness, Spotsylvania Co., Virginia.
NotesJAMES dropped out of Harvard, studied law with Daniel Webster, and was admitted to the bar in 1833. He married a "celebrated beauty" and took her to Europe for their honeymoon. Fascinated by the way the English gentry lived, he returned to Geneseo and built a palatial house called "Hartford House". He purchased 24,000 acres of government land in Ohio in 1836. He had a home in New York City, and maintained a racing stable and an impressive wine cellar. He entertained lavishly, his guests including many prominent government officials and European nobility. His house had nine servant rooms and other servants came in for the day. He divorced his first wife and remarried. In 1855, James took his family to France and England for two years. He was a leader in various agricultural movements, and was an unsuccessful candidate for Governor of New York. He was an outspoken opponent of slavery. James volunteered for the Union Army in 1861, and fought at the Battle of Bull Run and at Gettysburg. He was briefly Military Governor of Washington, D.C., and was nominated for Governor of New York in 1862. James commanded the Union troops at the Battle of The Wilderness in 1864, and died during the battle, reportedly after saying: "Steady boys. Come ahead. There isn't danger enough to harm a mouse." In 1868 he had an estate of 7,237 acres at Geneseo. The wil of James S. Wadsworth of Livingston, New York, dated 1856. recorded at Fulton Co., Ohio, states that he owned about 24,000 acres of land in Northwest Ohio, purchased fron the government in 1836. It mentions his children, Charles F. Wadsworth, Craig W. Wadsworth, James Wadsworth Jr., Cornelia, Nancy, and Elizabeth; nephew, Martin Brimmer; son-in-law, Montgomery Ritchie of Ritchey & Fitzhugh of New York City. His wife, Mary C. W. Wadsworth, is to have the home she was given in her fathers will dated 1837, and the home and library in New York City. He mentions various pieces of land formerly belonging to William A. Wadsworth, Livingston Wadsworth, and Herbert Wadsworth, infant children of William W. Wadsworth, and their mother, Emeline Wadsworth, and Charles James Murry, infant child of Elizabeth Wadsworth Murry.
m. 11 MAY 1834 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, Mary Craig Wharton, b. ABT 1811 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. .
6 children: Charles Frederick, Cornelia, Craig Wharton "Tic", Nancy Craig, James Wolcott, Elizabeth,
(9) Charles Frederick Wadsworth9 (James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1835 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. .
m. Jessie Burden, b. , d. .
1 children: Mary Wharton.
(10) Mary Wharton Wadsworth10 (Charles Frederick Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(9) Cornelia Wadsworth9 (James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 APR 1837 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. 22 SEP 1921 London,, England.
NotesCORNELIA met her second husband while touring England with her first husband. After his death she took her two sons to Paris where the eldest died a few years later. After her second marriage she lived in Ireland. She and her husband toured the American West in 1874, and she kept a diary of the experience which was published in 1918. In 1877 they purchased land in Donley Co., Texas, which became the J&A Ranch. It covered 336,000 acres, and grew to 500,000 acres in 1917. They kept 100,000 head of cattle on the ranch. Cornelia ran the ranch after her husband's death.
m. 1857 Montgomery Ritchie, b. Of Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 1864 Geneseo, Ontario Co., New York.
Spouse NotesMONTGOMERY was head of the firm, Ritchey & Fitzhugh of New York City. He helped recruit the regiment that became known as Wadsworth Guards. He was an officer in the 2nd Inf. BN., New England Guard, serving on the staff of Maj. Gen Augur. He resigned his commission in 1864 due to ill health, and died six months later.
2 children: Arthur Montgomery, James Wadsworth "Jack".
(10) Arthur Montgomery Ritchie10 (Cornelia Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. ABT 1866 Paris, Seine, France.
(10) James Wadsworth "Jack" Ritchie10 (Cornelia Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1861 Geneseo, Ontario Co., New York, d. 1924 ,, England.
NotesJAMES graduated from Cambridge University in 1931. He worked for a while on his mother's ranch in Texas. He then enlisted for service in the Boer War in 1889 and became a Major. After the war he settled in England. He had a large art collection and was a pilot and photographer.
(9) Cornelia Wadsworth9 (James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 APR 1837 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. 22 SEP 1921 London,, England.
NotesCORNELIA met her second husband while touring England with her first husband. After his death she took her two sons to Paris where the eldest died a few years later. After her second marriage she lived in Ireland. She and her husband toured the American West in 1874, and she kept a diary of the experience which was published in 1918. In 1877 they purchased land in Donley Co., Texas, which became the J&A Ranch. It covered 336,000 acres, and grew to 500,000 acres in 1917. They kept 100,000 head of cattle on the ranch. Cornelia ran the ranch after her husband's death.
m. 1869 John G. Adair, b. 1823 ,, Ireland, d. 1885 ,, Texas.
Spouse NotesJOHN was a wealthy Englishman, owner of Glenveagh Castle in Ireland. He came to America and opened a brokerage house in 1866. He and Charles Goodnight founded the J. A. Ranch at Armstrong Co., Texas, in 1876, and by 1882 had nearly a million acres. In 1881 he was Deputy Leiutenanant Magistrate living at North Lodge, Melton Mowbray, Leicester, England, with wife Cornelia and 15 servants. After his death his widow had a controlling interest in the J. A. Ranch
(9) Craig Wharton "Tic" Wadsworth9 (James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1841 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. 1 JAN 1872 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania.
NotesCRAIG was mustered in as a Lieutenant in the Union Army in September 1861, and served as an aide to Gen. John F. Reynolds. After Reynold's death in 1863, he joined the staff of Gen. John Burford. He was brevetted Major, Lt. Colonel, and was made Colonel 13 March 1864. He resigned his comission 16 July 1864. In 1868 he was living at Geneseo.
m. 31 MAR 1869 Evelyn Willing Peters, b. 1845 , d. 1885 .
2 children: Craig Wharton, James Samuel "Jim Sam".
(10) Craig Wharton Wadsworth10 (Craig Wharton "Tic" Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1872 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. 1960 .
(10) James Samuel "Jim Sam" Wadsworth10 (Craig Wharton "Tic" Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 FEB 1870 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. 3 JUL 1930 Buffalo, Erie Co., New York.
NotesJAMES graduated from Harvard University. In 1916 he enlisted as a Private and went to the Mexican border. He was comissioned a Lieutenant at Spartanburg, South Carolina, and served as a Captain in the Hq. Trp., 27th Div. overseas during World War I. He led a colorful life, backed a musical comedy, owned a stable of racing horses, divorced his wife and remarried, fought in the war, and lost most of his money. He was Master of the Genesee Valley Hunt.
(9) Nancy Craig Wadsworth9 (James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
m. 25 OCT 1866 M. Edward Rogers, b. , d. .
2 children: James Wadsworth, Harriet Ruggles.
(10) James Wadsworth Rogers10 (Nancy Craig Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Harriet Ruggles Rogers10 (Nancy Craig Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(9) James Wolcott Wadsworth9 (James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 OCT 1846 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. 24 DEC 1926 Washington, District of Columbia.
NotesJAMES was preparing to enter Yale College when word came of his father's death in battle. He immediately enlisted in the Army, and was appointed a Captain on the staff of Maj. Gen. G.K. Warren, commanding the 5th Army Corps of the Potomac. He was brevetted a Major for gallantry at Five Forks, 1 April 1865. After the war he managed the family estates at Geneseo, New York and built a large house called "Hartford House. He loved baseball, and financed teams on which his son, Jimmy, played. He also was a fan of harness racing. James was active in Republican politics. He was elected to the New York State Assembly, 1878-1879; State Comptroller, 1880-1881. In 1881 he was elected to fill an unexpired term in the U.S. House of Representatives, Eldridge G. Lapham, and the next year was elected for a new term from the 27th district in the 47th and 48th Congress. He served in the 52nd - 58th congress, 1891-1905 from the 13th district and served as chairman of the Committee on Agriculture. In 1898, James was given an Honorary MA degree by Yale University. He was then appointed to the State Racing Commission, and in 1915 was a member of the State Constitutional Convention. He was for many years President of the Geneseo National Bank and of the Genesee River National Bank.
m. Maria Louisa "Eloise" Travers, b. ABT 1843 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. 6 MAY 1931 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York.
Spouse NotesMARIA's father had made a fortune on Wall Street. She was a first cousin of Jennie Churchill, mother of Winston Churchill.
2 children: James Wolcott, Harriet.
(10) James Wolcott Wadsworth10 (James Wolcott Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 AUG 1877 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. 21 JUN 1952 Washington, District of Columbia.
NotesJAMES worked summers as a laborer on his father's farm, and at one time managed his aunt Cornelia's ranch. He attended St. Mark's School and graduated from Yale University. He left school to enlist as a Private in the Spanish American War, and later visited the Phillipines as a civilian. He inherited "Hartford House" from his father. He was a member of the New York State Assembly from Livingston County from 1904 to 1910, and was elected Speaker from 1906 to 1910. He was elected U.S. Senator for New York from 1914 to 1926, and was Chairman of the Senate Military Affairs Committee. James was a leader in the anti-suffrage movement, and president of the company that published an anti-suffrage newspaper. He and was a member of Congress for eight terms from the 39th District of New York, beginning in 1934 until 1949. James was the Honorary President of the National Defense League. He was United States Ambassador to the United Nations from 1960 to 1961.
(10) Harriet Wadsworth10 (James Wolcott Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 OCT 1881 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. .
NotesHARRIET was the author of "Around the World in 80 years on a Sidesaddle", published in 1966, and "Thoughts in the Night" published in 1967, and others.
(9) Elizabeth Wadsworth9 (James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1849 , d. .
m. Arthur Post, b. , d. .
1 children: Helen Agnes.
(10) Helen Agnes Post10 (Elizabeth Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. 1 SEP 1962 .
(9) Elizabeth Wadsworth9 (James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1849 , d. .
m. 28 FEB 1889 Arthur Hugh Barrymore, b. , d. 21 SEP 1844 .
Spouse NotesARTHUR was 1st and last Baron Barrymore of Fota Island, Queenstown, Ireland.
1 children: Dorothy Elizabeth.
(10) Dorothy Elizabeth Barrymore10 (Elizabeth Wadsworth9, James Samson Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(8) William Wolcott Wadsworth8 (Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1806 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. .
NotesWILLIAM remained a bachelor.
m. 5 JAN 1846 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, Emeline Austin, b. 27 NOV 1808 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. .
3 children: William Austin, Livingston, Herbert.
(9) William Austin Wadsworth9 (William Wolcott Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1847 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. .
NotesWILLIAM lived alone until mid-life, in "The Homestead", which he inherited from his mother. He introduced fox hunting into the Genessee Valley in 1876. The Genessee Valley Hunt is the third oldest in the country. He served in the Rough Riders during the Spanish American War, and in the 101st Cav. Bde. in France during World War I.
m. Elizabeth Perkins, b. Of Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. .
1 children: William Perkins.
(10) William Perkins Wadsworth10 (William Austin Wadsworth9, William Wolcott Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1906 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. 1982 .
NotesWILLIAM lived in "The Homestead" after the death of his mother. He was Master of the Genessee Valley Hunt from 1932 to 1975.
(9) Livingston Wadsworth9 (William Wolcott Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1849 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. 1855 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York.
(9) Herbert Wadsworth9 (William Wolcott Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1851 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. .
m. Blow, b. , d. .
(8) Cornelia Wadsworth8 (Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1810 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. .
(8) Elizabeth Wadsworth8 (Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 JUL 1815 Geneseo, Livingston Co., New York, d. 8 DEC 1851 Cairo,, Egypt.
NotesELIZABETH was considered beautiful and talented, and was courted by many men. She met her future husband when he visited America in 1834. Her father refused to consent to this marriage, but after his death she visited England and married Charles there in Westminster Abbey. She died following complications caused by the birth of her son.
m. 12 DEC 1850 London,, England, Charles Augustus Murray, b. 22 NOV 1806 ,, Scotland, d. 3 JUN 1895 .
Spouse NotesCHARLES was the second son of the Earl of Dunmore. He attended Eaton and graduated from Oxford. In 1834 he visited America, where he met his future wife. He was a member of the Queen's Household, and then was attached to the British Consulate at Naples. He was appointed British Consul-General to Cairo, and then to Berne. In 1854 he became the British Minister to Persia.
1 children: Charles James.
(9) Charles James Murray9 (Elizabeth Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 NOV 1851 , d. 25 SEP 1929 .
NotesCHARLES was educated at Eton. He visited his mother's family in 1880. He purchased the Lochcarron estate, including Courthill House, in 1882. He lost part of his fortune during World War I, and then came to live primarily at Courthill House. He served as a Member of Parliament.
m. 9 AUG 1875 Anne Frenchesca Wihelmina Finch, b. , d. 16 JAN 1933 .
3 children: Sybil Louise, Alasdair, .
(10) Sybil Louise Murray10 (Charles James Murray9, Elizabeth Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 JAN 1876 , d. .
(10) Alasdair Murray10 (Charles James Murray9, Elizabeth Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. 1900 .
NotesALASDAIR died of wounds received in battle during the Boer War.
(10) Murray10 (Charles James Murray9, Elizabeth Wadsworth8, Naomi Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1881 , d. 1885 .
(7) Samuel Wolcott7 (Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 DEC 1781 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 FEB 1795 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Elihu Wolcott7 (Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 FEB 1784 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 DEC 1858 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesELIHU was a Representative to the Connecticut Legislature for East Windsor. He sold the family farm and moved to Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois in 1830. It was said that had a two room cabin, but that their furniture was shipped via New Orleans and did not arrive until the next spring. Elihu was a merchant and land owner. He purchased a large amount of land in 6 counties in Illinois between 1831 and 1849, including 952 acres at Orland Township, Cook Co., in 1835. In 1839 Elihu Woolcott of Morgan Co., Illinois, purchased 950acres of government land at Cook Co., Illinois, and 160 acres at Morgan Co., Illinois. He surveyed the route of the Sangamon and Morgan Railroad. Elihu was President of the Board of Trustees of the Jacksonville Female Academy in 1836. He ran as a candidate for Congress for the Liberty Party in 1846, against Abraham Lincoln and Cartwright. His estate was valued at $100,000. He won prizes at the 1853 Illinois State Fair for his cow and poultry. His son Elizur Wolcott was executor of his estate.
m. 27 NOV 1806 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Rachel McClure, b. 29 OCT 1783 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 APR 1822 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
7 children: Elizabeth Ann, Elihu, Hannah McClure, Samuel, Arthur, Elizur, Frances Jane.
(8) Elizabeth Ann Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 DEC 1807 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa.
m. 28 NOV 1832 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, Carlton H. Perry, b. 1802 Arlington, Bennington Co., Vermont, d. Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa.
Spouse NotesCARLTON commanded a regiment during the Civil War. In 1880 he lived at Keokuk, Iowa, where he was described as a "capitalist".
2 children: Howard Wolcott, Katharine Wolcott "Kate".
(9) Howard Wolcott Perry9 (Elizabeth Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(9) Katharine Wolcott "Kate" Perry9 (Elizabeth Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1820 ,, Illinois, d. NOV 1924 Capri, Isola Di Capri, Italy.
NotesKATHERINE resided on the Isle of Capri, Italy, with her cousin, Sarah Morrison Wolcott. When her cousin died in 1918, she returned to America. Her escort, sent from America to accompany her home was held for two days, having the same name as a noted spy operating in France. She joined the Wolcott Society in 1916.
(8) Elihu Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1808 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(8) Hannah McClure Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 JUN 1811 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 31 AUG 1858 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
m. 28 NOV 1832 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, William Kirby, b. 2 JUL 1805 Middletown, Middlesex Co., Connecticut, d. 20 DEC 1851 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM graduated from Yale in 1827. He went to Illinois as a member of the Yale band of missionarys. In 1846 the family moved to Jacksonville. He was Superintendant of Home Missions in Illinois. His wife, Hannah, and father-in-law, Elihu Wolcott were named guardian of his children, William, Frances, Catherine, Helen, and Bessie.
7 children: Edward Payson, William Arthur, Frances Caroline, Katherine Wolcott, Helen McClure, Henry Burgess, Elizabeth Pomeroy "Bessie".
(9) Edward Payson Kirby9 (Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 OCT 1833 Blackstone's Grove, Will Co., Illinois, d. 25 FEB 1917 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesEDWARD graduated from Illinois College in 1854 and taught at the West Jacksonville School, where he became Principal. He read law and was admitted to the Illinois bar in 1862, after which he opened a practace at Jacksonville. He received his LLD degree in 1880. He was a lawyer and a Morgan County Judge at Jacksonville, Illinois, and a trustee of Illinois College. He had no children in 1880. He was a member of the Illinois State Historical Society, and joined the Illinois Sons of the American Revolution in 1896 as a descendant of Gen. Erastus Wolcott.
m. 28 OCT 1862 Julia Smith Duncan, b. , d. 5 JUL 1896 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(9) Edward Payson Kirby9 (Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 OCT 1833 Blackstone's Grove, Will Co., Illinois, d. 25 FEB 1917 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesEDWARD graduated from Illinois College in 1854 and taught at the West Jacksonville School, where he became Principal. He read law and was admitted to the Illinois bar in 1862, after which he opened a practace at Jacksonville. He received his LLD degree in 1880. He was a lawyer and a Morgan County Judge at Jacksonville, Illinois, and a trustee of Illinois College. He had no children in 1880. He was a member of the Illinois State Historical Society, and joined the Illinois Sons of the American Revolution in 1896 as a descendant of Gen. Erastus Wolcott.
m. 1898 ,, Illinois, Lucinda Gallaher, b. , d. .
(9) William Arthur Kirby9 (Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 AUG 1837 Mendon, Adams Co., Illinois, d. ABT 1922 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesWILLIAM was a Captain in the Civil War. He was a soap maker at Jacksonville, Illinois, in 1880, age 43, with Arabella 38, Clement 11, Harry 7, and Marian 3. He was a member of the Wolcott Society 1916-20, residing at Jacksonville, Illinois.
m. 10 SEP 1867 Arabella Clement, b. 23 MAR 1842 Port Mills,, Vermont, d. 31 DEC 1910 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
4 children: Clement Rufus, Henry Wolcott, Marian Dorothy, William Joshua.
(10) Clement Rufus Kirby10 (William Arthur Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 JUL 1868 South Pass,, Illinois, d. .
NotesCLEMENT was a Captain in the Ordnance Department at Brownsville, Texas, in 1919.
(10) Henry Wolcott Kirby10 (William Arthur Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 OCT 1872 South Pass,, Illinois, d. .
NotesHENRY was at Jacksonville, Illinois, in 1880. He was a dentist at Sebring, Florida, in 1923.
(10) Marian Dorothy Kirby10 (William Arthur Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 OCT 1876 South Pass,, Illinois, d. .
NotesMARION was DAR member #10996.
(10) William Joshua Kirby10 (William Arthur Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 JUL 1883 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
(9) Frances Caroline Kirby9 (Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 JAN 1840 Mendon, Adams Co., Illinois, d. .
m. 1 AUG 1861 James McLaughlin, b. 25 OCT 1829 , d. 17 AUG 1870 .
5 children: William Kirby, Bessie, Harry James, Frank Wolcott, Helen Margaret.
(10) William Kirby McLaughlin10 (Frances Caroline Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JAN 1862 Red Bluff, Tehama Co., California, d. .
(10) Bessie McLaughlin10 (Frances Caroline Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 JAN 1864 Red Bluff, Tehama Co., California, d. .
(10) Harry James McLaughlin10 (Frances Caroline Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 JUN 1865 Red Bluff, Tehama Co., California, d. .

(10) Helen Margaret McLaughlin10 (Frances Caroline Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 OCT 1869 Gilroy, Santa Cruz Co., California, d. 1 MAR 1872 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(9) Katherine Wolcott Kirby9 (Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 JUL 1842 Mendon, Adams Co., Illinois, d. 20 MAR 1880 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
m. 9 SEP 1862 Charles Emery Ross, b. , d. 1908 .
4 children: Helen, Edward Kirby, Carlton Perry, Edith Wolcott.
(10) Helen Ross10 (Katherine Wolcott Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 SEP 1863 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
(10) Edward Kirby Ross10 (Katherine Wolcott Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 JAN 1865 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
(10) Carlton Perry Ross10 (Katherine Wolcott Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 NOV 1868 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
(10) Edith Wolcott Ross10 (Katherine Wolcott Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 JUL 1872 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesEDITH was DAR member #10434.
(9) Helen McClure Kirby9 (Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 JAN 1845 Mendon, Adams Co., Illinois, d. 29 JUL 1923 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesHELEN was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914 residing at Mt. Morris Park, New York., and vice-president for Eastern New York 1914-15.
m. 23 JUN 1870 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, Melatiah Everett Dwight, b. 15 OCT 1841 South Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 14 SEP 1907 Northampton, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts.
5 children: Ellsworth Everett, Richard Everett, William Kirby, Katharine Wolcott, Marion Edith.
(10) Ellsworth Everett Dwight10 (Helen McClure Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 MAR 1871 Onarga, Iroquois Co., Illinois, d. 25 FEB 1955 .
NotesELLSWORTH was a physician living at Summit, New Jersey, in 1920, when he joined the Wolcott Society. He rejoined in 1951 as member #491, residing at Summit, New Jersey.
(10) Richard Everett Dwight10 (Helen McClure Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 JUN 1875 Onarga, Iroquois Co., Illinois, d. .
(10) William Kirby Dwight10 (Helen McClure Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 AUG 1879 , d. .
(10) Katharine Wolcott Dwight10 (Helen McClure Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 AUG 1881 Fairfield, Jefferson Co., Iowa, d. 30 AUG 1967 New Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
NotesKATHARINE graduated from Mt. Holyoke College. She joined the Wolcott Society in 1925 as member #95, residing at Paris, France. She was also a member of Magna Carta Dames.
(10) Marion Edith Dwight10 (Helen McClure Kirby9, Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 FEB 1886 Fairfield, Jefferson Co., Iowa, d. .
(9) Henry Burgess Kirby9 (Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 MAR 1848 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 4 AUG 1849 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(9) Elizabeth Pomeroy "Bessie" Kirby9 (Hannah McClure Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 APR 1850 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesELIZABETH joined the Wolcott Society in 1916, residing at New York City.
(8) Samuel Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUL 1813 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 FEB 1886 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Notes SAMUEL graduated from Yale College in 1833 and gave the Commencement Oration. He graduated from the Andover Theological Seminary in 1837, and was ordained in 1839. In 1837 his name is at the head of a number of Andover students who issued an anti-slavery manifesto. Samuel was a missionary to Syria from 1840 to 1843. He is said to have been one of two Americans who were the first Westerners to climb to the Jewish stronghold at Masada in 1842. Returning to America he became pastor of the Longmeadow, Massachusetts, Congregational Church in 1843. Between 1843 and 1853 he was among the principal speakers at temperance conventions. He became minister at Belchertown, Massachusetts in 1849; The High Street Congregational Church at Providence, Rhode Island in 1853; The New England Congregational Church of Chicago, Illinois, in 1859; and finally at Plymouth Congregational Church, Cleveland, Ohio, in 1862. He was at Chicago, Illinois, in 1860, with Harriet A., Samuel A., Henry R., Edward O., Harriet A., William E., Catherine E., Ann L., and Caroline G. Wolcott. Samuel was given an honorary STD degree by Marietta College, in 1863. During the Civil War, he went South with the U.S. Christian Commission. He was at Cleveland, Ohio, in 1870, with Harriett, Kate, Annie, Clara, Herbert, and Lottie. Samuel resigned his church ministry in 1874 to become Secretary of the Ohio Home Missionary Society. He was a minister at Cleveland, Ohio, in 1880. In 1880 Samuel Wolcott was on a delinquent tax list for Jacksonville, Illinois. He was the author of numerous religious tracts and hymns, the best known being, "Christ for the World we Sing", published in the 1892 hymnal of the Protestant Episcopal Church and subsequently in hymnals of many other denominations. He was the author of the 1st Wolcott Genealogy "The Wolcott Memorial" published in 1881. He is described as being tall in stature, with abundant white hair and beard. His sons in Denver built a fine home at Longmeadow, Massachusetts, for his retirement.
m. 5 SEP 1839 Westminster, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, Catharine Elizabeth Wood, b. 17 DEC 1812 Westminster, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 26 OCT 1841 Beirut,, Syria.
Spouse NotesThe Vital Records of Westminster, Massachusetts read "Wood, Catherine E. and Rev. Samuel Walcott of Jacksonville, Ill. [Int. Aug 17, 1839.]
(8) Samuel Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUL 1813 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 FEB 1886 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Notes SAMUEL graduated from Yale College in 1833 and gave the Commencement Oration. He graduated from the Andover Theological Seminary in 1837, and was ordained in 1839. In 1837 his name is at the head of a number of Andover students who issued an anti-slavery manifesto. Samuel was a missionary to Syria from 1840 to 1843. He is said to have been one of two Americans who were the first Westerners to climb to the Jewish stronghold at Masada in 1842. Returning to America he became pastor of the Longmeadow, Massachusetts, Congregational Church in 1843. Between 1843 and 1853 he was among the principal speakers at temperance conventions. He became minister at Belchertown, Massachusetts in 1849; The High Street Congregational Church at Providence, Rhode Island in 1853; The New England Congregational Church of Chicago, Illinois, in 1859; and finally at Plymouth Congregational Church, Cleveland, Ohio, in 1862. He was at Chicago, Illinois, in 1860, with Harriet A., Samuel A., Henry R., Edward O., Harriet A., William E., Catherine E., Ann L., and Caroline G. Wolcott. Samuel was given an honorary STD degree by Marietta College, in 1863. During the Civil War, he went South with the U.S. Christian Commission. He was at Cleveland, Ohio, in 1870, with Harriett, Kate, Annie, Clara, Herbert, and Lottie. Samuel resigned his church ministry in 1874 to become Secretary of the Ohio Home Missionary Society. He was a minister at Cleveland, Ohio, in 1880. In 1880 Samuel Wolcott was on a delinquent tax list for Jacksonville, Illinois. He was the author of numerous religious tracts and hymns, the best known being, "Christ for the World we Sing", published in the 1892 hymnal of the Protestant Episcopal Church and subsequently in hymnals of many other denominations. He was the author of the 1st Wolcott Genealogy "The Wolcott Memorial" published in 1881. He is described as being tall in stature, with abundant white hair and beard. His sons in Denver built a fine home at Longmeadow, Massachusetts, for his retirement.
m. 1 NOV 1843 Millbury, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, Harriet Amanda Pope, b. 29 JUN 1821 Oxford, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 5 FEB 1901 .
11 children: Samuel Adams, Henry Roger, Edward Oliver, Harriet Agnes, William Edgar, Katharine Ellen "Kate", Mary Alice, Anna Louisa, Clara Gertrude, Herbert Walter, Charlotte Augusta "Lottie",
(9) Samuel Adams Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 SEP 1844 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1883 Encinal, Webb Co., Texas.
NotesSAMEL attended Yale College in the class of 1866, but left in his sophmore year to enter business. In 1869 he was in the paper business at New York City. about this time he purchased a ranch in Webb Co., Texas, on the Rio Grande River, north of Lorado, where he raised livestock.
m. 25 JUL 1883 Julia Ella Neal, b. Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, d. .
1 children: Roger Henry.
(10) Roger Henry Wolcott10 (Samuel Adams Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 JAN 1885 San Antonio, Bexar Co., Texas, d. 30 OCT 1948 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado.
NotesROGER inherited the 10,000 volumn law library of his uncle, Edward Oliver Wolcott. Rover moved to Denver in 1905 and entered Denver Law School. He received an LLB degree from the University of Denver in 1907. He practiced law at Denver from 1907 to 1927, and was the first full time dean of the University of Denver law school 1928-1944, and afterward Dean Emeritus. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1948 as member #387, residing at Denver, Colorado.

1918 Draft Registration:
Roger Henry Wolcott 32, b. 12 Jan 1885, Denver, Denver, Colorado, lawyer, Wm. V. Hodges, wife Louise D. Wolcott, tall, medium build, gray eyes, light brown hair.
(9) Henry Roger Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 MAR 1846 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 31 MAY 1921 Honolulu, Honolulu Co., Hawaii.
NotesHENRY worked in two banks at Cleveland, Ohio. In 1864, he enlisted for 100 days service in a Cleveland Regiment that was sent to defend Washington. He then enlisted in the 143th Ohio Regiment until mustered out. He moved to Colorado in 1869, and tried mining and running a mill. In 1870 he was at Central City, Gilpin Co., Colorado. He became acting manager of the Boston & Colorado Smelting Co. at Black Hawk, becoming a stockholder and General Manager. He was also Secretary Treasurer of the Last Chance Mining and Milling Co. His brother, Edward, joined him in Colorado and the two became active in politics. He purchased land in Colorado in 1875, 1877, 1879, 1881,1888, 1890, 1893, and 1896. He was Colorado State Senator from Gilpin County from 1879 to 1882, and in 1881 was elected President of the Senate, and temporarily served as Acting Governor of Colorado. He was an unsuccessful Republican candidate for Governor in 1882 and 1896, and chairman of the state delegation to the 1888 Republican National Convention in Chicago. In 1887 he purchased a ranch at Bear Creek, Colorado. Henry was President of the Merchants National Bank of Denver, and Vice President of the First National Bank for ten years. He helped develop the Denver, Utah and Pacific Railroad and was its President. He was also a director of the Equitable Life Insurance Society. He built the observatory at Colorado College at Colorado Springs. Henry was given an honorary AM degree by Yale University in 1896, and by Colorado College in 1898. In 1905, the two brothers sailed to Europe where Edward died at Monte Carlo. Henry was living in Hawaii in 1916.
(9) Edward Oliver Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 MAR 1848 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1 MAR 1905 Monte Carlo,, Monaco.
NotesEDWARD and his brother joined a boys military company in Chicago. In 1862 the family moved to Cleveland, where he enlisted in the 150th Ohio Voluntary Regiment in 1864. During that summer he was stationed near Washington, D. C., and was with the Regiment at the battle of Ft. Stevens. He attended Yale, and in 1871 graduated from Harvard Law School, receiving a LLD degree from Yale in 1896. In 1871 he went to Colorado to join his brother, Henry. Edward practiced law at Denver in 1880. He was active in the Republican party, and was elected United States Senator from the State of Colorado in 1889, serving until 1901. He was President of the Republican National Convention at Philadelphia in 1900. In 1890 Edward bought 500 acres of land 14 miles South of Denver. There he built a large 52 room home called "Wolhurst", in 1890, at a cost of 2 million dollars. He lavishly entertained prominent Americans and European royalty there. He left it to his brother, Henry, as he had no wife or children surviving. The home, used as the Wolhurst Saddle Club, burned down in 1951. In 1881 he bought mineral rights to 4 acres of land called "Wild Cat Lode" in Lake Co.. In 1882 he and others bought mineral rights called "The American Star Lode in Boulder Co. In 1889 he bought 160 acres of coal land at Gunnison and Pitkin Co. In 1896 he and the heirs of John T. Herrick, the heirs of Sam P. Rose, Joseph Strumpf bought mineral rights to 8 acres of land in Lake Co. called "Tenderfoot". He was a great gambler at Poker and Faro, and died while visiting the casino at Monte Carlo. His biograph, "Life and Character of Edward Oliver Wolcott" by Thomas Dawson, was privately printed. A large stained glass window with his picture was placed in the Colorado Senate. Known for his eloquence and culture, he was known locally as "Edward of Navarre" because of his patronage of the Navarre, a "house of ill repute".
m. 14 JUN 1899 Buffalo, Erie Co., New York, Frances Esther Metcalfe, b. Buffalo, Erie Co., New York, d. 9 FEB 1932 New York City, New York.
Spouse NotesFRANCES was the author of a biography of herself, "Heritage of Years", published in 1932. She tells about people she had known or met, including the Grand Duke Alexis, Mark Twain, Millard Fillmore, and General Custer. As the wife of two U.S. Senators, she knew the Grants, the Clevelands, the Blaines, and other Washington D.C. notables. Grover Cleveland was the executor of her father's estate. During the last 20 years of her life, her residence in New York City was a gathering place for artists, actors, Musicians, and writers.
(9) Harriet Agnes Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 MAR 1850 Belchertown, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 1917 .
m. 2 APR 1879 , Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, Frederick Osni Vaille, b. 28 JUL 1850 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 15 MAR 1939 .
Spouse NotesFREDERICK graudated from Harvard in 1874. He and Henry Clark compiled the first Harvard Book as a souvenier for fellow Harvard graduates. He was the founder of the Denver Telephone Dispatch Company which established the first phone service between Denver, Colorado, and Black Hawk, Idaho, in 1879. This was the 17th telephone exchange in the nation. In 1880 he was superintendant of a telephone company living at Denver with wife, Harriet A. Vaille, daughter, Harriet, and sister Kate. E. Wolcott.
3 children: Harriet Wolcott, Edith Wolcott, Agnes Wolcott.
(10) Harriet Wolcott Vaille10 (Harriet Agnes Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 MAR 1880 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado, d. 25 NOV 1962 .
NotesHARRIET graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1910.
(10) Edith Wolcott Vaille10 (Harriet Agnes Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 AUG 1882 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado, d. MAY 1956 .
NotesEDITH graduated from Smith College in 1904.
(10) Agnes Wolcott Vaille10 (Harriet Agnes Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 APR 1890 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado, d. 12 JAN 1925 Long's Peak, Rocky Mountain National Park, Colorado.
NotesAGNES graduated from Smith College in 1912. She was an ardent rock climber and a member of the Colorado Mountain Club. Together with two other members she attempted to climb Long's Peak. One turned back and the other two reached the summit at 4 am in 14 degree below zero temperature. On the return trip Agnes fell 150 feet down a steep cliff. The other climber, Walter Kiener, reached her, but she was unable to continue and Kiener went for help. She died before she could be rescued. A stone shelter was built on the mountain at 13,200 feet as a memorial to her.
(9) William Edgar Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 APR 1852 Belchertown, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 MAY 1911 Lawrence, Essex Co., Massachusetts.
NotesWILLIAM graduated from Oberlin College in 1881, and was pastor of the Riverside Congregational Church at Lawrence, Massachusetts, for over 25 years. His large art collection, inherited from his brother, Senator Edward O. Wolcott, was left to the White Fund in 1911, to be placed in a museum in Lawrence when one could be built. William was an acquaintance of the poet, Robert Frost, who said, "Perhaps when that preacher looked me up after "My Butterfly" first appeared in print and talked to me about it, something Providential was happening to me. I'm sure the old gentleman didn't have the slightest idea he was having any effect on a very stubborn youngster who thought he knew what he knew. But something he said actually changed the whole course of my writing. It all became purposeful." William later recommended Frost for a teaching position. (From: Robert Frost, a Life", by Jay Parini.)
m. 26 MAR 1894 Cora Wadsworth, b. Of Methuen, Essex Co., Massachusetts, d. 25 SEP 1895 Lawrence, Essex Co., Massachusetts.
1 children: Samuel Wadsworth.
(10) Samuel Wadsworth Wolcott10 (William Edgar Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAR 1895 Lawrence, Essex Co., Massachusetts, d. 1945 .
NotesSAMUEL was raised by his aunt Clara. He graduated from Williams College and Harvard Law School. He was a lawyer in Boston.
(9) Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 AUG 1854 Providence, Providence Co., Rhode Island, d. 15 MAY 1936 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado.
NotesKATHERINE was a bookeeper, living with her sister, Harriet, in 1880.
m. 25 NOV 1880 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado, Charles Hansen Toll, b. 26 AUG 1850 Memphis, Onandago Co., New York, d. 4 DEC 1901 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado.
Spouse NotesCHARLES graduated from Harvard College in 1872. He was the Attorney General of Colorado 1881-2.
4 children: Charles Hansen "Carl", Roger Wolcott, Henry Wolcott, Oliver Wolcott.
(10) Charles Hansen "Carl" Toll10 (Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 MAY 1882 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado, d. .
NotesCHARLES served in the military during World War I. He was a professor at Amherst College and a genealogist.
(10) Roger Wolcott Toll10 (Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 OCT 1883 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado, d. 25 FEB 1936 Deming, Luna Co., New Mexico.
NotesROGER graduated from Williams College, and served in the military during World War I. He was Superintendant of Yellowstone National Park. Roger was killed in an automobile accident.
(10) Henry Wolcott Toll10 (Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 NOV 1887 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado, d. 17 OCT 1975 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado.
NotesHENRY attended Williams College and Harvard Law School. He served in the military during World War II. He was a prominent Denver attorney, and served in the Colorado Senate in the 1920s. He was the founder of the Council of State Governments. The Toll Fellowship Program of the Council of State Governments is named for him. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1941 as member #236, residing at Denver, Colorado.
(10) Oliver Wolcott Toll10 (Katharine Ellen "Kate" Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 AUG 1891 Denver, Arapahoe County, After 1901 Denver Co., Colorado, d. DEC 1981 .
NotesOLIVER graduated from Williams College in 1913 and the Harvard Law School in 1917. he served in the military during World War I. He was a lawyer and served in various role for the government, including the Nuremburg Trials. He was the author of "Arapaho Names and Trails; a Report of a 1914 Pack Trip", published in 1962.
(9) Mary Alice Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 JUL 1856 Providence, Providence Co., Rhode Island, d. 3 FEB 1858 .
(9) Anna Louisa Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 MAY 1858 Providence, Providence Co., Rhode Island, d. 17 AUG 1928 .
NotesANNA graduated from Wellesley College. She moved to Denver, Colorado in 1892 to be Principal of Wolfe Hall Episcopal School for Girls. In 1898 she founded the Wolcott School for Girls in Denver. She was a Regent of University of Colorado from 1910 to 1916, and a delegate to the Republican National Convention in 1923 and a member of the Republican National Committee in 1924. She was vice president of the Wolcott Society for Colorado in 1913.


"As Miss Anna Louise Wolcott she has been, for many years, one of the prominent educators of the state. Founded, and has sinee conducted, the Miss Wolcott School for Girls in Denver. A Regent of the State University since 1910; she is also one of the Board of Managers of the American School of Archacology. at Santa Fe. New Mexico. In January. 1913, she married Mr. Joel F. Vaile
m. JAN 1913 Joel Frederick Vaille, b. 1848 , d. 3 AUG 1916 King, San Bernardino Co., California.
Spouse NotesJOEL was an attorney for the Rio Grande Railroad.
(9) Clara Gertrude Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 DEC 1859 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. DEC 1939 .
NotesCLARA graduated from Smith College in 1883.
(9) Herbert Walter Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 NOV 1861 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. 28 NOV 1941 Los Angeles, Los Angeles Co., California.
NotesHERBERT graduated from Yale College in 1884. He became involved in the management of electric railroads in the Leavenworth, Ohio, area, where he was the first general manager of the Kansas City Leavenworth Electric Railroad Company. He was at Leavenworth in 1900. The power house of the railroad was located at Conner, Kansas, half way to Kansas City. Conner was renamed Wolcott in Herbert's honor in 1902. Herbert was a Republican and an Ohio state senator. In 1917 he was a large landowner in Texas. He gave the principal address at the 1920 Wolcott Society runion, and was President of the Society of Descendants of Henry Wolcott, 1922-1923.
m. 5 OCT 1891 Nettie M. Gabriel, b. , d. 24 JUN 1953 Buffalo, Erie Co., New York.
Spouse NotesNETTIE graduated from Oberlin College.
4 children: Mary Gabriel, Harriet Amanda, Edward Oliver, Henry Roger.
(10) Mary Gabriel Wolcott10 (Herbert Walter Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 APR 1902 , d. .
NotesMARY graduated from Skidmore College. She lived at Pittsburg, Pennsylvania, in 1942.
(10) Harriet Amanda Wolcott10 (Herbert Walter Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 JUL 1905 , d. .
NotesHARRIET graduated from Smith College.
(10) Edward Oliver Wolcott10 (Herbert Walter Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 SEP 1911 , d. AUG 1912 .
(10) Henry Roger Wolcott10 (Herbert Walter Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 AUG 1913 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 4 DEC 1983 , Los Angeles Co., California.
NotesHENRY attended Yale University in the 1930s. He was at West Los Angeles in 1942. He lived at Pasadena, California, in 1954, when he joined the Wolcott Society as member #553.
(9) Charlotte Augusta "Lottie" Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 OCT 1863 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. 16 APR 1912 Fort Leavenworth, Leavenworth Co., Kansas.
NotesCHARLOTTE graduated from Smith College in 1886.
m. 5 JAN 1904 Charles Francis Bates, b. 25 DEC 1862 Monroe, Monroe Co., Michigan, d. 1943 .
Spouse NotesCHARLES received a law degree from Columbia University in 1892. He served in the Spanish American War, and was commanding officer of Camp McArthur at Waco, Texas, during World War I. Retiring after 24 years of military service, he practiced law at Bronxville, New York. He wrote several books, including "Custer's Indian Battles" in 1936. His papers are now in the Yale University Collection of Western Americana.
1 children: Roger Wolcott.
(10) Roger Wolcott Bates10 (Charlotte Augusta "Lottie" Wolcott9, Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 DEC 1904 , d. .
NotesROGER graduated from Yale University in 1929. He was living in 1980 when he sold his father's papers to Yale University.

This or another Roger W. Bates was a World Life Master of Bridge in 1947.
(9) Charlotte Augusta "Lottie" Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 OCT 1863 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. 16 APR 1912 Fort Leavenworth, Leavenworth Co., Kansas.
NotesCHARLOTTE graduated from Smith College in 1886.
m. 21 OCT 1889 , Cook Co., Illinois, John H. Purdy, b. , d. .
(9) Charlotte Augusta "Lottie" Wolcott9 (Samuel Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 OCT 1863 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. 16 APR 1912 Fort Leavenworth, Leavenworth Co., Kansas.
NotesCHARLOTTE graduated from Smith College in 1886.
m. 26 MAR 1885 , Cook Co., Illinois, Robert C. Wright, b. , d. .
(8) Arthur Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 FEB 1815 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 NOV 1873 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa.
NotesARTHUR was a merchant at Keokuk, Iowa, in 1850. He was at Keokuk in 1860 with Clara B. and Sarah M. Wolcott. His burial record says he was born 10 April 1815.
m. 12 JUL 1849 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa, Sarah Ann Morrison, b. 10 DEC 1828 ,, Pennsylvania, d. 27 JAN 1851 .
1 children: Sarah Morrison.
(9) Sarah Morrison Wolcott9 (Arthur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1850 , d. 7 FEB 1917 Capri, Isola Di Capri, Italy.
NotesSARAH was adopted by her aunt and took the name, Sarah Morrison Perry. At the time of her death, her niece, Kathryn Wolcott Perry, was living with her. She joined the Wolcott Society in 1915, residing at Capri, Italy.
(8) Arthur Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 FEB 1815 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 NOV 1873 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa.
NotesARTHUR was a merchant at Keokuk, Iowa, in 1850. He was at Keokuk in 1860 with Clara B. and Sarah M. Wolcott. His burial record says he was born 10 April 1815.
m. 1854 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa, Clara Belknap, b. ABT 1820 Newburgh, Orange Co., New York, d. 24 JAN 1906 Keokuk, Lee Co., Iowa.
Spouse NotesCLARA came to Iowa from Ohio in the early 1850s, and was a long time member of the Presbyterian Church at Keokuk
3 children: Anne, Arthur Ellsworth, Bertha Belknap.
(9) Anne Wolcott9 (Arthur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(9) Arthur Ellsworth Wolcott9 (Arthur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1861 ,, Iowa, d. 13 OCT 1862 .
NotesARTHUR died age 13 months, 13 days.
(9) Bertha Belknap Wolcott9 (Arthur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 APR 1865 , d. .
(8) Elizur Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 AUG 1817 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 10 MAR 1901 Berkeley, Alameda Co., California.
NotesELIZUR graduated from Yale in 1839, was a early member of the "Skull and Bones" Society. He was educated as a physician, but engaged in Railroading and milling. He was roadmaster for the Wabash Railroad, and was a member of the Jacksonville, Illinois, City Council and Board of Education. In 1860 Eleizer Wolcot was a "gentleman" at Jacksonville, Illinois, age 42, with Martha 35, Eddie 9, and Elihu 5 mo. In 1870, he and wife and daughters Edith and May were living at Jacksonville, where he is described as a retired miller. He planned and carried out a city system of water-works for Jacksonville, and planned the Diamond Grove Cemetery.
m. 15 JUL 1846 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, Martha Lyman Dwight, b. 25 APR 1824 ,, Massachusetts, d. 9 JAN 1900 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesMARTHA's name is Marela D. Wolcott on her death record.
4 children: Leofwyn, Edith Dwight, Elihu, Mary Matoon.
(9) Leofwyn Wolcott9 (Elizur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 NOV 1847 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 7 AUG 1858 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(9) Edith Dwight Wolcott9 (Elizur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 DEC 1850 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 16 NOV 1915 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
m. 22 DEC 1897 , Morgan Co., Illinois, John Herbert Davis, b. Of Lynchburg,, Virginia, d. .
(9) Elihu Wolcott9 (Elizur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 DEC 1859 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 29 AUG 1860 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(9) Mary Matoon Wolcott9 (Elizur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 MAY 1863 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .

2 children: Edith Dwight, Miriam Wolcott.
(10) Edith Dwight Clapp10 (Mary Matoon Wolcott9, Elizur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 JAN 1889 , d. .
(10) Miriam Wolcott Clapp10 (Mary Matoon Wolcott9, Elizur Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 NOV 1890 ,, Illinois, d. .
(8) Frances Jane Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 MAR 1819 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 OCT 1871 Hot Springs, Garland Co., Arkansas.
Notes"My Beloved Wife, Frances Wolcott Lewis, a native of East Windsor, Conn., died at Hot Springs, Ark., October 11th (1831?, 1871?)
m. 2 JUN 1849 Mobile, Mobile Co., Alabama, Barbour Lewis, b. ABT 1814 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
Spouse NotesBARBOUR served as a Major during the Civil War. He was a lawyer, a Member of Congress for Tennessee, and a Judge.
(7) Elihu Wolcott7 (Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 FEB 1784 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 DEC 1858 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesELIHU was a Representative to the Connecticut Legislature for East Windsor. He sold the family farm and moved to Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois in 1830. It was said that had a two room cabin, but that their furniture was shipped via New Orleans and did not arrive until the next spring. Elihu was a merchant and land owner. He purchased a large amount of land in 6 counties in Illinois between 1831 and 1849, including 952 acres at Orland Township, Cook Co., in 1835. In 1839 Elihu Woolcott of Morgan Co., Illinois, purchased 950acres of government land at Cook Co., Illinois, and 160 acres at Morgan Co., Illinois. He surveyed the route of the Sangamon and Morgan Railroad. Elihu was President of the Board of Trustees of the Jacksonville Female Academy in 1836. He ran as a candidate for Congress for the Liberty Party in 1846, against Abraham Lincoln and Cartwright. His estate was valued at $100,000. He won prizes at the 1853 Illinois State Fair for his cow and poultry. His son Elizur Wolcott was executor of his estate.
m. 13 MAY 1823 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Juliana Wolcott, b. 9 APR 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 NOV 1832 .
3 children: Helen Maria, Julia Ann, Ellen Louise "Ella".
(8) Helen Maria Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 JUN 1824 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 13 MAY 1831 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Julia Ann Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 JUN 1826 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 JUL 1910 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesJULIA was a student at the Jacksonville Female Academy, graduating in 1845.
m. 19 NOV 1846 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, William Chauncy Carter, b. 2 APR 1820 New Canaan, Fairfield Co., Connecticut, d. 9 DEC 1896 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM came to Illinois in 1833. The family settled on a farm four miles south of Jacksonville in Morgan Co. He graduated from Illinois College in 1845 and taught school for a few years. He then purchased a farm next to his father's farm. His barn was a way station on the "Underground Railroad". In 1873 he moved into Jacksonbville, where he served eight years on the city council and Director of the school.
9 children: Samuel Wolcott, William Chauncey, Edwin, William Wallace, Ella Marian, Walter Lee, Truman Post, Herbert, Helen Hooker.
(9) Samuel Wolcott Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 APR 1849 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesSAMUEL was a farmer at Joy Prarie.
m. 14 MAR 1876 Hannah Joy, b. , d. .
3 children: Ernest Chauncy, Sylvester Joy, Samuel Wilford.
(10) Ernest Chauncy Carter10 (Samuel Wolcott Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 FEB 1877 , d. .
(10) Sylvester Joy Carter10 (Samuel Wolcott Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 NOV 1880 , d. .
(10) Samuel Wilford Carter10 (Samuel Wolcott Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 JAN 1893 , d. .

(9) Edwin Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1852 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. INFANT .
(9) William Wallace Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 FEB 1854 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesWILLIAM took over his father's farm in Morgan Co., Illinois.
m. 6 MAY 1885 Kittie Sibert, b. , d. .
3 children: Helen, William Wallace, Marian.
(10) Helen Carter10 (William Wallace Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 JUL 1889 , d. .
(10) William Wallace Carter10 (William Wallace Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 OCT 1891 , d. .
(10) Marian Carter10 (William Wallace Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 AUG 1898 , d. .
(9) Ella Marian Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 NOV 1855 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 14 AUG 1883 .
(9) Walter Lee Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 MAR 1861 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
m. 8 JAN 1884 Clara Rucy, b. , d. .
3 children: William Chauncy, Roy Rudy, Truman Lee.
(10) William Chauncy Carter10 (Walter Lee Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 MAR 1885 , d. .
(10) Roy Rudy Carter10 (Walter Lee Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 OCT 1886 , d. .
(10) Truman Lee Carter10 (Walter Lee Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 JUL 1889 , d. .
(9) Truman Post Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 AUG 1863 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesTRUMAN was a professor at Jacksonville, Illinois.
m. 31 JUL 1894 Elizabeth Demotte, b. , d. .
3 children: Catharine Demotte, Roger Wolcott, Alice Elizabeth.
(10) Catharine Demotte Carter10 (Truman Post Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 MAR 1898 , d. .
(10) Roger Wolcott Carter10 (Truman Post Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 JUN 1900 , d. .
(10) Alice Elizabeth Carter10 (Truman Post Carter9, Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 AUG 1903 , d. .
(9) Herbert Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 OCT 1870 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 24 MAY 1899 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania.
NotesHERBERT graduated from Illinois College in 1892, and from Hahnemann Medical College in Philadelphia in 1895. He had a druggist business in Jacksonville for a few yearsm and then returned to Philadelphia to study diseases of the nose and throat.
(9) Helen Hooker Carter9 (Julia Ann Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 OCT 1870 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 11 JUN 1871 .
(8) Ellen Louise "Ella" Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 JUN 1828 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 APR 1912 Elmira, Chemung Co., New York.
NotesELLEN had a dermatalogical illness and spent much time undergoing various cures. After the death of her father she had financial problems. She worked for the Sanitary Comission as a nurse during the Civil War, where she was a correspondent of Dorthea Dix. After the war she was a librarian at Elmira, New York. In 1880 she was living alone at Elmira. Her letters and papers are in the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, at the University of Connecticut Library. Ellen L. Wolcott of Elmira, New York, is reported deceased in the 1912 Society report, and is described as "a loyal member of the society from its beginning."
m. McVaugh, b. , d. .
1 children: Archie.
(9) Archie McVaugh9 (Ellen Louise "Ella" Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. 28 JUN 1912 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesARCHIE was killed.
(7) Elihu Wolcott7 (Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 FEB 1784 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 DEC 1858 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesELIHU was a Representative to the Connecticut Legislature for East Windsor. He sold the family farm and moved to Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois in 1830. It was said that had a two room cabin, but that their furniture was shipped via New Orleans and did not arrive until the next spring. Elihu was a merchant and land owner. He purchased a large amount of land in 6 counties in Illinois between 1831 and 1849, including 952 acres at Orland Township, Cook Co., in 1835. In 1839 Elihu Woolcott of Morgan Co., Illinois, purchased 950acres of government land at Cook Co., Illinois, and 160 acres at Morgan Co., Illinois. He surveyed the route of the Sangamon and Morgan Railroad. Elihu was President of the Board of Trustees of the Jacksonville Female Academy in 1836. He ran as a candidate for Congress for the Liberty Party in 1846, against Abraham Lincoln and Cartwright. His estate was valued at $100,000. He won prizes at the 1853 Illinois State Fair for his cow and poultry. His son Elizur Wolcott was executor of his estate.
m. 17 SEP 1835 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Sarah Choate Crocker, b. 17 AUG 1797 , d. 4 AUG 1844 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
2 children: Sarah Elizabeth, Richmond,
(8) Sarah Elizabeth Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 MAY 1837 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 6 SEP 1838 Jacksonville, Morgan Co., Illinois.
(8) Richmond Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JAN 1840 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 14 MAY 1908 Springfield, Sangamon Co., Illinois.
NotesRICHMOND gratuated from Illinois College in 1859. He was living at Morgan Co., Illinois, in 1860, with the Kirby family, and listed on the census as a physician. He enlisted as a Private in Co. B, 10th Illinois Infantry in 1861. In April 1861 he was a hospital steward at Jacksonville. He was later comissioned a Lieutenant, and then promoted to Captain. He was discharged in September, 1864. He was admitted to the bar in June 1865, and was a lawyer at Springfield, Illinois, where he was living with Jennie, Cordelia, and Lucy in 1880. He was one of the organizers and the first Secretary of the Illinois Sons of the American Revolution in 1889. Richmond wrote short stories, several of which were published in books and magazines in the 1860s. In 1870 Richmond Wolcott of Sagamon Co., Illinois, purchased 160 acres of government land at Otter Tail Co., Minnesota, and 12 acres at Grant Co., Minnesota.
m. 11 JUL 1865 , Sangamon Co., Illinois, Jane Van Vechten "Jennie" Satler, b. 17 OCT 1841 Waverly,, Illinois, d. 9 FEB 1920 St. Louis, St. Louis Co., Missouri.
3 children: Cordelia Leland, Lucy Salter, Ella Richmond.
(9) Cordelia Leland Wolcott9 (Richmond Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 MAY 1866 Springfield, Sangamon Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesCORDELIA was DAR member #63448 of Bloomington.
m. 4 OCT 1897 , Sangamon Co., Illinois, Parkinson Unwin, b. , d. .
1 children: Richmond Wolcott.
(10) Richmond Wolcott Unwin10 (Cordelia Leland Wolcott9, Richmond Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 NOV 1899 , d. .
(9) Lucy Salter Wolcott9 (Richmond Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 NOV 1867 Springfield, Sangamon Co., Illinois, d. .
m. 21 MAY 1889 , Sangamon Co., Illinois, Charles Ryan, b. , d. 31 MAR 1905 .
(9) Lucy Salter Wolcott9 (Richmond Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 NOV 1867 Springfield, Sangamon Co., Illinois, d. .
m. 12 APR 1909 Edwin W. Bear, b. , d. .
(9) Ella Richmond Wolcott9 (Richmond Wolcott8, Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 JUL 1873 ,, Illinois, d. 3 FEB 1875 .
m. 14 FEB 1888 , Mc Henry Co., Illinois, E. Stevens, b. , d. .
(8) Richmond Wolcott8 (Elihu Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 JAN 1840 , Morgan Co., Illinois, d. 14 MAY 1908 Springfield, Sangamon Co., Illinois.
NotesRICHMOND gratuated from Illinois College in 1859. He was living at Morgan Co., Illinois, in 1860, with the Kirby family, and listed on the census as a physician. He enlisted as a Private in Co. B, 10th Illinois Infantry in 1861. In April 1861 he was a hospital steward at Jacksonville. He was later comissioned a Lieutenant, and then promoted to Captain. He was discharged in September, 1864. He was admitted to the bar in June 1865, and was a lawyer at Springfield, Illinois, where he was living with Jennie, Cordelia, and Lucy in 1880. He was one of the organizers and the first Secretary of the Illinois Sons of the American Revolution in 1889. Richmond wrote short stories, several of which were published in books and magazines in the 1860s. In 1870 Richmond Wolcott of Sagamon Co., Illinois, purchased 160 acres of government land at Otter Tail Co., Minnesota, and 12 acres at Grant Co., Minnesota.
m. Ida Anneliza , b. , d. 1 OCT 1861 .
Spouse NotesIDA's relationship to Richmond is unknown, but she is buried in the same cemetery with his daughter.
(7) Sophia Wolcott7 (Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 MAR 1786 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 JUN 1870 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 19 OCT 1807 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Martin Ellsworth, b. 17 APR 1783 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 2 NOV 1857 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.

NotesOLIVER graduated from Yale College in 1830. He was killed being kicked by a horse.

(10) Margaret Woodburn Hall10 (Martin Ellsworth Hall9, Abigail Wolcott Ellsworth8, Sophia Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 DEC 1879 , d. 16 JAN 1932 .
(10) Annie Louise Hall10 (Martin Ellsworth Hall9, Abigail Wolcott Ellsworth8, Sophia Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 JAN 1881 , d. .
(10) Wolcott Ellsworth Hall10 (Martin Ellsworth Hall9, Abigail Wolcott Ellsworth8, Sophia Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 JAN 1884 , d. .
NotesWOLCOTT graduated from the Naval Academy in 1906, and was comissioned an Ensign. He became a captain in the U. S. Navy, serving in World War I and II. He was made Cdr. in 1928. In 1940 he lived at Annapolis, Maryland.
(10) Oliver Cushing Hall10 (Martin Ellsworth Hall9, Abigail Wolcott Ellsworth8, Sophia Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 MAY 1891 Newport, Newport Co., Rhode Island, d. 15 FEB 1954 Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

(9) Martha Barker Hall9 (Abigail Wolcott Ellsworth8, Sophia Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 DEC 1855 Washington, District of Columbia, d. 1 SEP 1903 New York City, New York.
NotesMARTHA changed her given name to Martha Wolcott.
m. 23 MAY 1883 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, James Ripley Wellman "Ripley" Hitchcock, b. 3 JUL 1857 Fitchburg, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 4 MAY 1918 New York City, New York.
Spouse NotesJAMES graduated from Harvard in 1877. He was a journalist and literary advisor; special correspondent for the New York Tribune 1882-3, art critic for the Tribune 1882-90, literary advisor Appleton & Co. 1890-1902, etc.. He was editor and author of many books on art, history, and biography.
2 children: Roger Wolcott, James Ripley Wellman.
(10) Roger Wolcott Hitchcock10 (Martha Barker Hall9, Abigail Wolcott Ellsworth8, Sophia Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1887 , d. 2 SEP 1918 ,, France.
NotesROGER was an aviator in World War I. He died in action in France.

Spouse NotesFREDERICK graduated from Yale College in 1877.
4 children: Dorothy Wendell, Roger Wolcott, Frederick Ellsworth, Elsie Pierrepont.
(10) Dorothy Wendell Davis10 (Mary Ellen Taintor9, Delia Williams Ellsworth8, Sophia Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 MAR 1886 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. DEC 1945 .
(10) Roger Wolcott Davis10 (Mary Ellen Taintor9, Delia Williams Ellsworth8, Sophia Wolcott7, Jerusha Wolcott6, Erastus Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 JAN 1890 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. APR 1959 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER graduated from Yale College in 1911, and received his law degree from Yale in 1913. He practiced law ar Hartford and was an alderman at Hartford from 1917 to 1919. He moved to Windsor, Connecticut, where he practiced law and became a judge.
