1940 Hempstead NY:
Oliver W Roosevelt 49
Verdery Roosevelt 51
Oliver Roosevelt 13
Malloy Terrall 30

Injuries Kill Oliver Roosevelt NEW YORK--VP--Oliver Wolcott Roosevelt, 60, a distant cousin of the late President Theodore Roosevelt, cited last night of injuries suffered In an accidental five-story fall from his Manhattan apartment. Roosevelt's wife told police he slipped and fell through an open low-silled bedroom window Tuesday night. Roosevelt was an Investment banker.
(10) Nicholas Roosevelt10 (Laura Henriette Oremieulx9, Laura Wolcott Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 JUN 1893 New York City, New York, d. FEB 1982 .
NotesNICHOLAS was U. S. Minister to Hungary. Roger Dodd Wolcott reported: "Nicholas Roosevelt told me in Washington that he and his wife had most of the Wolcott furniture and silver."

Nicholas Roosevelt was an American diplomat and journalist. A member of the Roosevelt family and first-cousin once removed of U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt, he was born in New York City to James West Roosevelt, a brother of Hilborne Roosevelt, and Laura Henrietta d'Oremieulx. Brought up in Oyster Bay, New York, he graduated from Harvard University in 1914. He was an attach at the American Embassy in Paris, secretary to the American mission to Spain in 1916 and 17, vice-governor of the Philippine Islands in 1930, and U.S. minister to Hungary from 1930 to 1933. He was a member of the Council on Foreign Relations and a writer for its journal Foreign Affairs, and a foreign correspondent and editorial writer for the New York Times and New York Herald Tribune from 1921 to 1946. A prolific author, his autobiography, A Front Row Seat (1953), offers a critical view of Franklin D. Roosevelt, a distant cousin, and an inside view of the New York Times. [6] Theodore Roosevelt (1967) drew on Nicholas Roosevelt's unique childhood recollections, his father having been a close friend of Theodore. He was married to Tirzah Gates, the daughter of Senator Egbert Gates. Her sister, Dorothy Gates, was the first wife of eminent astrophysicist Fritz Zwicky. He remained lifelong friends with Fritz Zwicky. He lived in Big Sur, California in later life.
(9) Leon F. Oremieulx9 (Laura Wolcott Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(8) Francis Sarason Gibbs8 (Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 JUN 1831 Astoria, Queens Co., New York, d. 27 DEC 1882 New York City, New York.
NotesFRANCIS spent two years in Shanghai, China, as a resident agent for "Wolcott, Bates & Co.", a trading company. He returned to America and was in the grain exporting business in New York City. His firm failed when an English firm, which held the shipments on consignment, failed.
m. 6 JUN 1860 Eliza Gay Hosmer, b. 27 OCT 1836 New York City, New York, d. 24 NOV 1883 .
Spouse NotesEliza was frequently ill and spent time in California for her health . The children received some of their early education in Santa Barbara.
4 children: George, Annie Margaretta, Laura Wolcott, Lucius Tuckerman,
(9) George Gibbs9 (Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 APR 1861 New York City, New York, d. 19 MAY 1940 .
NotesGEORGE was author of "The Gibbs Family of Rhode Island".
(9) Annie Margaretta Gibbs9 (Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 DEC 1862 New York City, New York, d. 5 MAR 1922 .
(9) Laura Wolcott Gibbs9 (Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 OCT 1865 New York City, New York, d. 1 MAY 1951 Milwaukee, Milwaukee Co., Wisconsin.
NotesLAURA spent much time in Milwaukee with her children. Later she moved to New York to live with her brother, George. Her grandson, Robert Nowell Miller, Jr., has a silver service presented to her on her 25th wedding anniversary.
m. 16 SEP 1891 Milwaukee, Milwaukee Co., Wisconsin, William Henry Miller, b. 15 OCT 1862 Milwaukee, Milwaukee Co., Wisconsin, d. 24 SEP 1923 Milwaukee, Milwaukee Co., Wisconsin.
3 children: Marjorie, Annie McLean, Constance Gibbs.
(10) Marjorie Miller10 (Laura Wolcott Gibbs9, Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 JUL 1892 Milwaukee, Milwaukee Co., Wisconsin, d. .
(10) Annie McLean Miller10 (Laura Wolcott Gibbs9, Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JAN 1894 Milwaukee, Milwaukee Co., Wisconsin, d. 30 SEP 1987 Ashville, Buncombe Co., North Carolina.
(10) Constance Gibbs Miller10 (Laura Wolcott Gibbs9, Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 AUG 1896 Milwaukee, Milwaukee Co., Wisconsin, d. 4 JAN 1974 Milwaukee, Milwaukee Co., Wisconsin.
(9) Lucius Tuckerman Gibbs9 (Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 FEB 1869 New York City, New York, d. JAN 1909 .
NotesLUCIUS was a drama critic for the New Yorker magazine.
m. 7 APR 1901 Angelica Singleton Duer, b. 1878 , d. .
2 children: Oliver Wolcott "Wolcott", Angelica Singleton.
(10) Oliver Wolcott "Wolcott" Gibbs10 (Lucius Tuckerman Gibbs9, Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 MAR 1902 New York City, New York, d. 16 AUG 1958 Fire Island, Suffolk Co., New York.
NotesOLIVER, under the name Wolcott Gibbs, began his literary career as a copy reader for the New Yorker magazine in 1926. He worked a newspaper reporter, and in 1940 became a theatre critic. He was the author of numerous stories and articles published in leading magazines, especially the New Yorker. He was the author of a 1950 Broadway hit, "Season in the Sun".
(10) Angelica Singleton Gibbs10 (Lucius Tuckerman Gibbs9, Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 JUN 1908 , d. 10 JAN 1955 ,, New York.
(9) Lucius Tuckerman Gibbs9 (Francis Sarason Gibbs8, Laura Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 FEB 1869 New York City, New York, d. JAN 1909 .
NotesLUCIUS was a drama critic for the New Yorker magazine.
m. Unknown , b. , d. .
(7) Elizabeth Stoughton Wolcott7 (Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 OCT 1795 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. 2 JUL 1813 New York City, New York.
NotesELIZABETH died in the Gracie mansion of a hemmorhage on her wedding night.
m. 2 JUL 1813 New York City, New York, William Gracie, b. 28 NOV 1787 New York City, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesWILLIAM remarried but maintained contact with the Wolcott family after his wife's death
(7) Oliver Stoughton Wolcott7 (Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 JAN 1800 ,, New York, d. 23 MAY 1832 New York City, New York.
NotesOLIVER attended the U. S. Military Academy at West Point, and then was attached as Midshipman to the "Chesapeake". After he left the Navy he settled in Litchfield, Connecticut, and then moved to New Jersey. Later, his father lived with him in New York City. An 1833 court case, DuBois v. Hepburn, says that Oliver S. Wolcott, lessee of the plaintiff of land in Lycoming County, was born in Connecticut, but was domiciled in the state of Pennsylvania on 25 Sept. 1830. A painting of him by an unknown artist is in the Frederick Co., Maryland Historical Society.
m. 9 NOV 1820 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, Jane Lowe Conard, b. 17 SEP 1803 , d. 1845 .
Spouse NotesJANE's portrait is in the Frederick Co. Historical Society, Frederick, Maryland.
3 children: Oliver, Oliver, Elizabeth Stoughton.
(8) Oliver Wolcott8 (Oliver Stoughton Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 NOV 1821 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 5 MAR 1823 .
(8) Oliver Wolcott8 (Oliver Stoughton Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 SEP 1823 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 22 MAY 1856 San Francisco, San Francisco Co., California.
NotesOLIVER received his MD at the College of Physicians and Surgeons, New York City. He lived in Argentina and died unmarried.
(8) Elizabeth Stoughton Wolcott8 (Oliver Stoughton Wolcott7, Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 JUL 1825 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 15 AUG 1825 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
(7) John Stoughton Wolcott7 (Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 DEC 1802 New York City, New York, d. 22 NOV 1843 New York City, New York.
NotesJohn S. Wolcott of CT was admitted to West Point 1 Sept. 1818, age 15 yrs 8 mo.

John practiced medicine at Litchfield, and later in New York City, where his father lived with him. Paintings of his father and grandfather Wolcott were presented by him to the Connecticut Senate in 1834. In 1925, miniature portraits of him and of his father, and a Latin text book inscribed with his name were presented to Peter Clark Wolcott for the Wolcott Society by Mrs. Olive K. Walden. Her aunt had been engaged to John.

April 8, 1844, Alexandria Gazette (Virginia): DIED: In Litchfield, Conn. Dr. JOHN STOUGHTON WALCOTT. His death was occasioned by the effects of arsenic and morphine, applied to the cavities of two hollow teeth, for the purpose of destroying the sensitiveness of their nerves.
(7) Henry Wolcott7 (Oliver Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 SEP 1805 ,, New York, d. 25 SEP 1805 ,, New York.
(6) Laura Wolcott6 (Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 DEC 1761 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 23 JAN 1814 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 6 OCT 1785 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, William Moseley, b. ABT 1758 , d. .
Spouse NotesWILLIAM graduated from Yale College in 1777.
1 children: Charles.
(7) Charles Moseley7 (Laura Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 JUN 1786 , d. 29 MAR 1815 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Mariann Wolcott6 (Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 FEB 1765 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 12 MAR 1805 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesMariann's portrait, painted by Ralph Earl, is in the Litchfield, Connecticut, Museum.
m. 13 OCT 1789 ,, Connecticut, Chauncey Goodrich, b. 20 OCT 1759 Durham Township, Middlesex Co., Connecticut, d. 18 AUG 1815 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesCHAUNCEY graduated from Yale in 1759, and then studied law with Charles Chauncey. He moved to Hartford to practice law in 1781. In 1793 and 1794 he represented New Haven in the State Legislature. In 1794, he was elected to the U.S. Congress where he served until 1801. In 1802 he was chosen a member of the Council, the upper branch of the state legislature, where he served until he became a U.S. Senator in 1807. In 1813 he was elected Lt. Governor of the State of Connecticut, and Mayor of Hartford.
(6) Frederick Wolcott6 (Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 NOV 1767 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 28 MAY 1837 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
NotesFREDERICK graduated from Yale College in 1786, delivering the the salutatorian oration in Latin. He was Clerk of the Court of Common Pleas in 1793, and clerk of the Superior Court at Litchfield in 1798. In 1796 he was appointed Judge of Probate. He inherited his parents home on South Street at Litchfield in 1797. His black servant, Hebe Williams died at Litchfield in 1803. Frederick was elected as Representative to the Connecticut General Assembly in 1808, and in 1810 was elected to the State Senate, an office that he held until 1823. He was a partner with his brother, Oliver, in the development of the woolen mills at a place that became known as Wolcottville. He and his brother imported cattle from England and sheep from Spain, and worked to improve American breeds of cattle and sheep. During the Revolutionary War he provided public service in Connecticut. He and his wife sold 200 acres of land at Norwalk, Ohio in 1822, part of the estate of her first husband, Amos Cook.
m. 12 OCT 1800 Norwich, New London Co., Connecticut, Elizabeth "Betsey" Huntington, b. 8 NOV 1774 Norwich, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 2 APR 1812 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
6 children: Mariann Goodrich, Hannah Huntington, Joshua Huntington, Elizabeth Huntington, Frederick Henry "Fred", Laura Maria.
(7) Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 AUG 1801 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 26 APR 1864 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
m. 22 MAY 1827 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, Asa Whitehead, b. 26 MAY 1795 Livingston, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 2 JUN 1860 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
Spouse NotesASA was a leading Newark lawyer. He was a Delegate to Whig National Convention from New Jersey in 1839, and member, Committee on Permanent Organization; member of New Jersey state senate from Essex County, 1849-51. He raised and educated his nephew, John Whitehead, who became president of the New Jersey SAR and vice-president of the national SAR.
1 children: Frederick Wolcott.
(8) Frederick Wolcott Whitehead8 (Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 OCT 1846 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
NotesFREDERICK was a railroad clerk at Newark, New Jersey, in 1880, with Ada, Huntington, Aaron P., and Normee (?) Whitehead.
m. 13 AUG 1867 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, Ada Italia Locker, b. 5 OCT 1849 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
7 children: Frederick Wolcott, Asa, Ada Birdette, Archer Wolcott, Huntington Wolcott, Aaron Pennington, Genevieve Elise.
(9) Frederick Wolcott Whitehead9 (Frederick Wolcott Whitehead8, Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 MAY 1868 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 24 JAN 1869 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(9) Asa Whitehead9 (Frederick Wolcott Whitehead8, Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 NOV 1869 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 15 AUG 1870 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(9) Ada Birdette Whitehead9 (Frederick Wolcott Whitehead8, Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JAN 1872 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 26 AUG 1872 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(9) Archer Wolcott Whitehead9 (Frederick Wolcott Whitehead8, Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 JUN 1873 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 26 NOV 1873 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(9) Huntington Wolcott Whitehead9 (Frederick Wolcott Whitehead8, Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 JAN 1875 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(9) Aaron Pennington Whitehead9 (Frederick Wolcott Whitehead8, Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 JUL 1878 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
(9) Genevieve Elise Whitehead9 (Frederick Wolcott Whitehead8, Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 MAY 1878 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 1952 Volusia,, Florida.
NotesGENEVIEVE was DAR member #148548.
m. Rial Newland Denison, b. 1885 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, d. .
1 children: Ruth Wolcott.
(10) Ruth Wolcott Denison10 (Genevieve Elise Whitehead9, Frederick Wolcott Whitehead8, Mariann Goodrich Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1905 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, d. .
(7) Hannah Huntington Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 JAN 1803 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 26 FEB 1838 Manayunk, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania.
m. 21 APR 1834 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, Frederick Freeman, b. 1 DEC 1799 Sandwich, Barnstable Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 SEP 1883 Sandwich, Barnstable Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesFREDERICK was rector of St. David's Church at Manayuck, Pennsylvania, and author of "A Plea for Africa"..
2 children: Huntington Wolcott, Hannah Huntington.
(8) Huntington Wolcott Freeman8 (Hannah Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 FEB 1835 New York City, New York, d. .
m. Clara Alexander, b. , d. .
(8) Hannah Huntington Freeman8 (Hannah Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 DEC 1837 Manayunk, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. 30 JUN 1838 .
(7) Joshua Huntington Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 AUG 1804 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 6 JAN 1891 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
NotesJOSHUA was a merchant. He entered the textile comission house, A. and A. Lawrence in Boston as an apprentice, and became a partner at age 26. When Abbott Lawrence was appointed Minister to England in 1849, Henry took over as managing partner of the firm. In 1857 J. Huntington Wolcott was a commercial merchant at 82 Milk St., Boston, residing at 48 Boylston, Boston. He was at Milton, Massachusetts, in 1860, with wife, Harriet, and son, Roger Wolcott, and a commercial merchant with A. A. Lawrence & Co. in Boston. He was Senior Partner when the firm dissolved in 1865. He was prominent in the development of New England manufacturing as president and director of many companies. He was involved in many charitable enterprises, and was state treasurer of the Sanitary Commission during the Civil War. He was a member of the Society of the Cincinnati, of which his grandfather was an original member. He was engaged to Elizabeth Flint of Nashville, Tennessee, but the engagement was broken. A marble bust of him is in the Newark Museum, and his papers are at the Massachusetts Historical Society.
m. 12 NOV 1844 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, Cornelia Frothingham, b. 11 DEC 1824 Cambridge, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts, d. 1 JUN 1850 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
2 children: Huntington Frothingham, Roger.
(8) Huntington Frothingham Wolcott8 (Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 FEB 1846 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 10 JUN 1865 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
NotesHUNTINGTON was comissioned 23 Oct. 1864 as a 2nd Lt. in I Co., 2nd Regiment, Massachusetts Cavalry, during the Civil War. He served as an aide to his relative, Gen. Alfred Gibbs. At the end of the war, he participated in a Grand Review at Washington D. C., and two days later took ill with "camp fever". He returned to his father's home, where he died a week later from typhoid.
(8) Roger Wolcott8 (Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 JUL 1847 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 21 DEC 1900 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
NotesROGER graduated from Harvard in 1870 and delivered the Class Oration. He received his LL.B. from Harvard Law School in 1874, and was a lawyer at Boston. He was a Member of the Boston Common City Council, 1877-79; the House of Representatives, 1882-84; Lieutenant-Governor of Massachusetts, 1892-95; became Governor upon the death of Governor Greenhalge in 1896 and was elected Governor, 1897-1898. He was the first President of the Republican Club of Massachusetts in 1891, a member of the Massachusetts Historical Society, Society of the Cincinnati and Loyal Legion and Society of Colonial Wars. He was overseer of Harvard University, 1885-1895, and Director and Trustee in many business and charitable organizations. In 1891 he established funds at Harvard in memory of Hunting Frothington Wolcott to benefit the Peabody Museum, and in memory of Joshua Huntington Wolcott to benefit the Harvard Library. A large bronze statue of him by Daniel Chester French graces the main lobby of the Massachusetts State House in Boston.

1910 Milton MA:
Edith P Wolcott F 57y
William P Wolcott M 30y
Cornelia F Wolcott F 25y
Oliver Wolcott M 19y

Find A Grave memorial No. 10634892.
m. 2 SEP 1874 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, Edith Prescott, b. 20 APR 1853 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 15 JUN 1934 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesEdith's great-great grandfather, Col. William Prescott, was Commander of American troops at the Battle of Bunker Hill. In 1899, she presented the Bunker Hill Monument to the town of Pepperell, placed on the Pepperell Common. Find A Grave memorial No. 45433906.
6 children: Huntington Frothingham, Roger, William Prescott "Prescott", Samuel Huntington, Cornelia Frothingham, Oliver.
(9) Huntington Frothingham Wolcott9 (Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 NOV 1875 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 19 FEB 1877 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
(9) Roger Wolcott9 (Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 JUL 1877 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 21 APR 1965 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
NotesROGER graduated cum laude from Harvard College in 1899. He served in the Spanish-American War and was a Major in the Infantry Officers Reserve Corps, in charge of the draft for Massachusetts, during World War I. He was a member of the Harvard Board of Overseers. He was also a members of the Advisory Board of Massachusetts General Hospital. His wife, Claire, seperated from him in 1923, saying "he had allowed their palatial home to become so dillapidated and run down" that she was unable to stay there. She left Milton, Connecticut, returned to Boston.

Find A Grave memorial No. 78346099.
m. 7 JUN 1904 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, Claire Morton Prince, b. 19 DEC 1885 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. .
3 children: Roger, Clarissa Endicott, John Endicott.

(9) Roger Wolcott9 (Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 JUL 1877 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 21 APR 1965 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
NotesROGER graduated cum laude from Harvard College in 1899. He served in the Spanish-American War and was a Major in the Infantry Officers Reserve Corps, in charge of the draft for Massachusetts, during World War I. He was a member of the Harvard Board of Overseers. He was also a members of the Advisory Board of Massachusetts General Hospital. His wife, Claire, seperated from him in 1923, saying "he had allowed their palatial home to become so dillapidated and run down" that she was unable to stay there. She left Milton, Connecticut, returned to Boston.

Find A Grave memorial No. 78346099.
m. 21 JUN 1928 Baltimore, Baltimore Co., Maryland, Barbara Hinkley, b. 6 FEB 1889 Cambridge, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts, d. 18 MAR 1958 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
1 children: Susan.
(10) Susan Wolcott10 (Roger Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 SEP 1929 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(9) William Prescott "Prescott" Wolcott9 (Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 MAY 1880 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 21 JUN 1947 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
NotesWILLIAM served as the American Red Cross representative at Base Hospital 18 in France during World War I. He was a member of the Wolcott Society living at Readville, Massachusetts, in 1914. He was a later a farmer at Milton, Massachusetts, and a noted sportsman and dog-show judge.

(9) Samuel Huntington Wolcott9 (Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 NOV 1881 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 18 DEC 1964 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
NotesSAMUEL was a member of the Executive Committee for Massachusetts of the American Protective League, and Captain in the First Cavalry Troop,Massachusetts State Guard, in 1919.

1918 Draft Registration:
Samuel Huntington Wolcott 36, b. 9 Nov 1881, Milton, Norfolk, Massachusetts, banker, Brown Bros. and Co., wife Hannah S. Wolcott, Milton, tall, medium build, brown eyes, black hair.

In 1930 he was at Milton, Massachusetts, with Hannah, Edith P., and Samuel, Robert S Wolcott.
m. 19 JUN 1907 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, Hannah Stevenson, b. 25 JUN 1881 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 2 JUL 1976 .
3 children: Edith Prescott, Samuel Huntington, Robert Stevenson.
(10) Edith Prescott Wolcott10 (Samuel Huntington Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 SEP 1908 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(10) Samuel Huntington Wolcott10 (Samuel Huntington Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 AUG 1910 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 7 NOV 2000 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
NotesSAMUEL attended Harvard University, where he lettered in three sports. He was a founding partner of Loring, Wolcott & Coolidge, a financial firm. He was probably the Samuel Wolcott who deposited the Wolcott family papers with the Massachusetts Historical Society in 1989.
(10) Robert Stevenson Wolcott10 (Samuel Huntington Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 FEB 1914 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 6 AUG 1984 .
NotesROBERT S. Wolcott served in World War II and was captured by the Germans.
(9) Cornelia Frothingham Wolcott9 (Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 FEB 1885 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 21 JAN 1956 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
m. 18 APR 1911 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, Samuel Smith Drury, b. 18 OCT 1878 Bristol, Bristol Co., Rhode Island, d. 21 FEB 1938 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesSAMUEL graduated from Harvard University in 1901, and became a missionary in the Phillipines. He was ordained in 1908 and became rector of St. Stephens Church in Boston. In 1910 he received a STB degree from Berkeley Divinity School and an honorary LHD degree from Trinity College. He received an honorary DD degree from Dartmouth College in 1917, an honorary DD degree from Williams College in 1921, and an honorary LittD degree from Princeton in 1922. He was Rector of St. Paul's School at Concord, New Hampshire, from 1911 to 1938. He was Director of the Harvard Alumni Association from 1919 to 1922, and an Overseer of Harvard from 1922 to 1928. He was the author of numerous books and articles. He and his son, Roger, wrote "In Pursuit of Pelicans", published in 1931. His biography, "Drury and St. Pauls:, written by his son, was published in 1964.
3 children: Samuel Smith, Roger Wolcott, Edith Prescott.
(10) Samuel Smith Drury10 (Cornelia Frothingham Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 DEC 1911 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 7 OCT 1972 Nahant, Essex Co., Massachusetts.
NotesSAMUEL graduated from Harvard University in 1935, and was Captain of the Harvard crew team.
(10) Roger Wolcott Drury10 (Cornelia Frothingham Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 MAR 1914 Jamaica Plain, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 31 OCT 1996 Sheffield, Berkshire Co., Massachusetts.
NotesROGER graduated from Harvard in 1936. He was a reporter for the New York Herald Tribine 1936-7, worked in the Advertising Department of Macmillan Company 1937-9, did alternative service as a military service objector 1939-46, and was a dairy farmer at Sheffield, Massachusetts, 1946-60. He was author of "The Finch's Fabulous Furnace", published in 1971, and other works.
(10) Edith Prescott Drury10 (Cornelia Frothingham Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 DEC 1916 Milton, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 6 SEP 1987 Pasadena, Los Angeles Co., California.
(9) Oliver Wolcott9 (Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 APR 1891 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 11 MAR 1967 South Hamilton, Essex Co., Massachusetts.
Notes OLIVER graduated from Harvard in 1913 and received his LLB in 1915. He was a Capt. in the U.S. Army Cavalry and served with the 28th Div. in France. In 1925, he was a Lt. Col. in the National Guard. He was legal counsel for the Old Colony Trust Co.
m. 2 DEC 1922 Ipswich, Essex Co., Massachusetts, Sybil Appleton, b. 28 DEC 1899 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. 15 DEC 1973 Beverly, Essex Co., Massachusetts.
3 children: Helen, Augusta Peabody, Oliver.
(10) Helen Wolcott10 (Oliver Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 DEC 1923 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(10) Augusta Peabody Wolcott10 (Oliver Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 JAN 1926 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(10) Oliver Wolcott10 (Oliver Wolcott9, Roger Wolcott8, Joshua Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 AUG 1930 Beverly, Essex Co., Massachusetts, d. .
NotesOLIVER lived at Hamilton, Massachusetts in 2004. He was Marketing Manager of Honeywell, Inc. at Waltham, Massachusetts, in 2007. He joined the Wolcott Society as member 1734.
(7) Joshua Huntington Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 AUG 1804 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 6 JAN 1891 Boston, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts.
NotesJOSHUA was a merchant. He entered the textile comission house, A. and A. Lawrence in Boston as an apprentice, and became a partner at age 26. When Abbott Lawrence was appointed Minister to England in 1849, Henry took over as managing partner of the firm. In 1857 J. Huntington Wolcott was a commercial merchant at 82 Milk St., Boston, residing at 48 Boylston, Boston. He was at Milton, Massachusetts, in 1860, with wife, Harriet, and son, Roger Wolcott, and a commercial merchant with A. A. Lawrence & Co. in Boston. He was Senior Partner when the firm dissolved in 1865. He was prominent in the development of New England manufacturing as president and director of many companies. He was involved in many charitable enterprises, and was state treasurer of the Sanitary Commission during the Civil War. He was a member of the Society of the Cincinnati, of which his grandfather was an original member. He was engaged to Elizabeth Flint of Nashville, Tennessee, but the engagement was broken. A marble bust of him is in the Newark Museum, and his papers are at the Massachusetts Historical Society.
m. 12 NOV 1851 Harriet "Hattie" Frothingham, b. 1810 Cambridge, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(7) Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 MAR 1806 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 15 OCT 1875 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
m. 22 MAY 1827 Pompton Plains, Morris Co., New Jersey, John Peter Jackson, b. 8 JUN 1805 Acquackanonk,, New Jersey, d. 10 DEC 1861 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
Spouse NotesJOHN graduated from Princeton College in 1823. He was a lawyer, member of the New Jersey General Assembly 1831, Speaker of the House, Clerk of Essex Co. in 1839, Secretary of the New Jersey Railroad Company 1832, Director 1836-1861, Vice President and General Manager 1849.
11 children: Laura Wolcott, Mary Elizabeth, Julia Huntington, Frederick Wolcott, Joseph Cooke, John Peter, Hannah Wolcott, Huntington Wolcott, Charles Henry, Henry Griswold, Schuyler Brinckerhoff.
(8) Laura Wolcott Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 MAY 1828 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 9 JAN 1901 .
m. 26 JAN 1854 Charles Henry Parker, b. 1816 , d. .
Spouse NotesCHARLES graduated from Harvard University in 1835.
1 children: Harriet Wolcott.

(8) Mary Elizabeth Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 NOV 1829 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 7 MAY 1885 Germantown, Sussex Co., New Jersey.

2 children: Adeline Mckean, Alexander.
(10) Adeline Mckean Henry10 (Alexander Henry9, Mary Elizabeth Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 MAY 1878 , d. .
(10) Alexander Henry10 (Alexander Henry9, Mary Elizabeth Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 AUG 1885 , d. .
(9) Charles Wolcott Henry9 (Mary Elizabeth Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 APR 1852 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. 23 NOV 1903 .
NotesCHARLES took over his father's lumber business, Henry, Bayard & Co., in 1872, and was active in the business until his death. He was a member of the Philadelphia Common Council in the 1870s and 1880s, served on the Fairmont Park Commission, and was a Trustee of the Chesnut Hill Academy. His uncle, Alexander Henry, was Mayor of Philadelphia 1858-1862. The Charles W. Henry Elementary School in Philadelphia was named for him.
m. 18 NOV 1885 Sarah Bonnell "Sallie" Houston, b. 1860 , d. 1938 .
3 children: Thomas Charlton, Gertrude Houston, Elizabeth Wolcott.

(8) Frederick Wolcott Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 AUG 1833 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 14 JUN 1904 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesFREDERICK studied at the Sheffield Scientific School at Yale University, graduating in 1852. He joined Norwood & Co. in New York City, and in 1855 went to work for New Jersey Railroad. He became General Superintendant of the United New Jersey Railroads, Pennsylvania Co..
m. 12 OCT 1859 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, Nannie Jane Nye, b. 5 AUG 1835 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 10 MAR 1905 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
9 children: Philip Nye, John Brinckerhoff, William Fessenden, Frederick Wolcott, Charles Huntington, Elizabeth Wolcott, Nina Fessenden, Oliver Wolcott, Martha Nye.
(9) Philip Nye Jackson9 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 SEP 1860 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 13 MAR 1911 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesPHILIP graduated from Princeton University in 1880, and Columbia Law School. He worked for the Newark Power & Light Co..

6 children: Nannie Nye, Edith Atlee, Frederick Wolcott, Margaret Atlee, Philip Nye, Schuyler Brinckerhoff.

(10) Frederick Wolcott Jackson10 (Philip Nye Jackson9, Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 FEB 1888 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 13 DEC 1934 Wolcott, Wayne Co. New York.
(10) Margaret Atlee Jackson10 (Philip Nye Jackson9, Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 NOV 1890 , d. .
(10) Philip Nye Jackson10 (Philip Nye Jackson9, Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 MAY 1898 , d. .
(10) Schuyler Brinckerhoff Jackson10 (Philip Nye Jackson9, Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 AUG 1900 , d. 4 JUL 1968 Wabasso, Indian River Co., Florida.
NotesSCHUYLER was a writer, critic, and poetry editor for Times magazine. He and his wife Laura, were co-authors of "Rational Meaning", published after his death. They settled at New Hope, Pennsylvania in 1941. In 1943 they moved to Wabasso, Florida, where he had a fruit shipping business. His papers are at Cornell University,
(9) John Brinckerhoff Jackson9 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 AUG 1862 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
NotesJOHN attended the Naval Academy 1879-83. He served in the Navy, resigning in 1886. He studied law at New York University and was admitted to the bar in 1889. He joined the diplomatic corps in 1890 and in 1903 was appointed minister to Greece, Roumania, Serbia, Bulgaria and Montenegro. In 1907 he was transferred to Persia, and in 1909 to Cuba, and then to the Balkans.
m. 25 APR 1886 Florence A. Baird, b. , d. .
1 children: Florence.
(10) Florence Jackson10 (John Brinckerhoff Jackson9, Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 7 MAR 1887 , d. 10 APR 1887 .
(9) William Fessenden Jackson9 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 NOV 1864 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
NotesWILLIAM graduated from Princeton University in 1885 and became a banker.
(9) Frederick Wolcott Jackson9 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 JUN 1867 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 2 SEP 1932 Lakeville, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
NotesFREDERICK graduated from Princeton University in 1887 and received a docturate from Columbia University in 1888 and graduated from Priceton Theological Seminary in 1891. He was a Presbyterian minister, and a member of the Board of Managers of the Americam Bible Society. He was a missionary to China 1892-94, representing the Society. He studied medicine at Bellvue Hospital 1894-95. He was pastor of the Scotch Presbyterian Church at Jersey City 1896-1900. He then did missionary work in North Carolin and studied in Germany. In 1906 he became an English professor at the German Theological Seminary at Bloomfield, New Jersey. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1930 as member #149, residing at Glen Ridge, New Jersey.
m. 27 JUN 1894 Savannah, Chatham Co., Georgia, Louise Gindrat Arnold, b. 23 OCT 1871 Newport, Newport Co., Rhode Island, d. 17 FEB 1928 Glenn Ridge, Essex Co., New Jersey.
4 children: Elizabeth Screven, Frederick Huntington Wolcott, Louise Arnold, Nannie Nye.

NotesFREDERICK attended the Naval Academy at Annapolis and patroled the coast in the summer of 1918.

(10) Nannie Nye Jackson10 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson9, Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 SEP 1904 , d. 9 FEB 1923 .
(9) Charles Huntington Jackson9 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 NOV 1869 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 5 JUN 1911 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado.
NotesCHARLES graduated from Princeton in 1890 and Columbia Law School in 1893, He was at Attorney at Newark until 1903, when he joined the Benefit Life Insurance Co.. He moved to Greeley, Colorado, in 1908 where he died of a heart attack.

(10) Francesca Lewis Stewart10 (Martha Nye Jackson9, Frederick Wolcott Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 DEC 1907 , d. 5 JUN 1980 Godalming,, England.
(8) Joseph Cooke Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 AUG 1835 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 22 MAY 1913 New York City, New York.
NotesJOSEPH graduated from Yale College in 1857. He received a LLB degree from Harvard University in 1860 and was admitted to practice law in New York City in 1860. He was commissioned Lt. Col. of the 6th New Jersey Volunteers in December 1862 for his gallant action at Fredericksburg, Virginia, December 11-15, 1862. He was brevetted Brigadier General, March 13, 1865. He was appointed U.S. Assistant District Attorney for the Southern District of New York by President Grant in 1870. After the war he was an attorney in New York City. He visited Tolland, Somerset, in 1903 and 1907, and joined the Wolcott Society in 1913 residing at New York City. In 1912 he privately published a 93 page book, "European and American Family of Wolcott". Some things said in that book were erronius.
m. 12 OCT 1864 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Katharine Perkins Day, b. 24 FEB 1837 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 NOV 1914 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Joseph Cooke, John Day, Katharine Seymour, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott.

NotesJOHN graduated from Yale University in 1890 and was a journalist. He was owner and publisher of the New Haven Register.

(8) John Peter Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 FEB 1837 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 17 DEC 1880 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesJOHN graduated from Princeton College in 1856 and received a LLB degree from Harvard in 1858. He was an attorney at Newark, New Jersey. He was a member of the Newark City Council 1866-70, and was Speaker of the New Jersey Legislature 1862-63.
m. 1868 Clara Catlin Gregory, b. , d. 1936 .
5 children: Eliza Gregory, Laura Wolcott, Eliot Gregory, John Peter, Huntington Wolcott.

(9) Laura Wolcott Jackson9 (John Peter Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1870 , d. .
m. 6 MAR 1909 Wilhelm A.F. Ekengren, b. ,, Sweden, d. 26 NOV 1920 Washington, District of Columbia.
Spouse NotesWILHELM was appointed Swedish Minister to the United States in March 1912, after serving six years as Secretary and Counselor at the American Embassy. He married Laura Wolcott Jackson while serving as Secretary.
1 children: Elsie Helen Augusta.
(10) Elsie Helen Augusta Ekengren10 (Laura Wolcott Jackson9, John Peter Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 APR 1910 , d. .
(9) Eliot Gregory Jackson9 (John Peter Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUL 1872 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. San Francisco, San Francisco Co., California.
m. 1903 Margaret Grey, b. , d. .
(9) John Peter Jackson9 (John Peter Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 MAY 1878 , d. .
NotesJOHN graduated from the Naval Academy and served in the Navy during the Spanish American War.
(9) Huntington Wolcott Jackson9 (John Peter Jackson8, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 17 APR 1880 , d. .
NotesHUNTINGTON graduated from Princeton University.
m. 18 FEB 1909 Shelby Converse, b. , d. .
(8) Hannah Wolcott Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 APR 1839 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 24 AUG 1904 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(8) Huntington Wolcott Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 JAN 1841 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 3 JAN 1901 ,, Illinois.
NotesHUNTINGTON entered the College of New Jersey in 1859, but left at the end of his junior year to join the army. In 1863 he was brevetted Lt. Colonel. He was badly wounded at Kenesaw Mountain. He graduated from Harvard Law school in 1865, and was admitted to the Bar in 1868. He practiced law in Newark and Chicago, and in 1888 he was president of the Chicago Bar Assn. He apparently never married. A bronze tablet to his memory was placed in the Marshall Field store in Chicago.
(8) Charles Henry Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 MAY 1843 , d. 14 FEB 1844 .
(8) Henry Griswold Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 MAR 1845 , d. 28 MAR 1846 .
(8) Schuyler Brinckerhoff Jackson8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 JUN 1849 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 28 JUL 1915 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesSCHUYLER graduated from Yale College in 1871, and from Columbia Law School in 1873. In 1879 he was an alderman at Newark 1879-80 and a member of the New Jersey legislature 1878-79. He became Speaker of the General Assembly of New Jersey in 1879. He was a member of the Wolcott Society 1914-15, residing at Newark, New Jersey.
m. 27 FEB 1889 Angela Forbes, b. , d. .
(7) Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 AUG 1808 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 13 APR 1883 Astoria, Queens Co., New York.
NotesFREDERICK was a merchant in New York City. In 1860 he was living at Newtown, Queens, with Sarah E., Elizabeth H., Alice, Frederick, and Gardner H. He was much interested in family history, and hired H. G. Somerby to research the Wolcott family in England. It was largely through his interest and using his papers that Samuel Wolcott compiled the "Wolcott Memorial", the first published genealogy of the family. The book was privately distributed in 1886. Frederick owned the Oliver Wolcott house at Litchfield.
m. 12 JUN 1838 ,, New York, Abby Woolsey Howland, b. 11 NOV 1817 New York City, New York, d. 14 JUN 1852 Astoria, Queens Co., New York.
Spouse NotesABBY was a descendant of John Howland who came to America on the Mayflower.
6 children: Elizabeth Huntington, Alice, Frederick Henry, Gardiner Howland, Oliver Huntington, Abby Howland.
(8) Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott8 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1840 Nyack, Rockland Co., New York, d. .
m. 20 NOV 1861 New York City, New York, Stephen L. Merchant, b. 1838 ,, Georgia, d. .
Spouse NotesStephen was a merchant in New York City. He and his wife lived with her father in 1880.
1 children: Huntington Wolcott.
(9) Huntington Wolcott Merchant9 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott8, Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 JUN 1869 New York City, New York, d. .
m. Mary Cornelia Tallmadge, b. Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. .
1 children: Betty Wolcott.
(10) Betty Wolcott Merchant10 (Huntington Wolcott Merchant9, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott8, Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(8) Alice Wolcott8 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1843 New York City, New York, d. 1927 .
(8) Frederick Henry Wolcott8 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 30 OCT 1845 New York City, New York, d. 1885 .
(8) Gardiner Howland Wolcott8 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 AUG 1848 New York City, New York, d. 5 NOV 1881 .
NotesGARDINER was a merchant, and travelled to Europe in 1880.
(8) Oliver Huntington Wolcott8 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 OCT 1850 New York City, New York, d. 15 MAY 1852 New York City, New York.
(8) Abby Howland Wolcott8 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1852 , d. 22 JUN 1852 .
(7) Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 19 AUG 1808 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 13 APR 1883 Astoria, Queens Co., New York.
NotesFREDERICK was a merchant in New York City. In 1860 he was living at Newtown, Queens, with Sarah E., Elizabeth H., Alice, Frederick, and Gardner H. He was much interested in family history, and hired H. G. Somerby to research the Wolcott family in England. It was largely through his interest and using his papers that Samuel Wolcott compiled the "Wolcott Memorial", the first published genealogy of the family. The book was privately distributed in 1886. Frederick owned the Oliver Wolcott house at Litchfield.
m. 18 JAN 1855 Plattsburgh, Clinton Co., New York, Sarah Elizabeth Merchant, b. 22 OCT 1822 Plattsburgh, Clinton Co., New York, d. 1907 .
3 children: Charles Merchant, Abby Howland, Alice.
(8) Charles Merchant Wolcott8 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 NOV 1855 New York City, New York, d. 3 APR 1858 .
(8) Abby Howland Wolcott8 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1863 New York City, New York, d. .
(8) Alice Wolcott8 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1865 New York City, New York, d. Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
NotesALICE never married. She owned and lived in the Oliver Wolcott house at Litchfield. In 1922 she sold it to her niece, Alice Sherman.
(7) Laura Maria Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 AUG 1811 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 7 FEB 1892 .
NotesLAURA went to live with her maternal grandparents at Norwich, Connecticut, shortly after her father remarried. She lived with them for nine years. In 1825 she was sent to Sarah Pierce's school for girls at Litchfield. In 1880, Laura was at Newburgh, New York, with daughters, Laura M., Frances W., Mary W., and Cornelia W. Wolcott
m. 11 MAR 1831 Newburgh, Orange Co., New York, Robert Gosman Rankin, b. 29 JUN 1806 New York City, New York, d. 6 MAR 1875 Newburgh, Orange Co., New York.
Spouse NotesROBERT was raised by a friend of his father who resided at Ulster, New York. He graduated from Yale College in 1826, worked in a law office in New York City for one year, and then attended the Tapping Reeve Law School at Litchfield, Connecticut. He became a lawyer in 1829, marrying 2 years later Laura Wolcott who he met while studying law at Litchfield. He worked for various railroads and manufacturers. Robert was an Elder of the Presbyterian Church, and was elected a Regent of The University of the State of New York in 1846. In 1852 he moved to Astoria, Long Island, where he was a consulting engineer. He became president of the Mexican Mail Company in 1853, and later managed a coal mining company. He moved to Newburgh, New York, in 1863 because of poor health.
12 children: Frederick Wolcott, Huntington Wolcott, Ann, Henry, Robert Gosman, Laura Maria, Charles Chauncey Wolcott, Katherine Almedea, Frances Wolcott, Francis Huntington, Mary Wolcott, Cornelia W. "Nellie".
(8) Frederick Wolcott Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 JUN 1832 , d. 9 DEC 1881 .
NotesFREDERICK graduated from Williams College in 1849.
(8) Huntington Wolcott Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 SEP 1834 , d. 21 AUG 1840 .
(8) Ann Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 FEB 1834 , d. .
m. 15 JUN 1859 Charles J. Collins, b. , d. .
Spouse NotesCHARLES was a presbyterian minister at Lacawana.
(8) Henry Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 OCT 1835 ,, New York, d. 5 SEP 1836 .
(8) Robert Gosman Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 MAR 1837 ,, New York, d. 4 JUN 1838 .
NotesROBERT served in the Union Army during the Civil War.
(8) Laura Maria Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 JUN 1838 ,, New York, d. .
(8) Charles Chauncey Wolcott Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 DEC 1840 , d. .
(8) Katherine Almedea Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 SEP 1843 , d. 6 FEB 1893 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
m. 15 MAR 1865 Newburgh, Orange Co., New York, George Adams Boyce, b. 13 JUN 1840 New York City, New York, d. 8 APR 1917 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
Spouse NotesGEORGE was a comission and produce merchant in partnership with W. S. Hartshorne at New York City.
4 children: Gertrude Huntington, John, George Adams, Robert Rankin.
(9) Gertrude Huntington Boyce9 (Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 10 FEB 1869 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, d. 10 JUN 1962 .
m. 12 NOV 1891 Arthur Cushman McGiffert, b. 4 MAR 1861 Sauquoit, Oneida Co., New York, d. 25 FEB 1933 .
Spouse NotesARTHUR graduated from Western Reserve College in 1882 and from Union Theological Seminary in 1885, and was ordained in the Presbyterian Church. He then studied in Europe and received a Doctor of Philosophy from the University of Marburg in 1888. He was a teacher and professor at Lane Theological Seminary 1888-1893, and then was a professor at Union Theological Seminary. Because of criticism of his controversial writings, he left the Presbyterian church and was ordained in the Congregational Church.
2 children: Katherine, Arthur Cushman "Cush".
(10) Katherine McGiffert10 (Gertrude Huntington Boyce9, Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
(10) Arthur Cushman "Cush" McGiffert10 (Gertrude Huntington Boyce9, Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 NOV 1892 Cincinnati, Hamilton Co., Ohio, d. 9 APR 1993 Claremont, San Bernardino Co., California.
NotesARTHUR attended Lane Seminary. He was President of the Chicago Theological Seminary. He wrote a biography of Robert and Laura Wolcott Rankin.
(9) John Boyce9 (Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 21 FEB 1872 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 22 JUL 1872 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(9) George Adams Boyce9 (Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 OCT 1873 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 16 FEB 1874 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(9) Robert Rankin Boyce9 (Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 18 OCT 1874 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 12 SEP 1949 Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
m. 2 NOV 1903 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, Caroline Harrison "Caro" Ward, b. 30 JAN 1877 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 12 AUG 1952 Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
4 children: Katherine Wolcott, Robert Rankin, Henry Ward, William Carter.
(10) Katherine Wolcott Boyce10 (Robert Rankin Boyce9, Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 OCT 1904 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 23 DEC 1985 Branford, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
(10) Robert Rankin Boyce10 (Robert Rankin Boyce9, Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 OCT 1909 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 31 JUL 1916 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(10) Henry Ward Boyce10 (Robert Rankin Boyce9, Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 AUG 1913 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 29 AUG 1916 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(10) William Carter Boyce10 (Robert Rankin Boyce9, Katherine Almedea Rankin8, Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 AUG 1918 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
NotesWILLIAM joined the Wolcott Society in 2005 as member #1971, residing at Georgetown, Texas.
(8) Frances Wolcott Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 SEP 1845 ,, New York, d. .
NotesFRANCIS graduated fron New York University in 1869. He founded the Austrian Red Cross.
(8) Francis Huntington Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 SEP 1845 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 9 NOV 1896 Newport, Newport Co., Rhode Island.
NotesFRANCIS graduated from the Medical Department of New York University in 1869. He studied in Vienna for a year, and then went to Berlin where he was given an appointment as Acting Assistant Surgeon in the Prussian Army, and then Acting Surgeon. On returning to America he was given the steel medal of thanks from the Prussinan government. He began practice in New York City in 1871. In 1876 he moved to Newport and joined practice with Dr. Austin Sands who died the following year. He was a founder and President of the Newport Medical Society, and attending physician at the Newport Hospital. He was a frequent contributor to medical journals.
m. 11 NOV 1879 Grace Voorhis, b. , d. .
(8) Mary Wolcott Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 MAY 1848 ,, New York, d. .
(8) Cornelia W. "Nellie" Rankin8 (Laura Maria Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 AUG 1850 ,, New York, d. .
(6) Frederick Wolcott6 (Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 NOV 1767 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 28 MAY 1837 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
NotesFREDERICK graduated from Yale College in 1786, delivering the the salutatorian oration in Latin. He was Clerk of the Court of Common Pleas in 1793, and clerk of the Superior Court at Litchfield in 1798. In 1796 he was appointed Judge of Probate. He inherited his parents home on South Street at Litchfield in 1797. His black servant, Hebe Williams died at Litchfield in 1803. Frederick was elected as Representative to the Connecticut General Assembly in 1808, and in 1810 was elected to the State Senate, an office that he held until 1823. He was a partner with his brother, Oliver, in the development of the woolen mills at a place that became known as Wolcottville. He and his brother imported cattle from England and sheep from Spain, and worked to improve American breeds of cattle and sheep. During the Revolutionary War he provided public service in Connecticut. He and his wife sold 200 acres of land at Norwalk, Ohio in 1822, part of the estate of her first husband, Amos Cook.
m. 21 JUN 1815 Danbury, Fairfield Co., Connecticut, Sarah Worthington "Sally" Goodrich, b. 7 AUG 1785 Berlin, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 SEP 1842 .
Spouse NotesSARAH was heir of her husband, Amos Cooke, to 100 acres of land near Norwalk, Huron Co., Ohio, which she and her husband, Frederick Wolcott, sold to Harvey Webb in 1822.
4 children: Charles Moseley, Chauncey Goodrich, Henry Griswold, Mary Frances.
(7) Charles Moseley Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 NOV 1816 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 20 NOV 1889 New York City, New York.
NotesCHARLES was a merchant. His home on the eastern bank of the Hudson River, near Fishkill Landing, was called "Roseneath". He was at Fishkill in 1860, with wife, Catherine, and children, Henry, Catherine, and Ann. In 1863 he made a gift of 6 acres of land to St. Anna's Episcopal Church at Fishkill. C. M. Wolcott was at Fishkill in 1870, when the census says he was born in Massachusetts. With him was his wife, Catherine, and his three children. In 1880, he was a retired merchant, living at Matteawan, Dutchess Co., New York.
m. 1 NOV 1843 Roxbury, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, Mary Elizabeth Goodrich, b. 26 OCT 1818 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 13 NOV 1845 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania.
1 children: Frederick.
(8) Frederick Wolcott8 (Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 DEC 1844 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 25 MAR 1846 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
(7) Charles Moseley Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 NOV 1816 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 20 NOV 1889 New York City, New York.
NotesCHARLES was a merchant. His home on the eastern bank of the Hudson River, near Fishkill Landing, was called "Roseneath". He was at Fishkill in 1860, with wife, Catherine, and children, Henry, Catherine, and Ann. In 1863 he made a gift of 6 acres of land to St. Anna's Episcopal Church at Fishkill. C. M. Wolcott was at Fishkill in 1870, when the census says he was born in Massachusetts. With him was his wife, Catherine, and his three children. In 1880, he was a retired merchant, living at Matteawan, Dutchess Co., New York.
m. 26 NOV 1849 New York City, New York, Catharine Almandia Rankin, b. 6 JAN 1817 New York City, New York, d. 24 JUN 1889 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York.
Spouse NotesCATHERINE was New York State Regent for the D.A.R..
3 children: Henry Goodrich, Katharine Rankin, Annette Rankin.
(8) Henry Goodrich Wolcott8 (Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 JUL 1853 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 2 APR 1906 Genoa,, Italy.
NotesHENRY graduated from Yale with a Ph.B. in 1873, and from Columbia College, LLB, in 1877. In 1892 he was a lawyer at Fishkill with Julia L., Oliver, Charles W., Elizabeth, and Katherine Wolcott. He was a member of the New York Bar, a lawyer, U.S. Commissioner, and Lt. Col. in the 21st Regiment, New York Guards. He resided at Roseneath, Fishkill-on-the-Hudson, but practiced law at Matteawan, a neighboring village.
m. 22 MAY 1879 New York City, New York, Julia Sterling Hutchins, b. 17 JUL 1855 New York City, New York, d. 15 FEB 1930 Red Bank, Monmouth Co., New Jersey.
Spouse NotesJULIA bought a large home on the Shrewsbury River at Red Bank in 1928. She was DAR member #10156.
6 children: Oliver, Charles Moseley, Henry Goodrich, Elizabeth Ellsworth, Katharine Rankin, Julia Hutchins.
(9) Oliver Wolcott9 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott8, Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 MAR 1880 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 28 DEC 1893 .
(9) Charles Moseley Wolcott9 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott8, Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 AUG 1882 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. .
NotesCHARLES was a real estate agent at Red Bank, New Jersey, in 1923, with Albertha and David Wolcott. He was there in 1941 when he joined the Wolcott Society.
m. 9 FEB 1929 Alberta Albrecht, b. , d. .
1 children: David.
(10) David Wolcott10 (Charles Moseley Wolcott9, Henry Goodrich Wolcott8, Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1930 , d. .
(9) Henry Goodrich Wolcott9 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott8, Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 MAR 1884 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 10 AUG 1885 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York.
(9) Elizabeth Ellsworth Wolcott9 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott8, Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 8 SEP 1886 , d. .
NotesELIZABETH was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914. She was a page at the D.A.R. National Congress in 1925.
m. JUN 1925 Red Bank, Monmouth Co., New Jersey, Sayre, b. , d. .
(9) Katharine Rankin Wolcott9 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott8, Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 AUG 1888 , d. 4 DEC 1893 .
(9) Julia Hutchins Wolcott9 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott8, Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 JUL 1892 , d. .
(8) Katharine Rankin Wolcott8 (Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 APR 1855 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 2 NOV 1941 Beacon, Dutchess Co., New York.
NotesKATHERINE was President of the National Society of Colonial Dames, and Regent of the Daughters of the American Revolution. She was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914, co-vice president for New York, and a member of the Historical Committee.
m. 8 APR 1896 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, Samuel Verplanck, b. 20 JUL 1840 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 15 DEC 1911 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York.
Spouse NotesSAMUEL Verplanck of Matteawan was one of the wealthiest men in Dutchess County, and probably its wealthiest land owners. He and his wife and Mrs, Rankin of Newburg were shot while out driving near Newburg 12 Aug. 1901. It was found to be an accident by someone squirrel hunting.
(8) Annette Rankin Wolcott8 (Charles Moseley Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 JUN 1857 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. .
(7) Chauncey Goodrich Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 15 MAR 1819 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 28 OCT 1820 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
(7) Henry Griswold Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 NOV 1820 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 8 MAY 1852 New York City, New York.
NotesHENRY received his business training in Boston as apprentice to his brother, Joshua. He went to China as a merchant in 1843, financed by his brother and his brother's partner, Abbott Lawrence. Henry was in partnership with Edward G. Bates and later his son, Edward W. Bates. Edward, Sr., is buried at Macau, China, where the stone reads" Edward G. Bates of the firm Wolcott, Bates & Co. of Shanghai Ltd., 1841 out of New York". The company was listed in directories 1842-1852. Henry was the first U.S. Consul at Shanghai, appointed as acting consul in 1846. The British objected to his flying the American flag in their area, and after his departure in 1847 when a new consulate was established outside British jurisdiction. He returned to the United States due to poor health caused my malaria contracted in China. He went to Germany for the spas, but when this failed to help, he returned to New York and died at his brother's home.
(7) Mary Frances Wolcott7 (Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 9 JUL 1823 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. .
NotesMARY lived at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in 1880, age 56, with children Theodore 31, Cornelia 26, Bessie 23, all born Massachusetts, Harriet 19 born Pennsylvania, and two Irish servants.
m. 4 FEB 1845 Theodore Frothingham, b. , d. .
5 children: Theodore, Mary Goodrich, Cornelia, Bessie, Harriet.
(8) Theodore Frothingham8 (Mary Frances Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1849 ,, Massachusetts, d. .
NotesTHEODORE graduated from Harvard University in 1870. In 1880 he was a ship broker at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
(8) Mary Goodrich Frothingham8 (Mary Frances Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. ABT 1850 , d. .
m. Charles Brinley, b. , d. .
1 children: Alice,
(9) Alice Brinley9 (Mary Goodrich Frothingham8, Mary Frances Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. , d. .
NotesALICE purchased the Oliver Wolcott house at Litchfield from her cousin Alice Wolcott in 1922. She was living there in the 1960s.
m. King, b. , d. .

m. Frederick William Sherman, b. , d. 21 JUL 1929 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
(8) Cornelia Frothingham8 (Mary Frances Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1854 ,, Massachusetts, d. .
(8) Bessie Frothingham8 (Mary Frances Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1857 ,, Massachusetts, d. .
(8) Harriet Frothingham8 (Mary Frances Wolcott7, Frederick Wolcott6, Oliver Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1861 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. .
(5) Mariann Wolcott5 (Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 JAN 1729 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 JUL 1798 Chaplin, Windham Co., Connecticut.
m. 5 DEC 1758 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, Thomas Williams, b. 6 MAY 1725 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 3 APR 1778 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut.
3 children: Roger, Roger Wolcott, Mariann.
(6) Roger Williams6 (Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 AUG 1761 ,, Connecticut, d. 22 AUG 1761 ,, Connecticut.
(6) Roger Wolcott Williams6 (Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 AUG 1764 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 1 OCT 1821 .
NotesROGER lived at Brooklyn, Connecticut.
m. 5 APR 1794 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, Mary "Polly" Scarborough, b. JAN 1775 Of Brooklyn,, Connecticut, d. 6 DEC 1820 .
7 children: Herbert, Frances, Edward, Cecilia, Godfrey, Mariann Noyes, Ursula.
(7) Herbert Williams7 (Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 27 MAY 1795 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 4 APR 1867 Michigan City, La Porte Co., Indiana.
NotesHERBERT moved his family to LaPorte, Indiana, in 1836. In 1850 they were living in Michigan City, Indiana. They were abolitionists, and their home was used as a station on the "underground railroad".
m. 19 AUG 1822 Lucy Bigelow, b. 11 APR 1797 New Braintree, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. .
5 children: Wolcott Bigelow, Amelia Sumner, Amelia Sumner, Lucy Maria, Ellen Dickinson.
(8) Wolcott Bigelow Williams8 (Herbert Williams7, Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 AUG 1823 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 31 AUG 1913 Charlotte, Eaton Co., Michigan.
NotesWOLCOTT attended Oberlin College in 1844-9, receiving a AB degree in 1850, AM degree in 1853, and a DD from Olivet College in 1898. He was a Congregational minister and a "conductor" on the "Underground Railroad" in Missouri, helping slaves escape from the South. He moved to Michigan where he preached at the First Congregational Church of Charlotte. He was the author of "The Past and Present of Eaton County, Michigan", published in 1887, and "Christian and Secular Education", published 1894.
m. 5 OCT 1853 Mary Augusta Thompson, b. , d. .
4 children: Alice I., Edith Burr, Sarah N., Herbert M..

NotesMARGARET joined the Wolcott Society in 1973, residing at South Pasadena, California.
(10) John Wolcott Haddock10 (Frank Dickinson Haddock9, Ellen Dickinson Williams8, Herbert Williams7, Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 22 AUG 1904 Polo, Ogle Co., Illinois, d. .
NotesJOHN joined the Wolcott Society in 1973 as member #951, residing at La Jolla, California.
(7) Frances Williams7 (Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 6 JUN 1797 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 19 APR 1816 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut.
(7) Edward Williams7 (Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 14 JUN 1799 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 16 JAN 1805 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut.
(7) Cecilia Williams7 (Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 4 OCT 1801 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 13 MAR 1837 Chaplin, Windham Co., Connecticut.
m. 27 JUN 1827 Charles Brooks, b. 30 OCT 1795 Medford, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts, d. 7 JUL 1872 Medford, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesCHARLES was a graduate of Harvard College, and was pastor of the 3rd Congregational Church at Hingham, Massachusetts until 1839, when he became Professor of Natural History at the University of New York.
3 children: Elizabeth Alurre, Charles John, Charles Wolcott.
(8) Elizabeth Alurre Brooks8 (Cecilia Williams7, Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 25 APR 1828 Hingham, Plymouth Co., Massachusetts, d. 5 MAR 1869 Medford, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts.
NotesELIZABETH died unmarried.
(8) Charles John Brooks8 (Cecilia Williams7, Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 16 APR 1832 Hingham, Plymouth Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 JUL 1833 Hingham, Plymouth Co., Massachusetts.
(8) Charles Wolcott Brooks8 (Cecilia Williams7, Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 OCT 1833 Hingham, Plymouth Co., Massachusetts, d. 17 AUG 1885 Napa, Napa Co., California.
NotesCHARLES was Japanese consul in San Francisco, California, and author of several books, including: "Report on Japanese Vessels Wrecked in the North Pacific", and "Origin of the Chinese Race".
(7) Godfrey Williams7 (Roger Wolcott Williams6, Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 20 MAR 1804 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 5 APR 1811 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut.

(6) Mariann Williams6 (Mariann Wolcott5, Sarah Drake4, Job Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 2 NOV 1768 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 11 NOV 1819 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
m. 19 NOV 1789 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, John Noyes, b. 1757 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 11 AUG 1808 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesJOHN was a Surgeon's Mate in the 4th Massachusetts Inf. Regt in 1777, Surgeon in the 1st Connecticut Inf. Regt. in 1779, and the 4th Connecticut Inf. Regt. 1781 to 1788, and in Swift's Connecticut Regt. 1778 to 1783.

(5) Elizabeth Griswold5 (Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 31 AUG 1718 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. MAR 1788 .
m. 29 DEC 1742 Haynes Woodbridge, b. 16 OCT 1717 , d. 12 MAR 1754 .
6 children: Esther, Dorothy Lamb, Elizabeth, Mary, Susanna, Theophilus.
(6) Esther Woodbridge6 (Elizabeth Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 23 MAY 1743 , d. .
(6) Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge6 (Elizabeth Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 NOV 1745 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1792 .
m. Thomas Phelps, b. 17 JUL 1741 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 FEB 1789 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesTHOMAS enlisted 4 March 1775, as Sgt. in Capt. Abel Pettibone's Co., of Simsbury, and was discharged 31 October 1775. He re-enlisted and joined Baldwin's Artificers, and in 1777 received his commission as 2nd Lt. in Capt. James Wilcox's Co., Col. Jeduthan Baldwin's Regt. of Artificers, 24 July 1777. He served under Generals Washington, Putnam, Heath and Greene, and in 1780 was engaged in rebuilding the block house at Newgate Prison. He was a great admirer of Gen. Greene, and his fourth chlld was named after him.
4 children: William Haynes "Billy", George Augustus, Thomas Woodbridge, Anson Green.
(7) William Haynes "Billy" Phelps7 (Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge6, Elizabeth Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 AUG 1767 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Lenox, Madison Co., New York.
(7) George Augustus Phelps7 (Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge6, Elizabeth Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 12 NOV 1769 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 JUL 1778 .

(7) Anson Green Phelps7 (Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge6, Elizabeth Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 24 MAR 1781 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 NOV 1853 New York City, New York.
NotesANSON was the founder of the firm of Phelps, Dodge & Company in New York City.
m. 26 OCT 1806 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Olive Eggleston, b. 30 MAR 1785 Middletown, Middlesex Co., Connecticut, d. 24 APR 1859 New York City, New York.

(9) Olivia P. James9 (Elizabeth Woodbridge Phelps8, Anson Green Phelps7, Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge6, Elizabeth Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 13 MAY 1836 , d. .
m. Robert Hoe, b. , d. .
(8) Melissa Phelps8 (Anson Green Phelps7, Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge6, Elizabeth Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 3 MAR 1809 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 24 JUN 1828 New York City, New York, William Earle Dodge, b. 4 SEP 1805 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 9 FEB 1883 New York City, New York.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM was the junior partner of the firm of Phelps, Dodge & Co., Cliff street, organized by his father-in-law, Anson Green Phelps, and at the death of Mr. Phelps in 1853, William became the head and manager of the noted house. Under his adminsitration it sustained the character and reputation established for it by its founder. He was also representative for the eighth district in the 39th Congress.
9 children: William Earle, Anson Green Phelps, David Stuart, Charles Cleveland, Norman White, George Eggleston, Arthur Murray, Sarah Olivia, Melissa Phelps.

(6) Mary Chaffee6 (Lydia Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 28 JUL 1760 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 OCT 1846 Schenectady, Schenectady Co., New York.
m. 7 NOV 1784 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, James Hooker, b. 1768 , d. 10 DEC 1805 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: James, Horace, Henry, Dolly.
(7) James Hooker7 (Mary Chaffee6, Lydia Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1792 , d. 1858 .
(7) Horace Hooker7 (Mary Chaffee6, Lydia Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 5 JUL 1794 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 NOV 1865 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesHORACE came to Carthage, New York, from Windsor, Connecticut, in 1821, and was engaged in comercial ventures. Carthage became part of Rochester.
m. 3 SEP 1822 , Ontario Co., New York, Helen Wolcott, b. 9 MAR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 4 APR 1840 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
Spouse NotesHELEN attended Mrs. Royce's School for Girls at Hartford, as did her cousin, Ursula Wolcott.
8 children: Julia Wolcott, Henry Edward, Frances, James Wolcott, John Chaffee, Charles M., Thomas, Horace B..
(8) Julia Wolcott Hooker8 (Horace Hooker7, Mary Chaffee6, Lydia Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 11 APR 1823 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
m. 12 JUL 1844 Josiah Wolcott Bissell, b. 3 MAY 1818 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
Spouse NotesJOSIAH was engaged before the Civil War in banking, and in architectural and engineering work. During the war he was colonel of an engineer regiment attached to Gen. Pope's army, and superintended the construction of the canal that enabled the national gunboats to approach the confederate works on Island No. 10, in the Mississippi River.
6 children: Josiah Wolcott, Willard Parker, Helen Wolcott, Edward Hooker, Francis, George Perkins.
(9) Josiah Wolcott Bissell9 (Julia Wolcott Hooker8, Horace Hooker7, Mary Chaffee6, Lydia Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 1 JUN 1845 , d. .
(9) Willard Parker Bissell9 (Julia Wolcott Hooker8, Horace Hooker7, Mary Chaffee6, Lydia Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 26 AUG 1847 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 19 AUG 1878 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
m. 12 APR 1876 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, MaryB. Taylor, b. , d. .
1 children: Philip Taylor.

NotesELON was a chemist, hydrodynamic engineer, and founder of the Hooker Electrochemical Co., founded in 1909. He was a candidate for the Republican nomination for Governor of New York in 1920.

NotesALEXANDER was educated privately by his uncle Roger Viets, a priest, and was ordained a priest in 1795. He was consecrated Bishop of the Eastern Diocese, covering all New England except Connecticut, 29 May 1811 in Trinity Church, New York City, and was presiding bishop 1836-1843.

(8) Casimir Clayton Griswold8 (Ezra Griswold7, Ezra Griswold6, Elisha Griswold5, Samuel Griswold4, Hester "Esther" Drake3, Mary Wolcott2) b. 29 SEP 1834 , d. .
NotesCASIMER was a landscape artist. He moved to New York in 1850 and exhibited at the Academy of Design in 1857, and was a member of the Academy in 1867. He lived and painted in Rome 1872-1886.

These records were prepared by John B. Wolcott from the records of The Wolcott Family Society and personal and public records.
